loans.name: Wilma Yolanda

texts.es:
Wilma  es una mujer ecuatoriana de 39 años de edad, se encuentra casada y su esposo es militar activo tienen dos hijas ,  gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar sus estudios universitarios ahora Wilma  y luego  la falta de recursos económicos la llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades y poder ayudar en las necesidades de su familia, Wilma es oriunda de la ciudad de Latacunga, viven en un barrio urbano del cantón Saquisilí en casa de sus padres ,  por ende no pagan arriendo ni gasta en alimentación.
El mayor obstáculo que han tenido ha sido la falta de financiamiento para poder hacer que su negocio crezca, actualmente tiene un sueño que consiste en poner nuevamente en marcha su negocio de los pollos, actualmente ella se dedica a la comercialización de flores nacionales pero en años anteriores ya criaba pollos, aprendió  esta actividad  de sus padres.
Requiere el crédito para emprender la crianza de pollitos y comprar el alimento, esto también ayudará a que Wilma  pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y la de su familia, y la oportunidad de salir adelante. Además ella   le gustaria en un futuro que que su negocio crezca cada día más y a la vez  agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Wilma is an Ecuadorian woman of 39. She is married, and her husband is an active soldier. They have two daughters. Thanks to the efforts of her parents, she was able to finish her university studies. The lack of economic resources brought her to work from the time she was very little in order to be able to support her needs and be able to help with the needs of her family. Wilma is a native of the city of Latacunga. They live in an urban neighborhood of the Saquisili canton in the house of her parents. Thus they don't pay rent or spend for food.

The major obstacle that they have had has been the lack of financing to be able to make her business grow. She now has a dream that consists of setting up her chicken business again. She now works marketing Ecuadorian flowers, but in previous years she was already raising chickens. She learned this work from her parents.

She needs the loan to begin raising chickens and to buy the food. This will also help Wilma to be able to improve her style of living and that of her family, and [give her] the opportunity to get ahead. In addition, in the future she would like her business to grow more every day, and at the same time she is grateful to Kiva for making possible the growth of her work life and her personal life.

loans.use: to undertake her business of raising chickens; thus she will diversify her business and will grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is 54 years old and married. She has been doing a business of bangle sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore, she started her own business to contribute to the family income. Shabana has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income

loans.name: Shabiran

texts.en: Shabiran is 43 years old and married. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Shabiran’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Shabiran has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Adelio Alberto

texts.es: Don Adelio de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su sobrino quien trabaja y el ayuda economicamente, el se dedica desde hace 15 años al cultivo de maiz y cuando ya esta su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su sobrino logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, controles, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia para continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Don Adelio, who is 50 years old, lives in his own house with his nephew, who works and helps him economically. For 15 years he has been raising corn, and when it is ready, he markets his harvest in the neighboring towns. With the earnings that he obtains and the help of his nephew, they manage to pay some of the household expenses. 

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of compost, fertilizers, [pest] controls, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to continue with his crops and thus have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, [pest] controls, and improve the land

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 53 años de edad es madre soltera, por lo que habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 11 años de edad a la que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Santos es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante apoyada en su negocio de venta de elaboración y venta de pan de leche y quesadillas de arroz, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Santos ha iniciado con la construcción de su vivienda, pero por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar de construirla, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro, puertas, ventanas y mano de obra para terminar con la construcción de su vivienda, y así cumplir con su sueño de tener una vivienda propia para brindar a su familia.
texts.en:
53-year-old Santos is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her 11-year-old daughter who she is raising by her great sacrifice.

Santos is an enterprising woman who works hard every day to get ahead, supported by her business making and selling sweetbread and rice quesadillas. She has been in the business for three years, so she enjoys a large number of customers who request her products.

Santos has started the construction of her house, but due to a lack of economic resources, she hasn't been able to finish building it. She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in iron, doors, windows, and labor. Then she can finish building her house, and fulfill her dream of having her own home for her family.

loans.use: to invest in iron, doors, windows, and labor to finish building her house

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia, 40 years old, is a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband (also pictured with her) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock  of  new clothes for resale

loans.name: Kavindu

texts.en:
Kavindu is a single woman with one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetics shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions for resale

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling blankets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.  She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a collection of blankets in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a collection of blankets in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Tuliza Group

texts.fr: Isude est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Tuliza», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un électronicien, âgée de 39 ans, mère de quatre enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est propriétaire d’un magasin de divers habillements dans la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en pantalons, chemises, cartables, souliers, etc. Elle commença son business avec capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir son enfant. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Isude is a retailer who belongs to the solidarity group “Tuliza,” a client of IMF Hekima. She is thirty-nine years old, married to an electronics technician, and mother of four children who all go to school.

She has owned a clothing store in town for the past seven years. She will stock up on pants, shirts, schoolbags, and shoes. She started her business with capital received from her husband. She wants to increase her capital, send her child to school, and feed them.

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from the banking system.

loans.use: to stock up on pants, shirts, schoolbags, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Aramango que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Bagua, región Amazonas, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Nancy se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de varios años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Nancy espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in their own house made of rustic materials in the district of Aramango, which is located in the Bagua province in the Amazonas region in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district is peaceful. The people work principally in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising.

Nancy works in agriculture, specifically in raising coffee. She has a number of years of experience in this area and very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan that will be granted to her will be used in the purchase of compost and fertilizers to do appropriate maintenance on her coffee planting, as well as to hire labor for the harvest season. With this, Nancy hopes to offer coffee of better quality to her customers, which will have a positive impact on her level of income and in the end will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to do appropriate maintenance on her coffee planting

loans.name: Les Amis De La Paix Group

texts.fr: Chance est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Les Amis de la Paix», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chauffeur, âgée de 30 ans, mère d’un enfant qui étudie. Elle est propriétaire d’un magasin d’habillements dans la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en pantalons, chemises, cartables et polo. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir son enfant. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Chance is a retailer who belongs to the solidarity group “Les Amis de la Paix,” “Friends of Peace,” a client of IMF Hekima. She is thirty years old, married to a driver, and mother of one child who goes to school.

She has owned a clothing store in town for the past five years. She will stock up on pants, shirts, schoolbags, and polo shirts. She started her business with capital received from her husband. She wants to increase her capital, send her child to school, and feed them.

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from the banking system.

loans.use: to stock up on pants, shirts, schoolbags, and polo shirts.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 36 years old, married and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn a profit for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Réussite Group

texts.fr: Lumbulumbu est commerçant qui s’entraide avec sa femme, membre du groupe solidaire «Réussite», client de l’IMF Hekima, marié, âgé de 46 ans, père  de 7 enfants dont 6 étudient et 1 est encore bébé. Il est revendeur des unités de communication dans la ville depuis 10 ans. Il va s’approvisionner en 1500 unités d’appel. Il commença son business  avec le capital reçu d'un crédit. Il souhaite accroitre son chifre d'affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lumbulumbu is a retailer who works together with his wife. They belong to the solidarity group “Réussite” (“Success”), a client of IMF Hekima. He is forty-six years old, married, and a father of seven; six of the children go to school and one is still a baby.

He has retailed call units in town for the past ten years. He will stock up with 1,500 call units. He started his business with capital received from a loan. He wants to increase his sales, send his children to school, and feed them.

In conclusion, he thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from the banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 1,500 call units.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Lucia, ellas son de la ciudad de Itá, ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que se unieron para poder trabajar juntas y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por un porvenir mejor.
La Sra. Rosalina solicita de este préstamo para la compra de joyas variadas, ya que ella se dedica a este trabajo, y por medio de sus ventas ayuda a su familia, dándoles todo lo que necesita para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que pone todo de si para poder crecer y capacitarse cada día.
La Sra. Rosalina es muy sacrificada y comenta que tiene mucha esperanza en el programa, pues le permitirá seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Santa Lucia". The members are from the city of Itá. They are friends and neighbors of this city who have gotten together to work with each other and in this way be able to help their families. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight program, fighting and exerting themselves for a better future.

Rosalina is requesting this loan to buy a variety of jewellery as she devotes herself to this work. Through her sales she helps her family giving them all they need for a dignified life, lacking nothing. She is a very self-sacrificing woman and puts her all into being able to grow and learn each day.

Rosalina is very demanding and comments that she has great hope in the program as it will allow her to continue to support her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewellery for sale.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married with two children. One of the children attends school and the other is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a single mother of one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.

For over 10 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Les Amis Group

texts.fr: Collette est commerçante, vice-présidente du collectif de crédits «Les Amis», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 58 ans, mère de quatre enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes dans un marché du centre commercial depuis 18 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 150 pièces de pagnes. Elle commença son business avec  capital reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Collette is a retailer and the vice-president of the credit collective "Les Amis" ("The Friends"), a client of IMF Hekima. She is a fifty-eight year-old widow with four children; all go to school.

She has retailed "pagnes" (local dresses) at a market in the commercial area for eighteen years. She will stock up with 150 pieces of pagnes.

She started her business with capital received from her husband, when he was still alive. She wants to increase her financing capability, build a house, send her children to school, and feed them.

In conclusion, he thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from the banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 150 pagne dresses

loans.name: Kibengo Group

texts.fr: Kamundala est une couturière, commerçante, membre du collectif de crédits «Kibengo», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 35 ans, mère de cinq enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes et les habits prêts à porter dans un atelier du centre ville depuis 18 ans. Elle compte acheter une machime à coudre, des pagnes, et autres matériels de couture. Elle commença son business avec capital reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kamundala is a seamstress and retailer. She belongs to credit collective "Kibengo," a client of IMF Hekima. She is a thirty-five year-old widow and a mother of five. All her children go to school.

She has retailed local dresses and ready-to-wear clothing from a workshop in the city center for the past eighteen years. She is planning on purchasing a sewing machine, local fabric, and other sewing necessities. She started her business with capital received from her husband when he was still alive.

She wishes to increase her credit, buy a plot of land, send her children to school, and feed them.

In conclusion, he thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine, "pagnes" (local fabric), and other sewing necessities.

loans.name: Firuzahon

texts.ru: Всегда приятно, если человек занимается тем делом что приносит удовольствие. Фирузахон из Турсунзаде. Ей 42. Она замужем и мать  шестерых детей.  Детям 20, 18, 16, 14, 11 и 8 лет.  Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Фирузахон  шьет женские национальные платья на заказ в ателье. В день она успевает шить одно простое платье и одно платье с вышивкой. 6 лет назад Фирузахон начала свою работу и решила помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Ее доходы только от этой деятельности. Фирузахон хочет получить кредит для покупки электрическую швейную машинку, чтобы расширить деятельность. Она ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en: It's always nice when a person does work that makes them happy. This is Firuzahon from Tursun-zoda. She is 42, married, and a mother of six. Her children are ages 8, 11, 14, 16, 18, and 20. Her husband works in Russia because he could not find a suitable job in Tajikistan. Firuzahon sews traditional women's clothing to order. She can sew a simple dress and a dress with embroidery in one day. She started as a seamstress six years ago when she decided to help her husband support the family. This business provides her only income. Firuzahon wants to take out a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to expand her business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Behzod

texts.ru: Бехзод своеобразный, стремительный молодой человек и всегда ищет, что-то новое. Ему 32 лет. Он из города Турсунзаде. Бехзод мастер своего дела он делает ремонты в квартирах. У Бехзод среднее специальное образование. Родился в семье рабочих. Живет он со своими родителями, женой и ребенком. Бехзод просит в займы для приобретения нужных инструментов и для расширения деятельности в области ремонта квартир.  Эту работу он научился делать у отца, с которыми он сейчас работает.
texts.en: Behzod is a unique, fast-moving young man who is always looking for something new. He is 32 and comes from Tursun-zoda. Behzod is an expert at repairing apartments. He has a vocational education and was born to a working class family. He lives with his parents, wife, and children. He is requesting a loan to purchase necessary tools for his work in order to expand his business repairing apartments. He learned how to do this job from his father, with whom he works.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary for his work.

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.en: Maria Corazon lives in Solana. She is 34 years old, married and has three children. She has been a vendor for about four years now. She is selling vegetables and coconut to gain profits. She wanted to gain more profits to save funds for her family. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more coconuts and vegetables to sell. This loan will help increase her merchandise and gain good profits for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, 51, is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop. He deals in scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles and waste paper. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have an amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to get money.

Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

Yasmeen is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles and waste paper for her husband's scrap shop.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is a farmer. He toils the land and grows rice. He is a married man with 10 children. Six of his children are still attending school and are ages 7-18 years old respectively. He has been engaged in rice farming for more than 20 years.

Aside from farming, he also engages in food vending. He sells ice candy as an additional source of income.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for the laborers and his child's tuition fee. This is a very essential tool that could help improve his earnings. He could improve the yield of his farm and be able to do the expansion for the better. Thus, he could be able to provide for the needs of his family.

Anecito is doing his best to properly handle his rice farming business to become financially stable and to alleviate the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the laborers and his child's tuition fee.

loans.name: Jeferson

texts.en: Jeferson is 18 years old from Macabaclay, Bongabon, Nueva Ecija. He is taking a nine-month Microfinance Technology course. He wants to finish this course and find a job to help his parents out of poverty. His parents cannot send him to college because of their little earnings from farming. That’s why Jefferson wants to avail himself of an education loan of PHP 43,000 from the Kiva lenders to sustain his schooling.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Elvira is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell of dried fish business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 34 years old with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Juliet has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, etc.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Khai's Group

texts.en:
Khai, 48, is a married woman who has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and help her do housework. She owns a wooden house in Kampong Cham province where rice growing and cassava growing businesses are run for the main sources of family income. To make better support, she sometimes works for others for a fee for supplemental income. Khai earns about USD 12 per day and is able to save about USD 7. A decrease in the price of cassava and harvesting low outputs from the farm are the challenges to the cassava farming business.

Thus, Khai is now leading a three-member group to apply for a loan from VisionFund to support her business. The previous loan she obtained had a great impact on her family. In fact, she can afford to buy more household supplies for daily use. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to boost the farmland. She hopes she can increase income and upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to boost the farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 60 years old and married with three children. Salome works very hard to provide for them.

Salome runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Salome has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beer, and snack food.

In the future, Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 60 years old and has four children.

Judith is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Judith has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For her husband, Salma has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston and one wheel and wants to pay the labor cost to cover it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Salma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Salma thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Mali

texts.en:
Mali is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, age 56, is a mother of seven children. Her son owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her son needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to the lack of money, her son finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally.

For that reason, his mother Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her son. Her son will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Shamim is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's embroidery business.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old woman residing in Kampong Cham province, Vann is a farmer and a married mother of three children who count on her. While two of her children are in school, the remaining one is too young to attend school. Vann, along with her husband, has been growing rice for years. She is also selling some grocery items in her community to earn additional income. The challenge to farming business is the drop of the price of rice in the market.

This is the second time for Vann to request a loan from VisionFund. Her past loan helped her improve her living condition. She, the group leader, is going to use her loan to purchase organic fertilizer and organic insecticide to boost her crop's productivity. She hopes she can keep sending her children to school until they finish and have a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer and organic insecticide to boost the crop productivity.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is 42 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a married woman and has three dependent children, one of whom is still in school.

Earning around USD $10 per day, Sambath, together with her husband, has worked as a farmer growing rice and cassava for 24 years. The decrease in cassava’s price sometimes in the market is the main challenge she faces.

Anyway, this former client has already been with VisionFund for four loan cycles, and she was able to support her child’s studying and living conditions, based on the past loans.

As the leader of a group of three members, she will use her loan to improve the farmland through purchasing organic insecticide and organic fertilizer. She wants to save more money to buy sufficient school materials for her child.

loans.use: to improve the farmland through purchasing organic insecticide and organic fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adelina is 65 years old now.

She has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Adelina requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy needed materials such as nipa leaves, etc.

Adelina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy needed materials such as nipa leaves.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar is 52 years old, married and has nine children, four of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Elmar requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elmar has been farming rice for 10 years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elmar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three sons and one daughter. Her children are doing their studies. Her husband has been running his own business selling garments for six years. Her husband is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of garments in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore, Noreen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Noreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's garment business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is in her late 30s and is married with one child who is still in school. She has been selling clothes for five years now. She works from 8am to 8:30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hawa's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing her stock of clothes and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is really doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, buy a plot of land, build her house, buy a motorcycle and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date styles of clothes to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of buying a car.

Hawa will make sure she pays back her loan within the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date styles of clothes to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 42 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

Merlita has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Tessie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aqdan

texts.en: Aqdan is a 59-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so her son is unable to generate any amount of income. Her son wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her son finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Aqdan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Aqdan is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son to repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Azhra is the age of 40 and married. She is living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for all the household expenses; he is providing sheltering services along with his team. He has been doing this as a worker, and now he wants to start his own business. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, he is unable to buy sheltering material of his own.

Therefore, Azhra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so her husband will be able to buy sheltering material such as bamboo, planks and wooden boards

Azhra thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, planks and wooden boards for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Mernita

texts.en:
Mernita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a weaving of bamboo business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

Mernita has been in this business for four years and earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Ye's Group

texts.en:
At her age of 38 years, Ye, who is a resident of Kampong Cham province, is married and has four dependent children to take care of, two of whom are in school and the youngest one who is under the age of school. The main sources of family income come from the rice and cassava growing businesses which she has been involved in for twenty years. Farming businesses earn her about USD 9 per day and she can save approximately USD 5 for future needs. The challenge that Ye mostly faces is when the cassava crop is destroyed by insect pests, which results in getting lower yields.

This will be Ye’s fifth time with VisionFund. Based on the past loans she got, she could manage it well to make her businesses grow smoothly. Ye, who is the leader of the three-member group, will spend her loan on purchasing organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to support her cassava farming business. She hopes that she can meet her family’s needs in a timely manner and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to support her cassava farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and lives together with her husband and one child. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the school fees for her kids.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
Sokhim, at the age of 27 years, is a resident of Tbaung Khmum district. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school, and the other who is too young for schooling. Sokhim and her husband work as paid workers on a rubber field, harvesting latex from rubber trees. They have recently earned lower pay because the rubber trees have not been producing good outputs. This is the challenge for her family’s income. 

Sokhim is now leading a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Sokhim will use her loan to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to work. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to live conveniently, especially if she can take children her children to school on time.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting from home to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years, and earns more income from pig fattening. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. 

Rosa is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruit to sell for her fruit vending business. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is married with children who are attending school. He works in the photography studio and photocopying business.

Fred meets his family's needs with the income he receives from these businesses. However, his studio equipment is becoming outdated, and he does not have the money he needs to buy new equipment. Fred is requesting money to buy new cameras with better functionalities so that he can win more customers and compete on the market.

loans.use: to buy new cameras.

loans.name: Nuevo Fraternidad Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Nuevo Fraternidad está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, lo coordina doña Sonia de 52 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, ella es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace diez años, con ayuda de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente, solicita el financiamiento por cuarta vez para la compra de arroz, azúcar, huevo, aceite, camisas y pantalones. Uno de sus proyectos es hacer mejoras en la vivienda y con las ganancias del crédito anterior logro comprar un zinc para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, la segunda socia es doña Maritza de 50 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y frescos, la tercer socia es doña Ana de 55 años quien se dedica a la costura.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Fraternidad solidarity group is made up of three enterprising women. It is coordinated by Sonia, who is 52 years old, in a relationship and mother to two children.
She has been the owner of a local convenience store for the last ten years with the help of her husband, who supports her economically. She is asking for a loan for the fourth time to buy rice, sugar, eggs, oil, shirts and trousers.
One of her projects is to make improvements to her home and with the profits from her previous loan she managed to buy some tin to improve the roof of her house.
The second member is Maritza, who is 50 years old and works selling cosmetics and fresh food, and the third member is Ana, who is 55 and works in dressmaking.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, oil, shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Flor De Jazmin Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Flor de Jazmín está conformado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras quienes trabajan fuertemente para sacar adelante sus negocios, lo coordina Virginia una joven emprendedora de 28 años acompañada y madre de tres niños, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante desde hace cinco años, solicita por segunda vez el financiamiento de los socios de Kiva porque desea invertir en la compra de camisas, pantalones, vestidos y trajecitos de niños, con las ganancias obtenidas con los créditos anteriores logro comprar una refrigeradora y su nuevo proyecto es tener su propio tramo en uno de los mercados del país, la segunda socia es Virginia de 21 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, la tercer socia es María de 37 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería, la cuarta socia es Fanny de 24 años quien se dedica a la venta de Elote.
texts.en:
The Flor de Jazmín solidarity group is made up of four enterprising women who work hard to get ahead with their businesses. It is coordinated by Virginia, who is a young entrepreneur at 28 years old, married and mother to three children. She has worked selling clothing door to door for five years, and she is asking for a loan from Kiva's members for the second time because she wants to invest in shirts, trousers, dresses and children's clothing. With the profits obtained from previous loans she managed to buy a fridge and her new goal is to have her own section in one of the country's markets.
The second member is Virginia, who is 21 years old and sells second-hand clothing, the third is María, who is 37 years old and the owner of a local convenience store, and the fourth member is Fanny, who is 24 years old and sells corn on the cob.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, dresses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem owns two cars that he rents to taxi drivers in the town of Kapan, in the region of Syunik.
He receives a percentage of the profit from the two cars, and as owner is responsible for keeping them in working condition.

He has applied for this loan to purchase notebooks, calculators and new tires so he will be able to improve the service provided to customers.

Artem has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisions providing business loans with soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Artem, so that he is able to satisfy his workers' needs and provide better living conditions for his family. Artem lives with his wife and two children, aged 14 and 16 years old.

loans.use: to pay for notebooks, calculators and new tires.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en août 2015,rassemble des membres qui habitent la même commune et ont comme activité le commerce et l'élevage.

Mariame qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 49 ans et mére de 06 enfants dont 01 fille.

Son activité est le commerce de bétail,elle achéte des moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires,puis les engraissent avant de les revendre.

Avec le prêt,elle va  acheter un mouton à 40000f et de la paille pour une valeur de 10000f.

Le bénéfice servira à aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et faire face aux frais de santé pour la famille.
texts.en:
This group, which was set up in August 2015, is made up of members who live in the same commune and either have small trading businesses or raise animals.

Mariame, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 49 years old, married, and mother to six children, including one girl. She has a livestock trading business buying sheep at the weekly markets then fattening them up before reselling them. With this loan she is going to buy a sheep for 40,000 francs and straw for 10,000 francs.

The profits she makes will be used to help her husband with the daily outgoings and cover the family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sheep.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en août 2015 réunit les membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le commerce.

Hassanatou qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 45 ans,est mariée et mére de 07 enfants dont 06 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de pâte d'arachide,d'huile de palme et d'oignons.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 03 sceaux de pâtes d'arachide pour une valeur de 13000f,01 sac d'oignon à 7750f,01 bidon de 20l d'huile de palme à 14000f.

le bénéfice servira à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group, which was set up in August 2015, comprises members who all live in the same village and run small trading activities. Hassanatou, who is on the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 45 years old and mother to seven children, six of whom are girls.

She buys and sells groundnut paste, palm oil and onions. With her loan she is planning to buy three buckets of groundnut paste for 13,000 francs, a sack of onions for 7,750 francs and a 20 liter container of palm oil for 14,000 francs. The profits she makes will be used to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy onions, groundnut paste and palm oil.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis joven ecuatoriano de 25 años de edad, es un muchacho muy emprendedor y trabajador ha trabajado junto a sus padres en la crianza de animales menores y ganado vacuno, hoy en día Luis tiene su propia microempresa, la misma que se trata de la crianza y venta de cerdos de raza. Es el segundo crédito que solicita en este año lo que evidencia su progreso y sus ganas de seguir esforzándose para en un futuro tener su propia familia.
Hoy en día Luis está solicitando el crédito que será utilizado para la compra de dos madres cerdas reproductoras adicionales, esto ayudará a incrementar sus gananacias debido a que sus ventas en los últimos meses han crecido, de esta manera crecerá la utilidad y por ende tendrán un mejor estilo de vida, es por esto que Luis agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida familiar y personal.
texts.en:
Luis, a 25 year old Ecuadorian, is a very enterprising and hard-working young man. He has worked alongside his parents, raising small animals and bovine cattle. These days he has his own small business, which also involves raising and selling pure-bred pigs.
This is the second loan he has asked for this year, which proves his progress and his desire to continue making an effort so that in the future he can have his own family. He is asking for a loan which will be used to buy two additional breeding female pigs, which will help to increase his profits thanks to which his sales in the last few months have increased. In this way he will increase his earnings and therefore have a better lifestyle. For this reason, Luis thanks Kiva for making the growth of his family and personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a breeding female pig which will help him to increase his profits.

loans.name: Maimouna Daouda's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis le 15 Juillet 2008, les membres du groupe ont une bonne connaissance du déroulement du programme bancs villageois. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme  activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maimouna, (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Âgée de  22 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de thé, de sucre et d’autres condiments qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter 01 sac de sucre à 20000f; 05 cartons de thé à 37500f et des condiments d’une valeur de 17500f pour le revendre en détail. 

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille ; de s’occuper de ses enfants et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
This group was set up on 15th July 2008 and the group members have a good knowledge of how the Banc Villageois program works. There is solidarity and cooperation between all the members. Their principal activity is running small trading businesses.

Maimouna (who is sitting on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 22 years old, married and mother to three children. She sells tea, sugar and other condiments, which she buys at the weekly markets. With her new loan she would like to buy a sack of sugar for 20,000 francs, five cartons of tea at 37,000 francs and condiments for a value of 17,500 francs to resell on a retail basis. The profits she makes will enable her to contribute to her family's daily outgoings, to take care of her children and boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar for 20,000 francs, five cartons of tea for 37,500 francs and condiments to the value of 17,500 francs to retail.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Triunfadoras está conformado por tres microempresarias emprendedoras, está coordinado por Karla una mujer laboriosa de 30 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos niños. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos hace tres años con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a distribuir las mercancías, solicita por primera vez el financiamiento en la institución porque desea invertir en la copra de blusas, pantalones cremas, lociones y perfumes, una de sus metas es hacer crecer su negocio, la segunda socia es Virginia de 41 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y nacatamales, la tercer socia es Yuri de 27 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Triunfadoras solidarity group is made up of three enterprising small business owners. It is coordinated by Karla, who is a hard-working, 30 year old woman who is married and mother to two children. She has worked selling clothing and cosmetics for three years with the support of her husband who helps her to distribute her merchandise. She is asking for a loan for the first time because she wants to invest in blouses, cream-colored trousers, lotions and perfumes. One of her goals is to grow her business.
The second member is Virginia, who is 41 years old and sells cosmetics and 'nacatamales' (corn, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaves), and the third is Yuri, who is 27 years old and sells cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy blouses, cream-colored trousers, lotions and perfumes

loans.name: Aguila Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Águila lo conforman dos mujeres exitosas y un hombre emprendedor; coordinado por María una mujer laboriosa de 27 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, ella emprendió su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos hace cuatro años con apoyo económico de su esposo y apoyo de sus familiares que le envían mercadería del extranjero para que ella pueda comercializarla en el país, solicita por segunda vez el financiamiento de la institución para la compra de blusas, vestidos, chores, perfumes y zapatos, María con los créditos anteriores logro aumentar la oferta de mercadería, y comprar un televisión. El  segundo socio es Marcio de 27 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y la tercer socia es doña Otilia quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y piñatas
texts.en:
The Águila solidarity group is made up of two successful women and an enterprising man. It is coordinated by María, who is a hard-working 27 year old woman, married with three children. She launched her business selling clothing and cosmetics four years ago with the financial support of her husband and help from her relatives, who sent her merchandise from abroad for her to sell in the country.
She is asking for a loan for the second time to buy blouses, dresses, shorts, perfumes and shoes. With the previous loan, María managed to increased her offering of merchandise and buy a television.
The second member is Marcio, who is 27 years old and sells cosmetics, and the third is Otilia, who works selling cosmetics and piñatas.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, shorts, perfumes and shoes.

loans.name: Aissata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en août 2015,réunit des membres qui habitent le même quartier et ont comme activité le commerce.

Bintou qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 33 ans ,est mariée et mére de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon.

Son activité est la vente de fruits,elle s'approvisionne au marché central pour aller revendre dans sa localité.

Le crédit servira à l'achat de bananes,orange,mangues.*

Le bénéfice servira à la nourriture,aux frais sanitaires de ses enfants et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group, which was set up in August 2015, is made up of members who live in the same district and who all have small trading activities.

Bintou, who is on the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 33 years old, married and mother to two children, one of whom is a boy. She has an activity selling fruit and gets her supplies at the central market to resell in her town. Her loan will be used to buy bananas, oranges and mangoes. The profit she makes will be used to buy food, as well as to cover her children's health costs and schooling.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Edmon

texts.en:
Edmon is single. He operates a restaurant, rears goats and also does farming. Through these sources, Edmon has been able to save and buy land. Recently, he saw more land to buy which is strategically positioned for building commercial houses, considering it is on the outskirts of the town. He desires to have it badly, but the challenge is that he doesn't have enough money on hand to buy it.

Edmon is requesting a loan to buy land and pay back the loan in installments afterward.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Soarimely

texts.fr:
Soarimely est une femme paysanne dynamique de 37 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants à la campagne. Avec son mari, elle exerce toute sorte de culture et d’élevage. 
Cela fait maintenant 3 ans qu’elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra. Ce qui lui a permis d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et de construire une maison familiale. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 2 zébus qu’elle va engraisser et vendre au boucher. Elle va aussi cultiver de la pomme de terre et donc acheter des semences et des engrais, des fongicides et des pesticides.
Soarimely espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices avec ce prêt et pense être autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
Soarimely is a dynamic peasant who is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in the countryside. Together with her husband she practises all sorts of farming and animal raising. She has been borrowing from Vahatra for the past three years, and this has allowed her to provide for her children's schooling and build a family house.

With this loan she is planning to buy two zebus which she is going to fatten up and sell to the butcher. She is also going to grow potatoes and thus buy seeds and fertilizer, fungicides and pesticides.

Soarimely hopes to make a lot of money thanks to this loan and thinks she will become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy two zebus to fatten up, as well as seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Nipagagnon Group

texts.fr: Portant  la main sur le mouton, Kadia  est  une femme âgée de 55 ans ; elle réside au mali Très respecté dans son environnement, elle vit avec son mari cultivateur de son état et ses 5 enfants âgés de 13 à 26 ans dont 2 écoliers. Dans l’avenir elle veut rebâtir sa concession  pour que ses enfants puissent avoir une meilleure condition de vie  Elle fait recours au RMCR pour l’achat de ses animaux et le  financement de ses petits activités qu’elle pratique depuis douze ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et vend ses produits dans les mêmes marchés Malgré quelque petites difficultés liée souvent  aux prix du marché, elle se réjouit du fait qu’elle arrive à satisfaire ses dépenses en habillement et  des frais scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en:
Kadia, who has her hand on the sheep in the photo, is a 55-year old woman; she lives in Mali. She is very highly respected in her area and lives with her husband, who is a farmer by trade, and her five children, whose ages range between 13 and 26 years old; two of the children are at school. In the future she would likes to rebuild her business so her children can have a better quality of life.

She is turning to RCMR to buy animals and finance the small activities she has been carrying out for the past 12 years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding markets and sells her products in the same markets. Despite small problems, often related to market prices, she is happy she can manage to cover the cost of her children's clothing and school fees.

loans.use: to buy animals for resale.

loans.name: Santhiaba Rural Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie du groupe a été inauguré le 09 juillet 2002; C'est un groupe composé de seize femmes qui s’entraident mutuellement. Madame Haby Mama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 55 ans et mère de sept enfants dont cinq filles. Depuis quatre ans elle s'active dans la vente de l'encens, du lait et du thiakry. Elle va renforcer son activité avec le prêt sollicité. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: The Banc Villageois to which this group belongs was inaugurated on 9th July 2002. The group is made up of 16 women who help each other out. Huby Mama, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 55 years old and mother to seven children, five of whom are girls. For the past four years she has been selling incense, milk and thiakry (a sweet millet cousous dish). She is going to build up her activity with the loan she is requesting. Her profits will be used to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy incense, milk and thiakry (a sweet millet couscous dish).

loans.name: Santhiaba Rural Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 09 juillet 2002. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce. Madame Véronique qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 61 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre garçons. Depuis plus de cinq ans elle s'active dans la vente de chaussures et d'habits. Le prêt sollicité va servir à renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: The Banc Villageois was set up on 9th July 2002 and this group is made up of 20 women who have trading activities. Véronique, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 61 years old and mother to five children, four of whom are boys. She has been selling shoes and clothes for more than five years, and the loan she has requested will be used to boost her business. The profits she makes will be used to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Dambé

texts.fr: Dambé est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avec six enfants à charge, Dambé est une revendeuse d’ignames frit qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Dambé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des calebasses d’ignames. Dambé désire gagner  plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide à son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées dans le foyer.
texts.en: Dambé is a married woman who is 37 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She has six children in her care. Dambé sells fried yams and gets her supplies twice a month from the market and sells them in front of her home. She is requesting this loan so she can order calabashes of yams. She would like to make more profit so she can help out her husband with the household's various daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy four calabashes of yams.

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en:
Jameeleh is 37 years old. She is a mother of four children. Actually as all mothers, she wants to provide a high quality life for her children and she is working hard to do that. Therefore she wants to use her free time for something useful, so she decided to be a productive woman and help her husband with the expenses of her children.

She started to sell household supplies. When she felt that she was working well and she got a good income from this work, she decided to expand her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help develop her work and buy more kinds of products to sell to increase her income.

loans.use: to develop her work and buy more kinds of products to sell.

loans.name: Josée

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Josée est une femme âgée de 39 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Josée est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Josée sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de tomates, de spaghettis et des sacs de riz en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Josée, who is married and mother to three children, is 39 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She sells general grocery products and buys her goods twice a month at the market to resell in her shop which is at home. Josée is requesting this loan so she can order cartons of tomatoes, spaghetti and sacks of rice and stock a larger quantity of goods. This will enable her to maximise her profit and help her husband with the children's schooling and the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy seven cartons of tomatoes, five sacks of rice and ten cartons of spaghetti.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses by machine in a nearby town. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work for daily wages.

Nowadays, he newly appointed a worker but does not have a spare machine for embroidery. He wants to buy new embroidery machine but does not have enough cash in hand.

Therefore, Sumaira made this humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan her husband would be able to buy new embroidery machine and some additional stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and stock of  threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia lives in Atsabe and she is a business woman. She has been involving in business activities for a few years with her own working capital and she does her best with it.

She has a very high interest in doing business. She has a small store and she hopes to open a bigger store but her capital is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $ 800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She will used this loan to buy more additional items to keep in her store including detergents, dishes, pots for water and other things to sell. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy detergents, dishes, pots for water and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anna Grace

texts.en:
Anna Grace is requesting a loan of UGX 1,600,000 to pay tuition for child at the university. She is 56 years old and is married with five children and four dependants, all under her care.

She is currently working as a police officer in the Uganda police force where she earns a salary. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with her family.

She hopes to educate her children plus providing basic needs for them through hard work but faces a challenge of low pay. As a result she decided to start cocoa growing in the year 2005 where she gets additional income after selling to cocoa associations.

loans.use: to pay  tuition for her child at university.

loans.name: Geresemu

texts.en:
Geresemu, an innovative man, is married with 2 children aged 3 and 2 years living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He established a shop offering mobile money transfer services, selling airtime, phones and accessories, in order to raise income to cater for the daily needs of his family.

His business is situated along a busy street lane where customers have easy access. He has supplemented his income with farming of crops like orange, irish potatoes and beans from which he sells the surplus.

Geresemu is requesting the loan to expand and improve his orange plantation for commercial purposes.

loans.use: to expand and improve his orange plantation for commercial purposes.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with three children; two are attending school. She is currently working as a nursing officer at the district hospital in Bundibugyo, Uganda where she earns monthly salary for her family upkeep.

She hopes to educate her children plus provide basic needs for them. She is a hardworking lady but faces a challenge of low pay.

As a result she decided to start cocoa growing where she gets additional income after harvest. Oliver has requested for a loan to pay school fees for her children for the third term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old, married and has ten children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to pay laborers salaries and to rent a truck.

Francisca has been farming sugarcane for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay salaries for laborers and rent a truck.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 55 years old and married with nine children. With two children in school, Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Angelita has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a married family man with children. He operates a boutique and also does farming. Through that, he has been able to build a commercial house.

Semu's greatest desire is to educate his children to higher levels of learning. Semu has realized a need in his shop and that is clothing wrappers commonly known as Bitenge from Congo which are in high demand in his area.

Unfortunately Semu has just stocked other clothes and at the moment he has no money to buy those specific clothes. He is now requesting a loan to buy Bitenge clothes to sell, so that he is able to raise his income levels.

loans.use: to buy Bitenge clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Edwige est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Mère de cinq enfants, Edwige est une marchande des céréales qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile à ses clients potentiels pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des bols de maïs,  Edwige sollicite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en:
Edwige is thirty-three years old, married and mother to five children. She lives in Tokoin and sells cereals. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and sells her products from her home.

Edwige has requested this loan to improve her stock levels and increase her profit margin. This will enable her to provide for the needs of her family and pay for schooling for her children during the coming school year.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of maize.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is 58 years old and married. She has eight children, three of whom depend on her. She and her family reside in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province where they have run their rice growing business on a hectare area of farmland for 38 years. To make additional income, Pov and her husband sometimes work for others for a fee. Rice are chewed and destroyed severely by pest insects; these are the obstacles to harvest good outputs from their rice farm.

This is the second loan cycle for Pov from VisionFund. Her previous loan has enabled her to improve the farmland and income and provide better support to her family.

As the leader of a three-member group, Pov will use her entire loan portion to purchase organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. She hopes that she can save more money for future needs and to support her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so as to better meet family needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en:
Terezinha has been involved in business activity since 2004, with her own working capital of $ 1,000. She is married and she has no children.

She is an entrepreneur and her business is selling cows. Her husband is involved in agriculture, so her husband was very supportive in selling the cows.

So now she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to their capital to buy more cows, because she wants to change her business and make it big. She was very happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin, because she can increase her income in the future.

She also cultivates cows, buffalo, goats, chickens and pigs in her place.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Judith est une femme célibataire qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 39 ans, Judith vend des articles de mercerie dans son atelier de couture à  domicile. Judith s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Judith sollicite ce prêt pour commander des doublures et fil. Avec la marge  bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Judith va pouvoir promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de son enfant et subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Judith is thirty-nine years old, single and mother to one child. She lives in Tokoin and sells sewing supplies from the workshop in her home. Once a month she buys new supplies from the market.

Judith has requested this loan to buy lining material and sewing thread. The profits that she will make, will be used to pay for schooling for her child and provide for their day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to buy 9 rolls of lining material and 60 packets of sewing thread.

loans.name: Berthine

texts.fr:
Berthine est une femme travailleuse et dynamique de 54 ans. Elle est marié et celui-ci travaille avec elle dans l'exercice de son activité à part l'élevage et la culture. Ils ont ensemble trois enfants qui sont déjà grands et autonomes actuellement.
Berthine confectionne et vend des jupons depuis très long temps. Elle démarrait cette activité en 1998. C'était avec cette activité qu'elle a pu faire réussir ses enfants et bien sur avec l'aide de son mari. 
Elle voudrait, de ce fait, encore développer et améliorer cette activité, elle désire acquérir une machine industrielle plus tard. Mais, cette fois, le prêt va lui permettre de renforcer le fonds de roulement, car elle va acheter des matières premières supplémentaires avec.
texts.en:
Berthine is a hard-working, dynamic, fifty-four year old woman. Her husband works with her in her business (but not with her vegetable growing and livestock rearing). Together they have three grown-up, independent children.

Berthine has been making and selling skirts for a long time, she began her business in 1998. Thanks to her business, and the help of her husband, she has been able to raise her children and help them become successful.

Berthine would like to improve her business further, and in the future buy an industrial sewing machine. This loan will increase her working capital and buy extra raw materials.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, elastic and sewing thread.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.en:
Buenaventura is 36 years old, married and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business raising goats in the Philippines. Buenaventura requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goats to raise.

Buenaventura has been raising goats for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Buenaventura would like to save enough to sustain the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to raise.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
