Marife is a woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marife is 36 years old now.

Marife has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marife has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 45 years old and married. She has six children, two of whom are in school. Ma. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, coffee, eggs, milk, etc.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, coffee, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 61 years old, married with children.

Eva is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eva has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mengil

texts.en:
Mengil is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling used clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mengil dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 38 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, junk foods, home prouct care, and other groceries to stock her store.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk foods, home prouct care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 38 years old, maried and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Abla  Victoire

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Abla est âgée de 33 ans et  s’active énormément pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Abla est une marchande de pagnes et des basins qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de basins riches et moins riches afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Abla is thirty-three years old, married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Tokoin. She is a dynamic woman who works hard to improve her financial position.

Abla sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and damask fabric. Twice a month she buys new supplies from the market and sells them from her home and in the surrounding area.

To help her achieve her goals, Abla has requested this loan. She will buy pieces of rich damask fabric and pieces of standard damask fabric to meet the demands of her customers. She has a remarkable level of financial autonomy and this will be used to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 pieces of rich damask fabric and 13 pieces of standard damask fabric.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been looking into biogas for a long time. She could see how important it would be for her elderly mother, who she shares a compound, to have a clean fuel to cook over. Takamoto Biogas made biogas affordable for her household.
Her son passed away recently and she feels most proud of her ability to cope with that loss and continue to run her successful dairy farm. Please help her fulfil her dream of getting a biogas system.

loans.use: To buy a biodigester for clean and smoke-free cooking for her family

loans.name: Balaoglan

texts.en: Balaoglan is 27 years old. He wife is a housewife and they have no children at this point. Balaoglan is an IDP (internally displaced persons) fom Füzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region with his family.  Balaoglan has been in the animal breeding business for a year. He wants to improve this new business. Balaoglan has applied to Komak for a loan. He needs his first loan in the amount of 1700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to build a small stall for his cows. He says he is very thankful to Kiva and their lenders for the help.

loans.use: to build a small stall for his cows.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Evangeline has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.
For over two years, Zainabu has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past three years, she has operated a sold clothing, selling at the market neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation and theft in her business. In addition she also sells utensils that earns her another source of income.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000 she wants to purchase a stock of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married mother of one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Atsabe and her business is printing. She lives near many people and in her place she is the only one who opened this business. She has an idea to improve her business for everybody so that if they want to print a document, it will not be far away.

She opened her business this year, but she is earning a good income every day because many people come to print a document in her rented space so she is very happy with her business.

Now she is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger rented space in the future. She started to open her business in 2015 with her own working capital of $ 1,500.

She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy papers, ink, ink color, paper volumes and other materials to use. She hopes with this loan, her business can improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy HVS ink, ink color, paper volumes, repair her computer and get other materials to use.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. Fro the past many days his rickshaw is not in proper working order and because of this her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband´s rickshaw.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée, Kossiwa a à sa charge trois enfants. Kossiwa est âgée de 44 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle vend  des produits alimentaires. Kossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des cartons de tomates, des paniers de piment et le tas d’oignons afin de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir soutenir aux besoins de sa famille  puis améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is forty-four years old, married and responsible for three children. She lives in Tokoin and sells food products. She buys new supplies twice a month from the market and makes her sales from a stall at her home.

Kossiwa has requested this loan to buy boxes of tomatoes, baskets of chillies and onions. Her profits will be used to meet the needs of her family and improve their day-to-day living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of tomatoes, 1 quantity of onions and 5 baskets of chillies.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark's welding shop gives him an income of about $500/month for a family of nine members.

It needs some upgrading and your loan will help him achieve that.

loans.use: to do some repairs to his welding shop.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a single woman with no children. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and rent.

For the past six months she has operated a sold clothing, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000 she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale

loans.name: Mbolatiana

texts.fr:
Mbolatiana est une femme débrouillarde et travailleuse de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et les deux époux travaillent ensemble et mutuellement dans l'exercice de l'activité génératrice de revenu de la famille. 
Mbolatiana confectionne des séries de vêtements et c'est son mari lui-même qui assure la vente. Elle commençait à coudre en 2010. Auparavant, elle ne faisait que l'achat et revente des vêtements prêts à porter. Elle demandait un prêt auprès de CEFOR pour l'achat d'une machine à coudre.
La vente est presque en gros parce que la plupart des clients sont des revendeurs en provinces et aux campagnes.
texts.en:
Mbolatiana is thirty-two years old, married and very hardworking. She and her husband work together to earn a living for their family. Mbolatiana makes a range of clothing and her husband is responsible for sales. They began their business in 2010. Until that time, she had been buying and selling ready made clothes. Then she requested a loan from the field partner, CEFOR, to buy a sewing machine.

Most of Mbolatiana's sales are on a wholesale basis as the majority of her customers are retailers from the countryside.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing thread.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for the last 20 years. Her husband is responsible and fulfils the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it is requiring maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to perform the needed maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Saima has applied to Kiva for a loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Saima's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. This will allow him to provide better transport services to earn income. Saima also plans to save some of the profits to meet her family's needs in future.
Saima is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs to her husband´s taxi.

loans.name: Sitrakiniaina

texts.fr:
Sitrakiniaina est une jeune femme travailleuse de 22 ans. Elle est mariée et il est agent de sécurité salarié. Ils ont ensemble un petit enfant de 4 ans, déjà scolarisé dans une école privée.
Sitrakiniaina fabrique des caca-pigeons et chips. Elle a démarré son propre affaire en 2011. Elle a déjà travaillé dans ce domaine avec ses parents auparavant. Ce sont ces derniers qui lui ont appris le métier. Elle a déjà beaucoup de clients mais ça ne l'empêche pas d'en chercher d'autres. 
Son objectif en ce moment est d'épargner davantage afin de pouvoir construire un jour sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Sitrakiniaina is twenty-two years old, married to a paid security agent and a hardworking woman. She and her husband have a four-year-old child who attends a private school.

Sitrakiniaina makes 'caca-pigeons' (local snacks) and chips. She began her business in 2011 but had already worked in this area with her parents. It was her parents who taught her the business. She has many customers but is always looking for more. Her current goal is to save enough money that she is able to build her own home one day.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, flour, table oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Natanaela

texts.fr:
Natanaela est un exemple d'un bon père et d'un bon mari. Il a 25 ans et très fier de son bébé et de sa femme. C'est un père débrouillard et travailleur. 
Il dirige un taxi-phone et vend des accessoires téléphoniques depuis 2012. Auparavant, il ne faisait que livrer chez des petits magasins des recharges. Grâce à ses esprits de perfectionniste et de professionnalisme, il ne cesse pas de chercher toujours à améliorer son affaire. 
Sa priorité dans la vie est la réussite de sa famille, actuellement il n'a qu'un enfant de 12 mois. Son objectif est de pouvoir lui offrir une meilleure condition de vie, construire sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
Natanaela is a fine example of a good husband and father. He is twenty-five years old and very proud of his wife and their twelve-month-old baby. He is hardworking and self reliant.

Natanaela has been running a taxi-phone (a mobile phone service) and selling phone accessories since 2013. Before then, he was a recharge delivery man. Thanks to his professionalism and perfectionism he has managed to continually improve his business.

Natanaela's priority in life is the success of his family. He wants to be able to offer them better living conditions and, one day, build his own home.

loans.use: to buy accessories - batteries, chargers, headphones, memory cards and phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Marie Ernestine

texts.fr:
Marie Ernestine est une mère travailleuse, exemple de force et de courage. Elle a 39 ans. Elle a un enfant de 4 ans et trois petits sœurs et frère à sa charge. Elle est marié, mais le problème est que celui-ci n'a pas de travail stable.
Elle était marchande des produits agricoles surtout des cultures maraîchères mais depuis 2011, elle dirige un magasin de quincaillerie. A causes des charges lui affligeant, elle doit travailler dur et bien choisir l'activité plus intéressante et plus bénéfique. Son objectif est de pouvoir construire un jour sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Marie Ernestine is a hardworking woman who is very courageous. She is thirty-nine years old, married and has a four-year-old child. She is also responsible for three younger sisters and a younger brother. Her husband doesn't have a stable job. Marie Ernestine used to sell agricultural products, particularly for vegetable growing. Since 2011 she has been running a hardware store. She has to work very hard to make enough to pay all the expenses of her family.

One day, she would like to be able to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy hardware products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy extra vegetables.

loans.name: Mercedes Yamileth

texts.es: Mercedes de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace varios años, posee una pequeña tienda con la cual puede salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mercedes is 34-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. For several years, she has owned a small store with which she can get ahead with her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc. This way she can get a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 11 años y con lo que obtiene de sus trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo un muro de contension pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion para realizar el muro y asi tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Pedro is 39-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has worked in artesanal fisheries for 11 years and with what he gets from his job, he manages to resolve some household expenses. He wants to improve his home by building a contention wall, but because he does not have enough money, he is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to build a wall and have a safer home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 47-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has worked selling personal products for 10 years. Her business is located in her home and she also sells on the street in different communities. With what she gains from her sales, she manages to resolve some of her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy perfume, lotion, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. at wholesale prices. This way she can continue with her work to get a better income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotion, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. at wholesale prices.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural. Ella solicita un préstamo de quinientos setenta mil colones (₡ 570 000), para la compra de diversos productos, esto con el fin de incrementar su volumen de inventario y poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Luisa makes a living selling natural medicine products.

She is requesting a loan of 570,000 CRC [$1075 USD] so that she can buy various products to expand her inventory and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine products for resale.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es: Magnolia es una emprendedora mujer de 54 años de edad que reside en Madrid un municipio de Cundinamarca y en esta misma localidad en compañía de su cónyuge funciona su venta de comidas rápidas, idea de negocio que surgió por la iniciativa de su cónyuge quien consideró que había un gran potencial en el sector. Cuentan con tres años de funcionamiento en un kiosco y sus clientes en su gran mayoría son transeúntes del lugar, a quienes empieza a atender de lunes a sábado a partir de las 7 a.m. en horario extendido hasta las 7:30 p.m. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la ampliación de su kiosco porque el espacio le es insuficiente para tener las estanterías con productos empacados y demás enseres. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir volúmenes y manejar mejores precios. Su meta a futuro es continuar haciéndole mejorar a su negocio y velar para que su hija termine la universidad.
texts.en:
Magnolia is a 54-year old entrepreneurial woman who lives in Madrid, a town of Cundinamarca. In this same place, in her partner's company, she operates her sale of fast food. This business idea arose from the initiative of her partner who thought that there was a great potential in the area. They have been running the kiosk for 3 years and the customers are mostly pedestrians of the area. They serve customers from Monday to Saturday, starting at 7 AM until 7:30 PM.

Now, she is applying for her first Credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in expanding her kiosk because the space is insufficient to have the shelves with packed goods and other equipment. With this investment, she will be able to get volume and manage better prices. Her future goal is to continue making her business better and making sure her daughter finishes college.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her kiosk.

loans.name: Blanca Susana

texts.es:
Blanca Guanoluisa es una mujer de 21 años soltera que vive con sus padres durante 12 años en el barrio  Potrerillos en la Parroquia Belisario Quevedo ciudad de Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi este barrio es característico por la gente honesta y trabajadora. Es el segundo crédito de Blanca lo que hace afianzar su actitud luchadora. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva durante 5 años por esta razón tiene convenios con el Gobierno. Solicita su crédito para comprar más materia prima como telas y cierres de nylon para la confección de ropa deportiva que le ayudará a incrementar sus ganancias y facilitar su trabajo ya que este oficio requiere de muchas horas para obtener un producto de calidad.  
Blanca agradece a KIVA por confiar nuevamente en ella y por hacer posible cumplir su sueño y salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 21-year old woman. She is single and has lived with her parents for 12 years in the Potrerillos neighborhood in the Belisario Quevedo Parish, city of Latacunga and Cotopaxi province. This neighborhood is characterized by its honest and hard-working people. This is the 2nd loan that Blanca has asked for which strengthens her fighting attitude.

She has worked making activewear for 5 years and has agreements with the government. She is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials such as fabric and zippers to make activewear. This will help her to increase her earnings and ease her work because this job requires many hours to get a quality product.

Blanca thanks Kiva for believing in her again and for making it possible for her dream to come true and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as activewear fabric and nylon zippers to keep increasing her production.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hija, ella se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta de medicina popular y otros productos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 35-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three daughters. She has worked for 9 years in selling popular medicine and other products. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers from the quality of her products and the good prices. She is asking for a new loan to buy more popular medicine at wholesale prices, to be able to continue with her sales and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicine at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ana Armida

texts.es: Ana de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 4 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 36-years old and lives in her own home with her partner and two children. She has worked selling personal products for 4 years. Her business is located in her home and she also sells on the street in different communities. She is asking for a loan to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. at wholesale prices to keep going with her job and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Dúo Alemán Group

texts.es: Dúo Alemán Petrona de 58 años de edadm, es madre de 1 hijo, y tiene a cargo 2 nietos. El negocio al cual se dedica es a la venta de cosméticos y costuras, sus productos los entrega a domicilio. Nuevamente solicita un segundo crédito para la inversión en productos de catalogo y comprar al contado pues así obtiene mejores ganancias. Agradece la oportunidad que se le ha brindado. El sueño de Petrona es tener un negocio más grande y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Dúo Alemán - Petrona, 58 years old, is the mother of 1 child and has two grandchildren in her care. The business which she has is the sale of cosmetics and sewing. She delivers her products to the home. She asks for a second loan to invest in the catalog products and to purchase with cash since, in this way, she gets better earnings. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been offered to her. Petrona's dream is to have a larger business and a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros,  desde hace 2 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, esta solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk zone, works selling inner wear for women and men. For 2 years she has done this work and has many regular customers, with which she can keep her business afloat. With the earnings that she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. The young woman lives in her own house with her family, she is asking for the loan to purchase a greater quantity of inner wear of different prices, styles and colors and in this way have more customers and, so, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of inner wear of different prices, styles and colors.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Con Talento Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres con Talento La encargada de este grupo es la señora Deicy Leticia, es casada, tiene tres hijos, y al lado de su esposo le da muchas gracias a Dios por el pequeño taller de confeccion de playeras y camisas que tienen desde hace dos años. Viven en una colonia del pueblo y su sueño es cada día agrandar su negocio y ser grandes confeccionistas.  Ella tiene varios pedidos de playeras pero las maquinas que tienen no le son suficientes y necesita comprar otra, por ese motivo ella nuevamente pide otro préstamo y así comprar la maquina que le hace falta  para confeccionar prendas de vestir agradece mucho las oportunidades que le han dado y les desea muchas  bendiciones.
texts.en: Dúo Mujeres con Talento - The one in charge of this group is Deicy Leticia. She is married, has three children and alongside her husband she thanks God very much for the little shop where she sews t-shirts and other shirts which they have had for two years. They live in a colony of the town and her dream is to grow her business each day and be great tailors. She has various t-shirt orders but the machines that they have are not enough and she needs to purchase another. For this reason, she again asks for another loan and, so, to purchase the machine that she lacks to sew clothing. She is very grateful for the opportunities that have been granted to her and she wishes great blessings on the grantors.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to sew clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fatima Liset

texts.es: Fatima de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha logrado salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y encementando el piso, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener una vivienda signa.
texts.en: Fatima, 36 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She has a store located in her home, with what she earns from her sales she has managed to get ahead. She wants to improve her house, replastering the walls and cementing the floor, but as she doesn't have sufficient capital, she is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials and, so, to be able to have a dignified house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.es: Yonatan tiene su propia tienda en la cual ofrece diversidad de prendas a sus clientes. Solicita un préstamo de trecientos cincuenta mil colones (₡ 350 000), para la compra de mercadería, esto con el propósito de incrementar su volumen de ventas y poder crecer en este mercado.
texts.en: Yonatan has his own store where he sells a variety of clothing to his customers. He asks for a loan of three hundred fifty thousand colones (₡ 350 000), to purchase merchandise. This is with the goal to increase his sales volume and to be able to grow in this market.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rafael De Jesús

texts.es: Rafael de 39 años es residente en una localidad de Barranquilla, un municipio del departamento del Atlántico en donde emprendió su propio negocio por sugerencia de su hermana; al encontrarse en una situación difícil tras su desvinculación laboral y pese a sus acciones para hallar un nuevo empleo le fue imposible, sin embargo encontró en la comercialización de carnes frías y lácteos una oportunidad para crecer como empresario independiente y generar sus propios ingresos. Cada ocho días visita a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son vecinos, amigos y familiares y promociona sus productos que generalmente vende a crédito, aunque algunos de sus clientes prefieren cancelar de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual surtirá su negocio con butifarras, salchichón, mortadelas, yogures y quesos, para así mejorar su línea de productos e incrementar sus inventarios. Rafael es muy comprometido con su negocio y desea que su número de clientes siga incrementando.  En lo personal desea nuevamente conformar una familia puesto que es separado.
texts.en: Rafael, 39 years old, lives in a place in Barranquilla, a municipality in the Atlantic department where he established his own business at the suggestion of his sister. When he was in a difficult situation due to being laid off from his job and, despite his attempts to find another job, it was impossible. However, he found in selling cold meat and dairy products the opportunity to grow as an independent businessman and generate his own income. Every week, he visits his customers who in the great majority are neighbors, friends and family members, and promotes his products which he generally sells on credit, although some of his customers prefer to pay in cash.  Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will stock his business with Catalan sausage, sausage, mortadella, yogurt, and cheese, so in this way to improve his line of products and increase his inventory. Rafael is very committed to his business and wants his number of customers to continue increasing. Personally, he wants to form a family again since he is separated.

loans.use: to stock his business with Catalan sausage, sausage, mortadella, yogurt and cheese.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es una persona muy luchadora, tiene 38 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia, es originaria de Intag, pero desde hace 20 años aproximadamente que decidió salir de su ciudad natal. Luz ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos con su negocio, inicio con la venta de moras y frutillas porque no le alcanzaba con el dinero que ganaba como empleada doméstica, por eso inicio con este negocio y ahora su primera hija después de que Luz le dio una buena educación está trabajando y aporta económicamente con los gastos del hogar, y apoya para que sus hermanos menores también puedan acabar sus estudios.
Vive en el sector llamado Gangotena en donde la mayoría de personas se dedican a la crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes o conejos. Gangotena pertenece a la ciudad de Antoni o Ante que es muy conocida por sus productos textiles con muchas ofertas para todo tipo de gustos.
Luz se dedica al comercio de frutillas, moras y granos desde hace 5 años, inicio con esta actividad como iniciativa propia, además de esta actividad ella también cría chanchos y vacas, pero los tiene en la casa de su madre ubicada en Intag a donde ella va cada fin de semana.
Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para mejorar sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida. Luz agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luz is a very determined person. She is 38 years old, single, and lives in her own house. She is from Intag, but approximately 20 years ago, she decided to leave her native city. Luz has gotten her 4 children ahead with her business, she began selling blackberries and strawberries because the money she earned as a domestic employee wasn't enough. For this, she began with this business and now her first daughter, after Luz provided her with a good education, is working and contributes economically to the household expenses and supports her younger siblings to also complete their education.

She lives in the sector called Gangotena where the majority of people work raising animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and rabbits. Gangotena is part of the city of Antonio Ante which is well-known for its textile products with many sales for all tastes.

Luz has worked selling strawberries, blackberries and grains for 5 years. She began this work with her own initiative, in addition to this work she also raises pigs and cows, but she has them at her mother's house which is located in Intag, where she goes every weekend.

She wants to increase her working capital to improve her income and, in this way, improve her quality of life. Luz is grateful to Kiva for the offered support.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and grains and increase her sales, in this way to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Mariette Goretti

texts.fr:
Mariette Goretti est une femme exemple de force et de courage de 58 ans. Elle est divorcée depuis très longtemps. Elle est mère de six enfants dont les cinq sont déjà mariés et le dernier qui a 16 ans est encore à sa charge et suit actuellement une formation professionnelle en mécanique-auto. C'était elle seule qui élevait tous ses enfants. C'est une femme battante.
Elle vend des ustensiles de cuisines depuis 1993 pour gagner sa vie et pour pouvoir entretenir ses enfants. Le père de ses enfants qui est irresponsable n'avait jamais aidé.
Son objectif est de développer et améliorer encore son activité. Elle envisage d'ouvrir un autre point de vente.
texts.en: Mariette Goretti, aged 58, is a woman exemplary of strength and courage. She has been divorced for a long time. She is mother to six children, five of whom are already married. The youngest who is 16 years old is still her dependent and currently undertakes professional training in auto-mechanics. She raised all of her children by herself. She's a fighter. She has been selling kitchen utensils since 1993 in order to make a living and support her children. The father of her children, who is irresponsible, had never helped. Her goal is to develop and further her business even more. She plans to open another retail store.

loans.use: to buy different types of kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es:
Álvaro es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 23 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa familiar con su madre y sus hermanos.
Vive en el Barrio el Coco de Natabuela que pertenece al cantón Antonio Ante muy reconocido por su gastronomía típica principalmente la fritada y los helados, y muy visitado por sus fábricas textiles ya que se fabrican todo tipo de prendas de vestir y con ofertas a precios económicos.
Álvaro trabaja en un taller de carpintería como ayudante desde hace 6 años, ahora cuenta con la experiencia suficiente para poder montar su propio negocio, desea apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida, realizando adecuaciones a su vivienda que se encuentra un poco deteriorada ya que viven en un sector rural. Solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de muebles y la compra de un compresor ya que es lo único que le hace falta para poder empezar con su propio taller de carpintería. Agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a very hard-working young man. He is 23 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He lives in the family home with his mother and siblings.

He lives in the neighborhood of Coco de Naabuela which is in Antonio Ante canton, very well-known for its cuisine, especially fried foods and ice creams, and it is visited by many for its textile factories where they make all sorts of clothing and have sales at bargain prices.

Álvaro has worked as an assistant in a carpentry shop for 6 years. Now he has enough experience to be able to establish his own business. He wants to support his mother with the household expenses and to be able to have a better quality of life, making improvements to his house which is a bit deteriorated since they live in a rural area. He asks for a loan to purchase raw materials to make furniture and to purchase a compressor since it is the only thing he lacks to be able to begin his own carpentry shop. He is grateful to Kiva for the offered support.

loans.use: to open his own carpentry business and purchase a compressor in addition to raw materials.

loans.name: Kossiavi

texts.fr: Agée de 25 ans, kossiavi est une femme mariée et sans enfant vivant  à Adidogomé. Pour soutenir sa famille, kossiavi vend des cuire dent et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. kossiavi réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, elle désire ce prêt pour commander des planches de cuire dent afin de favoriser l’émergence de son commerce et aider son mari à couvrir les charges de son foyer.
texts.en: 25 years old, Kossiavi is a married woman without children, living in Adidogomé. In order to support her family, Kossiavi sells toothpicks and gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Kossiavi makes profit in her business and in order to meet her client's needs, she wants this loan to order planks of toothpick in order to boost her emerging business and to help her husband cover household costs.

loans.use: To buy two planks of toothpicks.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia tiene 23 años de edad, convive con el señor Marcelino, tienen dos hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, vive en una comunidad rural muy alejada al área urbano.
La señora Delia, se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus progenitores. El año 2014 sufrió una disminución en sus ingresos económicos por los bajos precios que atravesó los productos agrícolas y también por las lluvias que le echaron a perder sus plantaciones de cebolla y la granizada daño sus sembradíos, perdió parte de su cultivo de zanahoria, también perdió una parte de su terreno con el desborde del rio. La comunidad entera sufrió los daños.
La señora Delia, es una persona humilde y muy respetuosa en su comunidad donde trabaja, por lo dedicado al trabajo agrícola, con lo cual saca a su familia adelante para así mantener y cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
Por los motivos mencionados su estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de sus insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos.
La señora Delia, está solicitando el préstamo para el arriendo de terreno de esta manera mejorar su economía y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Delia is 23 years old and lives with Marcelino, they have two dependent sons. They live in a rural community far away from the town. Delia makes a living from agriculture because it is the only thing she learned from her parents. In 2014 she sustained a reduction in her income as a result of low prices for agricultural products. In addition, the rains ruined her onion crops and hail damaged the fields she had sown. She lost part of her carrot crop, as well as part of her land when the river burst its banks. The whole community suffered damage. Delia is a humble and respectful person. Her dedication to agricultural work has earned  the respect of  the community where she works,  and allowed her family to get ahead and pay for her children's education expenses. Her economic stability has been unsettled for the reasons mentioned, directly impacting agricultural supplies which are required for production and to feed her children.  Delia is asking for a loan to lease land allowing her to increase her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the rent on new land so she can increase her agricultural production,  thereby generate more income and be able to secure a home in the short term.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
A farmer who is a resident from Kandal Stoeng district, Kandal province, Sokly is 56 years old. She is a widow who is the breadwinner to the family and has five children, three of whom rely on her.

In order to earn a living, she is growing rice. In her free time, she sells firewood to supplement her income. The challenge to her farming business is the drop of rice’s price in the market, which happens sometimes while the cost of inputs remains high. Sokly earns about USD 10 per day and can save approximately USD 5 each day after expenses.

This will be the second cycle for Sokly to apply for a loan from VisionFund. The past loan, which was completely paid back, has helped her to earn good income to improve the living condition for her family. Some of her loan will be used to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase the crop yields. The remaining portion will be used to pay for plowing fee and subsidiary expenses. She hopes she can increase her income so as to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase the crop yields.

loans.name: Nurangiz

texts.en:
Nurangiz is 42 years old. She is married and has two children. Her children are 15 and 18 years old. One of the children studies in high school and the other is in sports. Now she lives in the Füzuli region with her family, but they are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city. Her husband’s salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses.

Today she needs her first loan in the amount of 2,150 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) so that she can supply her business. She wants to buy two head of cattle. She is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Manjola

texts.en:
Manjola and her husband have been buying and selling produce for the past eight years. They buy products such as potatoes, onions and apples from producers in their region and then sell them in other parts of the country.
Manjola is asking for a loan to pay for more of the products she wants for her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh produce to sell

loans.name: Lilia Mercedes

texts.es:
Lilia  es una mujer  de  52 años de edad actualmente se encuentra viuda, tiene un hijo el mismo que tiene 17 años es estudiante. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella dedica mucho tiempo a la crianza y cuidados de su único hijo. Ahora  Lilia  vive en  una parroquia del Cantón Latacunga,   ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi. En este sector la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la producción de bloques y existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Lilia es comerciante de allullas, empanadas, cueros y quesos de hoja, estos son típicos en la ciudad y tienen mucha tradición  sus ventas  las realiza en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, y su producto es muy cotizado.
Vino a la fundación por referencia de su hermana y hoy solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima de elaboración de sus productos y con estas ganancias adicionales pagar los estudios universitarios de su hijo y esto ayudará a mejorar sus oportunidades en la vida.
Lilia y su hijo agradecen a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 52 year old woman who is now a widow. She has a son who is 17 years old. He is a student. Despite having a job that demands a lot of time and work, she spends a lot of time raising and caring for her only child. Right now, Lilia lives in a parish of the Latacunga canton, located in the province of Cotopaxi. In this area, most of the residents work in construction block production and there are families that had started all types of activities to cover their own and the community's needs.

Lilia sells hallullas, empanadas, pork rinds and leaf-wrapped cheese. These are very traditional in the city and she sells in the different markets there. Her product is much sought after.

She came to the foundation referred by her sister. Today she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make her products and with the additional profits, pay for her son's college education. This will help improve his opportunities in life.

Lilia and her son thank Kiva for making it possible for them to grow in their personal and work life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as milk, flour and pork rinds to increase production and in the near future pay for her son's college education.

loans.name: Naomy

texts.en:
Naomy is married and has been blessed with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a farming business, selling retail at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizer to use in her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to use in her farming business.

loans.name: Jicaras Group

texts.en:
The very large Guatemalan northwestern State of El Quiche is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Jicaras” (Bowls).  Ten women have joined together in order to ask for loans to grow their businesses.  They want to generate more income so that they can make certain their children go to school.  In Guatemala, a good education is critical for children to have a prosperous future.

The “Jicaras” newest group member is 53 year old Victoriana who is married with two children.  She is happy to be a part of the group and, especially so, because they have asked her to lead them as president.  Victoriana runs a small convenience store out of her home.  Some of the items she sells are soap, eggs, pasta, oil and rice.  She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory to include more items like sugar and coffee, as well as increasing the amounts of eggs, oil and pasta. Victoriana is a very busy and hardworking women who, in order to generate more income, also raises chickens and hand makes aprons and blouses to sell.

Victoriana, the other members of “Jicaras” and the women of Guatemala are so very grateful to the KIVA investors who have shown their faith in them to borrow and then pay back their loans.  They are able to do this with the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” program of non-formal education and micro-loans.  During the monthly meetings of “Jicaras” where the women do their loan accounting and payments, they also have an educational topic presented by the Friendship Bridge Facilitator.  

Many thanks go to all the KIVA investors around the world!!!

loans.use: to increase her inventory to include more items like sugar and coffee, as well as increasing the amounts of eggs, oil and pasta for her convenience store .

loans.name: Kavini

texts.en:
Kavini is 65 years old. She is widowed and has five adult children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to put back into the business to expand it. Her hopes and dreams are to be a big farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from fattening pigs. Aiza dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies necessary for his clothing manufacturing.

loans.name: Ba Bi

texts.en:
Ba Bi is a 41-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past year. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his family.

Ba Bi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purpose.

Therefore, Ba Bi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Ba Bi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.fr: 40 ans, mariée, Angeline est mère de trois enfants âgés de 3, 5 et 12 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés. Le mari d'Ageline est ouvrier, dont le salaire est très faible. De ce fait, elle doit exercer des activités génératrices de revenu pour l'aider à entretenir la famille. Angeline est couturière et elle cultive aussi des choux verts depuis l'an 2000. Elle voudrait développer son activité agricole, elle désire cultiver différentes sortes de légumes et brèdes à part les choux verts.
texts.en:
Forty years old and married, Angeline is the mother of three children, 3, 5 and 12 years of age. The latter are both schooling. Angeline's husband is a workman, so his salary is very limited. For this reason, she has to undertake money-earning activities to help him support the family.

Angeline is a seamstress and she has been growing green cabbage since the year 2000. She would like to develop her agricultural business and grow various sorts of vegetables and greens apart from green cabbage.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Paulino se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 y específicamente 3 en el cultivo de café años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Paulino espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Paulino is 42 years old, and he lives with his wife and child in his own home made of rustic materials. They live in the district of Santo Tomás, which is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this area is tranquil, and the residents primarily make a living in agriculture, commerce and ranching.

Paulino makes a living in agriculture, specifically he grows coffee. He has 30 years of experience in this profession, and 3 years specifically growing coffee. He is highly recommended, both personally and professionally, in his area.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his coffee crop as well as to pay for the labor costs of harvest season. With this, Paulino hopes to produce a higher-quality coffee for his customers which will have a positive impact on his income. Through this, he will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works as a secretary for a government department. She is married, but her husband is working at another place in the country. Sheis living at the house of her mother but she will be the owner of the place some day.

Susana needs a loan to fix a room at the place where she lives with her 5 kids. She hopes you can help her

loans.use: to fix a room at the place where she lives

loans.name: Gedeon Group

texts.en:
The community of Los Altos is in Guatemala’s second largest city, Quetzaltenango which is in the Western Highlands.  It is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Gedeon” that has nine very dedicated and hardworking members whose aspirations are to make their lives better. 

Cecilia is one of “Gedeon’s” members.  She is 29 years old, married and has two children who are 5 and 1 year old.  Her business is as a seamstress and embroiderer.  She makes exquisite quilts, drapes and “huipiles” the traditional blouses worn by Maya women.  This is the time of year, because of various holidays and end of the year celebrations, that she needs to augment her inventory due to increased customer demands.  Cecilia is asking for a loan to buy fabrics, threads and needles because these are the most important items for making her creations and to sustain the high quality she is known for.  She sells, predominantly, in her local community.   

The Trust Bank women of “Gedeon” are very happy that, besides receiving micro-loans, they also have the opportunity to learn about important topics that will help them on a daily basis in their lives and in their businesses.  They say that it is helpful to learn about good health for themselves and their families.  They also are very grateful for the lessons in business administration, sound investing, creating savings and customer service.  The women look forward to the monthly meetings where the Friendship Bridge Facilitator helps them to learn through role playing, drawings and photos.  This is all part of the winning combination of the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” program of micro loans and education. The women of “Gedeon” send their sincere gratitude to Friendship Bridge and the KIVA investors for helping them to develop personally, as well as their businesses.  Thank you!!!

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and needles for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Patricia Abigail

texts.es:
Patricia es una joven de 23 años, es casada, vive con su esposo Cristian que tiene 23 años, y sus dos hijos de 6 años y 8 meses respectivamente. Su esposo trabaja reparando bicicletas en Sport Bike de la ciudad de Ibarra. Su primer hijo estudia en la escuela fiscal. Vive en casa propia, que la construyeron poco a poco con su esfuerzo.
Patricia actualmente no trabaja y tampoco tiene un negocio, únicamente tienen el ingreso de su esposo de la empresa en donde trabajan, es por eso que desea iniciar su negocio y apoyar con los gastos de hogar y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, y darles una buena educación.
Vive en el barrio 10 de Agosto de la Parroquia Caranqui de Ibarra, conocida por su gastronomía típica como la fritada, los halados de paila y confites. Además en esta ciudad está ubicada la laguna de Yahuarcocha  que es visitada por gran cantidad de turistas en especial los fines de semana.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de mercadería como blusas, pantalones jeans y chaquetas para venderlo en otras ciudades y a sus vecinos. Ella anteriormente ya trabajo vendiendo ropa pero como tuvo a su segunda hija tuvo que dejar su negocio para dedicarse al cuidado de su hija. Patricia desea empezar con el comercio de ropa ya que sabe que si salen buenas ganancias.Patricia agradece a KIVA por la confianza y el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 23-year-old young woman. She is married. She lives with her husband Cristian, who is 23 years old, and her two children aged 6 years and 8 months respectively. Her husband works repairing bicycles in Sport Bike in the city of Ibarra. Her first child is studying in public school. She lives in a house of her own, which they built little by little through their efforts.

Patricia currently does not work neither has a business. They only have her husband's income from the company where he works. That is why she wants to start her business, help with the household expenses, and be able to offer her children a better quality of life and give them a good education.

She lives in the August 10 neighborhood of the Caranqui Parish of Ibarra, known for its traditional cuisine such as "fritada" (braised pork), "paila" (handmade in pan) ice cream, and sweets. Also, the Yahuarcocha lagoon is located in this city, which is visited by a great amount of tourists especially on weekends.

Patricia is going to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise such as blouses, jeans, and jackets to sell in other cities and to her neighbors. She has previously worked in selling clothes but since she had her second child, she had to leave her business to take care of her daughter. Patricia wishes to start with the clothing business since she knows that good profits can indeed come out. Patricia thanks Kiva for the trust and support given.

loans.use: to start her clothing sales business buying blouses, jeans, and jackets to help her husband with household expenses.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 37 years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Elma has been in this business for eight years.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family but her husband is a very poor man. Faiza also works as a tailor, providing sewing services to earn income to contribute to managing the household. 

Faiza is requesting a loan through the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, and other supplies for her tailoring business. She will use her loan to enable her to purchase these accessories and help increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Faiza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 49-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has five adult children. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Josephine sells ice candy and hotdogs to earn a living. They work together each day. 

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making ice candy such as powdered milk, powdered juice, sugar, and fruit. She will also buy hotdogs to sell. In the future, Josephine wishes to have a stable business to have sustainable earnings.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, powdered juice, sugar, fruit, and hotdogs

loans.name: Niño

texts.en:
Niño and his wife are residents of Baybay, Leyte. For the past year, they have owned a small restaurant to earn a living and they also operate a sari-sari (variety) store to give them extra income. Niño is 29 and a father of six year old boy. He works hard to provide for the needs of his family. 

Niño is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, vegetables, and cooking oil. He will also buy grocery items such as toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, powdered juice, canned goods, spices, and soft drinks. In the future, Niño wants to expand his business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, vegetables,cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, powdered juice, canned goods, spices, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 23 years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Jovelyn has been in this business for two years.

Jovelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, milk, soap, noodles, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, milk, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Piedad

texts.es:
Gloria es  una mujer  ecuatoriana de 44 años de edad, quien nación en la ciudad de Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  una de las provincias mas reconocidas por su gente trabajadora del país Ecuador, ella actualmente está casada, ella vive en casa de los padres en casa propia , el obstáculo mas grande que ha tenido fue el tener que trabajar desde muy niña para poder ayudar en su casa por esta razón tuvo que salir a buscar trabajo.
Gloria ha sido un apoyo incondicional para su familia desde ya hace mucho tiempo atrás, hoy en día se dedica a la comercialización de chatarra desde hace mas de cuatro años esta actividad la aprendió de su hermano y sus padres quienes se dedican a la misma actividad desde ya hace algún tiempo atrás, la actividad mas difícil en este negocio es sin duda alguna es la falta de transporte para el traslado de su producto.
Su sueño y anhelo es poder tener un carro y un mejor estilo de vida, para que a futuro no les pueda faltar nada. Necesita el crédito para la compra de mas producto ya que al tener un pedido muy grande tiene un faltante de producto, Gloria y su familia quieren extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 44-year-old Ecuadorian woman who was born in the city of Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi. This province is one of the most well-known in Ecuador for its' hardworking people. She is currently married and lives in her parents' home.

The greatest obstacle that she has faced has been the need to work since she was young to be able to help in her household. For this reason, she left to search for work. Gloria has unconditionally supported her family for a long time now. Currently, she has made a living buying and selling scrap metal for more than four years. She learned this occupation from her brother and her parents who have been making a living doing this for awhile now. The most difficult part of this business is without a doubt the lack of transportation to transport the metal.

Her hope and dream is to be able to have a car and better quality of life so that her and her family have what they need in the future. She needs a loan to buy more metal because she has a very large request at the moment but is lacking the metal for it. Gloria and her family would like to extend a sincere thank you and commend Kiva for making possible the improvement in their personal and professional lives.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal since she has an important request to take care of.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet is a 47-year-old married woman who is a resident in Kampong Cham province. This woman is blessed with six children, four of whom still count on her and need her support.

To make a living, she, together with her husband, is working hard on a hectare rice field, the business they have owned for 27 years. In addition to the main income, they sometimes work for others for fees. This family’s income is about USD 18 per day.

The main challenge to their farming business is that the rice crop can be destroyed by pest insects, producing lower-than-expected outputs.

Yet has been with VisionFund for a cycle already and that past loan has enabled her to generate good income. As the leader of a group of three members, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields. She hopes to increase her income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, 31, is living in a house located in Kampong Cham province and is a married mother of three dependent children.

The primary source of her income is from growing cassava and rice for 13 years. The price of cassava is lower than before, which causes her to earn a very low income.

After successfully repaying all the previous four loans, Oun has asked for the fifth loan cycle with VisionFund. As the group leader of four, she is going to manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase her outputs. She hopes that her crop will grow well so that she can sell it at a higher price, which will enable her to save sufficient capital to support her business next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her outputs so as to earn more income for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur was born in 1976. He and his family live in the Füzuli region. He is married and has a child. The child is 16 years old and he studies in high school. Elnur’s wife is a housewife. Elnur is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Füzuli city.

He needs his first loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). Elnur has applied to Komak company. With this loan, he wants to repair his shop. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to repair his shop.

loans.name: Satkyn

texts.ru: Саткын, 62 года, вдова, воспитала 3 детей. У Саткын - средне-специальное образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством, стартовав в 2012 году. На земельном наделе размером 3,0 ГА, она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Саткын составляет 12,600 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, все накопленные средства Саткын старается вкладывать в развитие ее бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая экологически-чистого ячменя с целью последующей его реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят улучшить благосостояние Саткын и отложить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Satkyn is 62, widowed, and raised three children. She has a vocational education and is retired. She plants crops to earn income for her family, a business she started in 2012. She grows barley to sell on a 3 hectare plot of land. Her monthly income is 12,600 som (KGS), which is not enough to live on. Satkyn tries to invest her profits in expanding her business. She applied for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to harvest organic barley with the goal of later selling it. The earnings from the loan will help improve Satkyn's living conditions and repair her house.

loans.use: to harvest organic barley

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Don Demetrio vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de cerdos y ganado y tambien a la agricultura y gracia a ese trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de concentrado para los cerdos y tambien para la compra de 6 novillos para continuar con su trbajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Don Demetrio lives in his own home with his three children. He has made a living raising pigs and cattle for 15 years, as well as working in agriculture. Thanks to this work, he has been able to provide for his family. He is requesting a loan to buy pig feed concentrate and also to buy 6 steers to continue with his work and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy pig feed concentrate and also to buy 6 steers.

loans.name: Gomaa

texts.en:
Gomaa is 39, married and has 4 children. He runs a small restaurant that presents traditional meals and he previously requested 7000 EGP and successfully repaid it on the due dates.

Gomaa is requesting 10,000 EGP to buy a new gas line and some raw food materials to meet the increasing demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy a new gas line and some raw food materials for his restaurant

loans.name: Lazer

texts.en:
Lazer is 50 years old and a married father of four. His youngest child is 10 years old. Lazer works as an event recorder/cameraman and he also raises livestock. He has a dairy cow and has been selling one baby calf each year for 400 USD. Lazer also grows corn and fodder for his cow in addition to cultivating grapevines. He provides camera services for approximately 20 events each year for which he charges 240 USD per event. Lazer’s annual earnings for his family adds up to 5,200 USD each year. 

Lazer said to the loan officer, “we are poor and at times it is very difficult to pay for the children’s school expenses. Sometimes not all villages have public elementary and secondary schools making it easy on those people who want to cash in very easy. They have opened private schools and we must pay a good chunk of money to them, when we shouldn’t, if government had thought of us.” 

Lazer is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his youngest child. He will use a portion of his loan to buy roofing insulation.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his youngest child and buy roofing insulation

loans.name: Hayam

texts.en:
Hayam is 27, married and has 4 children. Her husband works in a CDA with a very small salary. She has a small grocery store project, where she sells some fruits and vegetables, in front of it.

She is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy some more grocery products such as oil, rice and soap.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and soap for sale in her store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, with her family. She is requesting a loan of 2,700,000 Ugandan shillings to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement and timber, for constructing a permanent house for the family. She is 32 years old and married with three children (two attending school).

Jane is currently working as a primary school teacher earning a salary. She joined the teaching profession due to her desire to impart knowledge and shape the children of the nation. She hopes to educate her children and provide for their basic needs. She complains of low salary payments and a long distance to her place of work.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement and timber, for constructing a permanent house for the family.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios, 65, from Buhangin, Davao City, owns two units of this kind of tricycle which she calls a "closed cab motor." Two of her neighbors drive it for income and pay her the rental fee on a daily basis. If there is a sudden mechanical problem on any of these tricycles, she has no available spare parts and tools for troubleshooting. She’s afraid that if that situation occurs, her family and the families of the two drivers will suffer financial insufficiency.

Remedios wants to be prepared, so she applied for a PHP 15,000 loan to buy the necessary spare parts and mechanical tools. She seeks your generosity to lend her this amount because it will help three families.

Later on, she will buy another "closed cab motor" and hire another neighbor as a driver. Moreover, she plans to buy a multicab (a small van) and plans to put up a Piso Net, a coin-operated internet café. All of these are geared towards helping her grandchildren and supporting their studies. Her husband, Pepito, a self-employed sales and marketing person, shares the same aspiration with her. They both feel that their responsibilities don’t stop with their children alone. Instead, they want to help as long as they can.

Remedios regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and mechanical tools

loans.name: Cholponai

texts.ru: Чолпонай, 42 года, замужем. У нее средне образование, она 15 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей одеждой, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чолпонай, на данный момент в обороте есть товар на сумму 120,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 27,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпонай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для реализации, увеличения ассортимента и привлечения новых клиентов. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Cholponai is 42, married, and has a high school education. She has been selling clothing as the main source of income for her family for 15 years, having started out with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Cholponai's hard work, she currently has inventory worth 120,000 som (KGS) and her monthly income is 27,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy clothing to sell, increase her inventory, and attract new customers. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future expansion of her business and to pay for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase her inventory and attract new clients

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул, 39 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем географии в школе, супруг - преподаватель физкультуры там же. С 2008 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Анаркул на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, также 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает кукурузу, сами заготавливают корма для скота. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет до 24,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и улучшение условий проживания.
texts.en:
Anarkul is 39 and married with three children. She has a higher education and works as a geography teacher in a school. Her husband is a physical education teacher there as well. Since 2008, she has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income. She currently has five cows on her farm as well as one hectare of land where she grows corn for livestock feed. Her total monthly income is up to 24,000 KGS.
