With the goal of further developing her business, Anarkul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 KGS to purchase calves to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further building up her farm and into improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some calves in order to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 41 years old and is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children for the third term. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is at present working as a primary school teacher: a job he has performed for 12 years in order to meet his family's needs. He hopes to educate his children to university; however, he faces the challenge of little and delayed salaries by the local government, which hinders his future prospects of setting the best living standard for his family. He is hardworking and very committed to his profession – this gives him hope to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Sit Kone Village Group

texts.en:
Thein, featured borrower, lives at Sit Kone Village. He is married and has three children, all of them are students. He spends everyday farming in the paddy field and sometimes, when he needs a hand. mostly during harvest months, his wife helps him. The couple raise ducks, to sell duck eggs. He also has pigs for savings.

Proximity's loan will help Thein's family purchase high quality feeds and vaccines; to be healthy and productive. Thein, as a parent, wants his children to be schooled till graduation and have enough finances to cover the family's living cost.

This loan will help 19 members, purchase ducks and high quality feeds. Duck raising has recently become very popular in Myanmar and a way to boost income in rural areas. Ducks growers work very carefully to be kind with their ducks, as it effects the egg production rate.

Pictured above are some members from Sit Kone Village Group, named Aye, Thein, Than, Than H, Zaw and Hte. This village is in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region where most households focus on crop farming and raising ducks.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and also high quality feeds, for 19 group members in the village

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Hussein, in his mid 30s, is married with three children who are still in school. He has been running a barber shop for two years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hussein's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date machines for attracting customers. He dreams of making his business big.

Hussein will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date machines for attracting customers.

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en août 2015 réunit des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité l'élevage et le commerce.

Sadio qui se trouve à l'extrême droite et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 51 ans,est mariée sans enfant.

Son activité est l'élevage,elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit 02 moutons d'une valeur de 25000f.

Son objectif est de réfectionner sa case et faire le pélerinage à la mecque à long terme.
texts.en:
This group was created in August 2015 and unites members who live in the same village and whose business is raising livestock and small-scale commerce.

Sadio who is located on the far right, raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is 51 years old, married, and has no children. Her business is livestock-raising and she has been doing this work for several years.

With the loan, she intends to buy two sheep for the amount of 25,000 francs. Her objective is to repair and renovate her small house and, in the long run, to make a pilgrimage to Mecca.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Dúo El Paraíso Group

texts.es:
Dúo El Paraíso
Doña Josefa tiene 48 años de edad es soltera  vive con sus hermanas  ella quiere utilizar el préstamo en su comedor llamado roca fuerte quiere invertir en  una estufa industrial y carnes, frutas, verduras, y poder contratar a una persona de tiempo completo ya que tiene muchos clientes  su proyecto inicio desde hace 35 años vendiendo atoles y todo tipo de comida para poder ayudar a sus papas, sus clientes son personas de alrededor y clientes de tiendas, y oficinas sus esperanzas son mejorar su calidad de vida, mejorar sus ingresos económicos fortalecer el negocio, ofrecer variedad de productos, y poder darle la oportunidad de superación a otras personas para que ellos puedan  pagar gastos de sus casas, es el primer préstamo que solicita a fape esperando en dios recibir la ayuda de fape  ella quiere ahorrar para poder comprar su casa  y poder tener su local propio.
texts.en:
Dúo El Paraíso

Doña Josefa is 48 years old. She is single and lives with her sisters. She wants to use the loan in her dining area called roca fuerte. She wants to invest in an industrial stove as well as meat, fruit, and vegetables. She also wants to hire a full-time person since she has many customers.

She started her business 35 years ago selling atoles (cornflour drink) and all types of food in order to help her parents. Her customers are people from the surrounding area and people from shops and offices.

Her hopes are to improve her quality of life, earn more income, strengthen her business, offer a variety of products, and be able to give others the opportunity to overcome so that they can pay for household expenses. This is the first loan that she is requesting from FAPE. She is trusting in God that she will receive help through FAPE. She wants to save money to be able to buy a house and be able to have her own place to run her business out of.

loans.use: to buy a stove and vegetables to makes snacks to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Here is Anita from Buhangin, Davao City. She is a 56-year-old single woman who supports herself and sometimes extends financial assistance to her relatives. She’s into direct selling of products from brands such as Avon, Personal Collection, MSE, and Natasha. Her products range from intimate apparel, RTWs (ready-to-wear), shoes and bags, to personal and home care commodities.

She was encouraged to venture into this kind of business because it typically requires low capital to begin with. Now she is trying to enhance it by expanding her network of target consumers and through proper rolling of capital.

Anita aspires to further improve her direct selling business by availing additional capital. She will use this PHP 20,000 loan to buy more personal and home care products, clothes, shoes, bags, and other collections.

Anita is positive that this additional capital will give her more profits and savings. She dreams of having a stable space or a showroom for her business in the near future.

Anita meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more personal and home care products, clothes, shoes, bags, and other collections

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. He is a teacher by profession and has taught for the last 10 years.

His salary is his major source of income. Henry supplements his income with a produce business. Having used the previous loan to buy cement and iron sheets to complete his commercial house, he has gone ahead to use the proceeds from this business to start up a retail shop.

Henry is so ambitious that he wants money to buy a piece of land for farming and to have several sources of income plus ensuring food security at home. Though he meets challenges of inadequate capital, price fluctuations and seasonality changes, he has hope that he will acheive his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a man, age 36, with three children (all in school). They live in Kagadi, Uganda.

Francis works as a primary school teacher. He joined the profession because he loves to stay and care for the little children. He teaches five hours a day and also earns income from farming and a retail shop where he has worked for 13 years. He wants a loan to expand his retail shop by buying items for the shop, such as sugar, salt and others, to resell. He has a dream of boosting business capital although he faces challenges of high debts. Clients describe him as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy items for his shop, such as sugar, salt and others, to resell.

loans.name: Amanda Azucena

texts.es: La señora Amanda de 28 años de edad y posee 2 hijos pequeños (10 y 3 meses) se dedica a la venta de comida y cosméticos  y venta de zapatos desde hace 5 años este es su segundo crédito kiva que ella solicita para invertir en la compra de mercadería Productos comestibles y cosmeticos como son lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes, productos de belleza, desinfectantes, bolsas, billeteras, y zapatos para dama, caballeros, niños y tenis  etc. Porque no posee suficiente efectivo para invertir ya que posee una gran demanda de sus clientes ella agradece por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que con las ganancias lograron construir su pequeña vivienda  y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Amanda is 28 years old and has 2 small children (10 and 3 months old). She has worked for 5 years  selling food, cosmetics and shoes. This is her second Kiva loan which she is requesting to buy merchandise: food products and cosmetics such as lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, beauty products, disinfectants, bags, wallets; and women's, men's and children's shoes and tennis shoes, etc.  She is requesting this loan because she does not have enough cash to invest and she has much demand form her customers. She is grateful for the given support, because with her earnings they were able to build their small house and give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She has two school-aged children, ages 18 and 13 years old. She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living. Aside from this, she also sells food to have extra income to support her family's needs.

She dreams for business improvement in the future. Perhaps she wants to have a better means of living, especially to give a better education to her children. Thus, Editha is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies and biscuits. She will also buy ingredients for her food selling business, such as cooking oil, sugar and flour.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits and flour.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a commercial farmer, an activity that he does as his major source of livelihood. He supplements his income with proceeds from trading in produce, especially in beans and maize. Charles got into serious farming in 2003 with a purpose of generating income for the entire family.

Charles lives in Kagadi, Uganda; he is 50 years old and a father of five children. Charles wants to acquire a loan to pay school fees for his children and also improve on his farming.

He has dreams of educating his children and putting up a permanent house at home. His major challenge is frequent price fluctuations of the agricultural output, especially during the rainy season.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy, 54, is a married man with 6 children who are 28, 24, 22, 20, 18, and 13 years old. Four of them are attending University and a post secondary technical school.

Willy deals in animal rearing, teaching and also earns funds from agricultural produce. He started his business in 1985 in a rural area with the intention of meeting his family's needs. He has a dream of educating his children, however he faces challenges in his business such as inflation, bad weather and competition. Clients describe him as hardworking and honest.

He intends to use this loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
This man is 50 years old, and he lives in the village of Arajadzor in Syunik region. Norik lives here with his wife and smallest daughter (she is a student); their son is in the army and now passing his military service, and their elder daughter is already married.

Norik has vocational education, and during his life has been doing different work. The most profitable until today for his family is farming and agriculture. On his farm Norik has cows, heifers, and a calf. He also has a large vegetable garden where he cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, and zucchini, and he also has a cute fruit garden with apple, plum, nut, and peach trees. This farmer sells all his farm products at the city’s wholesale market.

Norik would like to develop poultry on his farm and hopes this Kiva deal will be very helpful for his plans. With his Kiva loan amount of 450,000 Armenian drams, Norik wants to buy 20 chickens and also fodder for the chickens. He hopes that the sale of eggs and some poultry will make his farming income more than he manages to have now.

loans.use: to buy 20 chickens and also fodder for the chickens.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 42 years old and is a single mother with three children of 13, 12 and 1 year. Two of them are attending school in Kagadi, Uganda.

She wants a loan to pay school fees. Her only source of income is a salary from a bank where she works as a teller. She has worked for 12 years serving the people who hold accounts there, and they call her an honest woman.

She has dreams of having well-educated children, though at her workplace she has found challenges like long working hours.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a divorced woman with six school-aged children, although they do not all attend school. They live in their own house, which does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Amina operates a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. A major challenge she faces in her business is the high cost of seasonality.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Amadou Dioulde's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en août 2015 rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le commerce.

Arame qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 23 ans,célibataire sans enfant.

Son activité est le commerce de tissu et la vente de mouton.

Elle compte acheter 05 piéces de tissu wax à 5000f la piéce et o1 mouton à 25000f.

Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
This group was created in August 2015 and brings together members who live in the same village and whose activity is small-scale commerce.

Arame who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 23, single, and has no children. Her activity is buying and selling cloth and selling sheep.

Arame intends to buy five lengths of wax cloth (high quality African print cloth) at 5000 francs each and one sheep for 25,000 francs. She will use the profit she makes to boost her activity.

loans.use: to buy some lengths of African print cloth (wax pagne) and a sheep.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Chizi has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes suits for men and women. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza is a married woman with one child who is still too young to attend school. Wanza owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Wanza operates a grocery vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
From Davao City, here is Rosalinda, 64 years old, who dreams that this house for rent will become units of apartments someday. For now, she aspires to have it renovated to attract good-paying renters. It’s been idle for some time, as she has no immediate funds for renovation.

She needs financial assistance amounting to PHP 25,000 that she can use to buy construction materials such as wood, cement, concrete blocks, sand, and others. She cannot use her husband Dionisio’s monthly pension because it is their source of daily sustenance. Rosalinda believes that the renovation will bring positive results like regular monthly income and more savings for emergency situations. She wishes for good health and a long life for her whole family.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as wood, cement, concrete blocks, sand, and others.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya is 24-year-old woman, and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is vegetable seller by profession, selling vegetables such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Ruqiya's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position her husband is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business.

Therefore Ruqiya has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business.

loans.name: Magda

texts.en:
This nice woman name is Magda, and she is 63 years old. She lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. She graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute in history, social science and law.

From the year of graduating the institute, she started to work in her specialty; today, she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian history.

Magda is a very intelligent and beloved pedagogue. Having high qualification and being known as a very good specialist of her subject, Magda also has a lot of pupils whom she gives paid private courses of Armenian history and prepares them for their entrance exams.

Magda is married and she has two sons. Both of them are married, and they live with their families. Magda lives with her husband, who is also a pedagogue.

Magda asks for this loan of 200,000 Armenian drams as she has a lack of the professional literature that she daily uses during her private courses at home.

loans.use: to buy professional literature that she daily uses during her private courses at home.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 54-year-old woman and mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. Her husband sells fruits, e.g., apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Irshad's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore, Irshad has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a widowed mother of six children, all of whom do not attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a shoe selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe réunit des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le commerce.

Fatoumata qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 39 ans et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son activité  est le commerce d'arachide.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit  une valeur de 30000f et le reste le mettre dans son compte d'épargne.

Son objectif est de constituer un fonds pour pratiquer l'élevage de moutons.
texts.en:
This group is made up of members who live in the same village and are businesswomen.

Fatoumata, who is on the far right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married and is 39 years old. She has four children, two of whom are boys.

She sells peanuts.

She intends to purchase an amount for 30,000 francs with this loan and to put the rest in her loan account.

Her goal is to amass funds to raise sheep.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Khurshid

texts.en:
Khurshid is a 58-year-old widow. She is running a business of milk selling. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production.

Khurshid’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. She works very hard to earn income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

For the improvement of her business, Khurshid has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Santhiaba Rural Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré 09 juillet 2002. Ce groupe est constitué de huit femmes qui ont les mêmes ambitions. Madame Véronique qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe elle est divorcée, âgée de 64 ans et mère de quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de l'huile de palme, de netetou et du citron de plus de trente ans. Elle compte renforcer son activité avec le prêt sollicité. Elle est très expérimentée dans son domaine d'activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en: The banc villageois was inaugurated on the 9th of July 2002. This group is made up of eight women who share the same ambitions. Mrs. Veronique, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is aged 64 and divorced with four sons. She has been selling palm oil, netetou (spicy seasoning) and lemons for over 30 years. She plans on reinforcing her business with the loan that she requests. She has a lot of experience in her domain. She will use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, netetou and lemons.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es amable y muy unida este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo existen muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con amabilidad y respeto. 
En este Cantón vive y trabaja el señor Carlos un hombre luchador, casado tiene cuatro hijos, actualmente trabaja como aserrador pero desea emprender poniéndose un restaurant, su esposa es quien estará al momento al frente del negocio ya que hasta hacer clientela él tiene que seguir trabajando aserrando.
Cuenta con el local casi listo para iniciar en este negocio y la experiencia suficiente, solo necesita comprar un poco de activos que son necesarios para este negocio como mesas, sillas, etc.
Don Carlos viene de familia muy humilde y sabe lo duro que es la vida, por ese motivo todos los días da su mejor esfuerzo para apoyar a sus hijos en su preparación.
Don Carlos agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a lovely, small village, it has a warm, humid climate and the people are very friendly and united. The village has many tourists who visit and so there are many hostels in the surrounding areas in which they can rest and be treated in a friendly and respectful way. 

Carlos lives in this village, he is a hard-working man who is married and has 4 children. He currently works as a sawyer but he wises to set up his own restaurant. His wife will be at the forefront of the business interacting with the clients because he will have to continue working as a sawyer. 

He already has a shop ready to start this business and has sufficient experience, he only needs to buy a few things which he needs for this business, such as tables, chairs etc. 

Carlos comes from a humble family and knows how tough life can be, because of this he gives it all to help support his children as they grow up.

Carlos is grateful to Kiva for the given support and the opportunity.

loans.use: to set up his own restaurant together with the help of his partner, together they will give it their best effort to support their children.

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina is a 39-year-old, single woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.

Through her best efforts at providing services, she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demand of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. That is why she has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair-care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria tiene 60 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 3 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and lives in her own house together with her family, she has had a small shop for 3 years which is located in her home. 

She has many clients thanks to the good prices, with her earnings she is able to cover some of the costs of her home. 

She is asking for a new loan to be able to buy to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, sweets, sweet bread etc. and therefore be able to earn more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, sweets, sweet bread etc.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “NUEVA GENERACION” una de ellas es la Sra. Dominga de 44 años soltera, se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles (verduras y frutas) todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su familia. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es tener un local propio donde pueda vender más de sus productos. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más productos comestibles (verduras y frutas) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez  la Sra. Dominga se encuentra sentada y se le distingue con un polo color azul con y pantalón jean azul, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo. Agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The members of this communal group, "Nueva Generacion" [New Generation], are responsible for their own distinct commercial activities. 

One of the members is Dominga, she is 44 years old, single, and earns a living selling groceries (fruits and vegetables) every day with the merit of moving forward. 

With her efforts she has managed to improve her home and support her family. 

She continues improving her business, and her biggest wish is to her her own shop so she can sell more products. 

She will invest the loan in buying more groceries (vegetables and fruits) and thus be able to earn more income.

At the photograph Dominga is seated, wearing a blue top with jeans. She is grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loan which makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy more groceries (fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Don Manuel es un señor muy esforzado que se dedica a la actividad de ganado de doble propósito. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de dos vacas, que le permitirán aumentar la producción de leche y carne en su finca y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Manuel is a very energetic man who works in the cattle business for dual purposes. He is requesting a loan of one million colons (1,000,000 CRC) to buy two cows. This will allow him to increase his production of milk and meat on his farm and in this way generate greater income.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is very thankful for her first Kiva and Nor Horizon partnership, thanks to which she bought a computer. Now she hopes for second deal with Kiva lenders.

She is 30 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region with her husband and two school-aged children. Kristine has higher pedagogical education, and she still works at the school as a teacher of Armenian language and literature. She also continues giving private courses at her house, for the pupils who will pass entrance examinations.

Now this time with her Kiva loan, Kristine wants to furnish her working room, where she gives private course. She wants to buy a table with chairs, and she also wants to buy some professional literature for her courses.

loans.use: to buy a table with chairs and some professional literature for her courses.

loans.name: Sarayi

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Sarayi, and she lives in Ddmashen village of the Gegharkunik region. She has a higher pedagogical education, and from 1986 until today, she has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian language and literature.

Sarayi mentions that she loves her work, and during the years, her profession became part of her life and her pupils all are very beloved for her.

Sarayi is married and she has two daughters (they are already married) and a son, who temporarily lives and works in the Russian Federation.

Sarayi, with this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, wants to buy a computer and also professional literature for her self-development and for getting aware of any innovations in the sphere of pedagogy.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature for her self-development and for being aware of any innovations in the sphere of pedagogy.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of five children, all of whom do not attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more stitching material such as spools of threads, laces and ribbons for completing maximum orders on time.

She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more stitching material such as spools of threads, laces and ribbons for completing maximum orders on time.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three sons. Her son has run a garments business for 8 years. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and manages the house hold finances.

Her son needs to purchase bulk quantities of different types of clothes but has insufficient funds to do so. Robina is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase these clothes for her son's business. Her son will also increase the size of his business to earn maximum profit with this loan.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's garments business.

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en: Zanib  has successfully built her business to sel animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a good number of customers and makes a good  income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. She requests a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more animals to increase her sales and gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis août 2015,rassemble des membres qui habitent la même localité et ont pour activité le commerce.

Hawa qui se trouve en position debout à la droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 47 ans,est mariée et mére de 03 filles.

Son activité est la vente d'arachide et de pâte d'arachide.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 100kg d'arachide à 400f le kg.Les 50 kg seront transformés en pâte et les 50 kg restant seront revendus.

Le bénéfice servira  à la nourriture , à la scolarité de ses enfants et à l'épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in August 2015, and is made up of members who live in the same district and work in commerce.
Hawa, who is standing on the right in the photo with her arm raised, is the leader of the group. She is 47 and married with three girls.
She sells peanuts and peanut paste.
With the loan, she plans to buy 100kg of peanuts at 400f a kilo. She will transform 50 kilos into paste, and she will sell the remaining 50 kg.
She will use the profits for food, school fees and savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Nairi

texts.en:
Nairi used her first Kiva loan to make their small flat more comfortable by purchasing kitchen and guest room furniture. Nairi lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region with her husband and two children.

She teaches biology and tutors private courses to help the pupils prepare for entrance exams. Nairi hopes that Kiva lenders will accept her loan request to buy a computer, accessories, and professional literature for her courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories, and professional literature for her courses.

loans.name: Santhiaba Rural Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait ce groupe a été inauguré le 09 juillet 2002. Ce groupe porte le nom de "goorgoorlu" et compte huit membres. Madame Lena qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 63 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de balais, d'huile de palme et du poisson sec depuis plus de dix années. Avec le prêt sollicité elle compte renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en: The banc villageois to which the members of this group belong, was inaugurated on the 9th of July 2002. This group is called “goorgoorlu” and is made up of eight members. Mrs. Lena, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is a widow aged 63 with five children of which four girls. She has been selling brooms, palm oil, and dried fish for over 10 years. She plans to reinforce her business with the loan that she requests. She will use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy brooms, palm oil, and dried fish.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima has successfully built her business to sell animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a good customer base and earns a good income to contribute to the family's needs.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals, increase her sales, and earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is 28 years old and is a married woman. She is a mother of 2 children.

Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She aspires to save money to provide a prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 33 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 45-year-old Palestinian refugee who grew up in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. He and his wife have been married for 10 years and they have four children, ages 7, 5 , and 2 years old.

Khaled couldn't afford to go to school, so he started working at a young age in different businesses in order to support his parents. He worked for a long time as a painter but the high competition and unstable revenue made him switch to a different industry. He recently opened a small coffee shop in a very popular street of the camp to sell gas, coal and grills. The shop is the only shop of its kind in the area and has done very well since it's opening in 2013. His wife also helps him run the business during the day.

Khaled is asking for a 2,057,996 LBP loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. The loan will allow him to sell new items and increase his sales especially with the beginning of the winter season that brings high demand for gas and coal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 50-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 8 children.

Her son has been running a general store for the past 15 years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Yasmeen's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints her son is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes.

Therefore Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all these commodities and will also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's general store business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. She has had a boutique for three years. She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to increase her stock of skirts, blouses, braids, scarves, and cosmetics.

She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and help meet the family's budget. Her hopes and dreams are to have a large business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of braids, clothes, chemicals, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Miriam Mirella

texts.es:
La señora Mirian una mujer luchadora, tiene 26 años casada su esposo trabaja en una empresa empacadora de pollos desde hace 5 meses el mismo trabaja y pasa en Quito regresa a ver a su familia todos los fines de semana, tienen 4 hijos ellos viven en el Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado Recinto San Juan de Pto. Quito ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha. 
Mirian trabaja en una tienda de víveres y en una quinta del sector junto a su esposo luchan día a día para que el futuro de sus hijos sea diferente al que ellos pasaron.
Mirian desea emprender en una pequeña finca porcina cuenta con el espacio a este negocio le dedicará un promedio de 3 horas diarias sus hijos serán quienes le ayuden en el negocio y su esposo los fines de semana, Doña Mirian y su esposo aprovechan al máximo los momentos que tienen de descanso para pasar buenos momentos en familia. 
Doña Mirian tiene muchos sueños futuros como lo es tener su casa propia, y también le gustaría que su granja porcina sea una de las mejores y dejar de trabajar en lo ajeno. 
Este préstamo ayudara a Doña Mirian a mejorar su calidad de vida y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos , agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como ella que por falta de oportunidades no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en: Mrs. Miriam is a hard working woman, she is 26 years old, married, and her husband has worked for a poultry processing farm for the last 5 months. He works in Quito and comes back to see the family every weekend. They have 4 children, and live in the Pedro Vicente Maldonado neighborhood, Recinto San Juan de Puerto Quito, located northwest in the Pichincha province. Miriam works in a grocery store in a shopping district in the area. She and her husband work day after day to make their children's future different from what they went through. Miriam wants to start a pig farm, she has the space and wants to dedicate 3 hours per day to the business. Her children will help with the business during the week and her husband on weekends. Miriam and her husband take advantage of their time off to spend good times with the family. Miriam has many dreams such as have her own house and also to have the pig farm become one of the best and work for herself. This loan will help her to improve her quality of life and to provide a better future for her children. She thanks Kiva for the support they bring to people like her who due to a lack of opportunities, have not been able to develop their dreams.

loans.use: To start a pig farm, so that he can improve her quality of life and offer a better future for her children.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a responsible woman with 2 children, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been providing taxi services for 15 years. Her son is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family. He needs to maintain his Taxi because the current condition is not good. He has insufficient funds and is unable to repair his taxi. Therefore Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan.

Shamim's son will use the loan to repair his taxi and provide better services to earn an income. Shamim also plans to save some income to meet her family's future needs.

Shamim is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez  has successfully built her general store business  with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a good number of customers and earns enough income to contribute to the family's income. She used a previous loan to expand her business. She requests 40,000 PKR to purchase  grains, sugar, flour, and rice to meet customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase  grains, sugar, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su casa, por eso posee muchos clientes, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus hijo, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman shown in the photo is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, she has earned a living selling shoes for 2 years.

Her business is located in a zone with high footfall near to her house, which is why she has a lot of clients. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her child. 

With the earnings she makes she is able to cover the costs of her house. She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale shoes to be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
This man is greatly thankful for his first Kiva deal and hopes to have a second partnership. Manuk, in the village Lchashen of the Gegharkunik region, lives with his wife (she is a housewife), son (he is a student and also the veterinarian of the village), and daughter (she is also a student).

Manuk has always been engaged in farming and now also he is busy with his farm’s cattle care. In his farm he has cows, calves, a pig and piglets. The sale of his farm products such milk, macun (a national dairy-product), and meat make up his family income. Their needs are many with the costs of their children’s education.

Manuk asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as now his farm cattle has a lack of fodder. He wants to buy fodder for all his farm cattle, since little by little he wants to start the storage of animal fodder, because in the autumn and winter seasons there is usually more need for it.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all his farm cattle in order to start storing animal fodder, as the need is greater in colder seasons.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is a 49-year-old man who lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. He has avocational education and is an engineer. Hakob is married and lives with his wife, daughter, and retired mother. His son is at the army. Hakob has health problems which greatly influenced the quality of his life.

He will be very thankful if Kiva lenders help him with the loan amount of 700,000 AMD to solve his health problems.

loans.use: to solve his health problems.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a good number of customers and earns enough income to contribute to the family's income.

She used a previous loan to expand her business and now requests 60,000 PKR to purchase grains, sugar, flour, and rice to meet customers' demands..

loans.use: to purchase  grains, sugar, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Merita Yuliana

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, aquí se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 15 De Abril.
En este lugar vive la señora Merita, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 3 años. El cónyuge es comerciante de frutas, queso, pescado, etc. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Merita se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos o tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual se dedica a la venta de pescado, frutas y queso,  el sale a recorrer por la localidad vendiendo sus productos y con lo que ella hace con la venta de pollos les sirve para sacar adelante su hogar y a su hija.
Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar  pescado por libras, frutas, queso y alimento para los pollos. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Su sueño es  tener una casa de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
El Carmen canton stands out for it's agriculture. They grow Barraganete plantains, coffee, cocoa, corn and a wide variety of fruit. As for livestock raising the most important are raising cattle, horses, pigs and poultry. The "15 De Abril" communal bank meets here.

Merita lives here. She is 19 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has a three year old daughter. Her partner is a vendor of fruit, cheese, fish, etc. They live in their own house.

Merita works raising poultry. She has a small farm at her house. From time to time she buys large quantities of chickens which she raises for two or three months at which time they are ready to sell. After that she delivers them to a few stores in her area. She will also give part of the loan to her husband who works selling fish, fruit and cheese. He goes out in the community selling his products and with what she makes from her chicken sales they get ahead with her household and daughter.

This loan will be used to buy fish by the pound, fruit, cheese and feed for her chickens. This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it for the support the loans provide. Her dream is to have a concrete house as the one they have is made of cane.

loans.use: to buy fish by the pound, fruit, cheese and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Stiven Alfredo

texts.es: Stiven es un joven de 22 años que creció en medio del negocio de su padre un pintor y latonero reconocido en un sector del municipio de Barranquilla y que se inclinó por la parte mecánica de los vehículos; mientras que su padre manejaba únicamente la parte estética de los vehículos, él quiso aprender sobre la reparación y el mantenimiento de los mismos. Stiven ejerce hace cinco años en su propio taller esta actividad y gracias a su buen servicio y respaldo, ha logrado captar a un amplio grupo de clientes entre ellos taxistas y autos particulares que llegan hasta su negocio, todos los días de la semana buscando una solución a sus problemas automotores.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en repuestos e insumos necesarios para el óptimo funcionamiento de su trabajo.  Con esta inversión podrá acortar los tiempos de respuestas y presentar una mejor oferta a sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es arreglar la parte locativa de su taller y ayudar a su mamá y aportar para el estudio de sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Stiven, 22, is a young man who grew up in the midst of his father's business. He was known in an area of the town of Barranquilla for his painting and body work. Stiven was inclined toward the mechanical aspect of cars. While his father handled just the aesthetic aspect of the vehicles, Stiven wanted to learn about their maintenance and repair.

Stiven has been in this line of work in his own business for five years and he has managed to attract an extensive clientele thanks to his good service and support. Taxi drivers and private cars patronize his business every day looking for solutions to the problems with their cars.

Currently he's applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in spare parts and the supplies he needs for his optimal performance at work. With this loan he'll be able to shorten his response time and give his customers a better offer.

Stiven's goal for the future is to fix up his shop space, help his mother, and contribute to his siblings' education.

loans.use: to invest in spare parts and supplies

loans.name: Yubelys

texts.es: Yuberlis es una microempresaria que emprendió la iniciativa de su cónyuge cuando le propuso ser empresaria independiente e incorporarse en el sector de los alimentos en el año 2010, idea que fortaleció al hallar oportunidad de negocio entre los habitantes del sector donde reside al sur de Barranquilla y sobre todo el know-how de su cónyuge un panadero experto empleado de una cadena prestigiosa de supermercados de la ciudad. Así que no hubo lugar a la duda,  su repostería iba a ser exitosa y con todo el entusiasmo y la dedicación, inició una campaña de promoción de sus distintos productos; tortas para toda ocasión, galletería, dulces y pasabocas, comercializados a sus clientes por pedidos.  Así fue el inicio de su sueño de prosperidad, sin embargo Yubelis desea ampliar la gama de productos que actualmente comercializa y para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de equipos de panadería y así poder desarrollar adecuadamente la actividad.  Yuberlis adicionalmente a su actividad principal comercializa mercancías varias que le representan una ganancia extra.  Su meta a futuro es adecuar su negocio con la mejor infraestructura que le permita ser reconocido en el sector. En lo personal desea tener casa propia y garantizarles a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad un techo estable.
texts.en:
Yuberlis is a small-scale business who set up a business on her partner's initiative when he suggested that she became an independent business woman in the food sector in 2010.

This idea was strengthened when she had a business opportunity in the area where she lives, in the south of Barranquilla. Her partner has the know-how as he is an expert bread-maker employed at a prestigious chain of supermarkets in the city. 

Given that there is no room for doubt, her baking will be popular with enthusiasm and dedication. She started a promotion campaign for her own products, cakes for all occasions, biscuits, sweets and snacks, which she sells to-order. 

This was the start of her prosperous dream, however Yubelis wishes to grow her range of products that she sells at the moment, and therefore she is applying for a Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. She will invest in in buying bread-making equipment and this be able to sufficiently develop this activity. 

In addition to this, Yuberlis currently sells various goods which earn her extra money. Her future goal is to improve her business with a better infrastructure which will allow her to become known in the sector. 

Her personal wish is to have her own house and guarantee her 4 young children a stable home.

loans.use: to invest in buying bread-making equipment

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita creció en medio del negocio familiar de las confecciones y mientras su madre cosía no pasaba desapercibida para ella, puesto que también sentía inclinación por este arte y cuando apenas era una niña elaboraba vestidos para sus muñecas.  En la medida que se fue haciendo una jovencita se interesó mucho más y busco capacitarse para poder ejercer esta profesión. Su taller lo aperturó en el año 2000 y sin embargo su experiencia es de 25 años, cuenta con una amplia clientela a quienes confecciona todo tipo de prenda femenina y sus clientas se han mantenido fieles con el pasar del tiempo, pues brinda un excelente servicio y elabora sus prendas con diseños exclusivos.  Su demanda se ha incrementado y próximamente será mucho más por la temporada que se aproxima, por lo que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una maquina recubridora para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.  Con esta inversión fortalecerá su infraestructura técnica y su capacidad de producción.  Su meta a futuro es tener una producción tan voluminosa que le permita contratar dos empleados  y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos costeándoles sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Margarita grew up in the family apparel business and her mother's sewing did not go unnoticed. Since she was a little girl she also felt inclined to do this art and used to make dresses for her dolls. Once she grew into a young woman she became much more interested and sought training to practice this profession. 

She opened her workshop in 2000, although she has 25 years experience. She has a large clientele for whom she manufactures all kinds of ladies' garments. Her clients have remained loyal with the passage of time since she offers excellent service and makes garments with unique designs. Her demand has increased and soon will soon grow even more with the upcoming season, which is why she applied for a Kiva  loan. 

This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will invest in an overlock sewing machine to improve the quality of her products. This investment will strengthen her technical infrastructure and production capacity. Her future goal is to have such a voluminous output that she is able to hire two employees and to give a better future to her children by paying for their college education.

loans.use: to invest in an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN MADRE DE FAMILIA QUE TRABAJA POR SU CUENTA VENDIENDO ARTÍCULOS DE CATALOGO PARA AYUDAR EN EL GASTO FAMILIAR. PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES LOS CUALES LE HAN PROVOCADO FUERTES DOLORES E INFLAMACIÓN EN LAS ENCÍAS POR LO QUE REQUIERE DE UN TRATAMIENTO QUE LAMENTABLEMENTE PARA SU ECONOMÍA LE RESULTA COSTOSO.
texts.en:
She is a young mother who works independently selling catalog items in order to help with the family expenses.

She has dental problems, which have caused severe pain and gum inflammation. This requires a treatment that, sadly, is very expensive for her.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora sostiene económicamente su hogar y a su hija, ella es viuda. Actualmente labora como empleada en una empresa. Su hija necesita un tratamiento de ortodoncia pues sus dientes presentan un problema severo de apiñonamiento, lo que le ha provocado alteración en la mandíbula, aparte del evidente problema estético. El tratamiento le resulta muy costoso para su economía.
texts.en:
This woman financially supports her household and her daughter. She is a widow. She currently works as an employee for a company.

Her daughter needs orthodontic treatments. She has a problem of her teeth being severely crowded. This has caused a change in her jaw, in addition to the obvious aesthetic problem. The treatment is very expensive for her.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III.
La socia Biviana alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Biviana is a member of the Comuzone III communal bank. Her daily business activities include raising young animals and then selling them to clients who request them. Biviana has been involved in this activity for quite awhile, thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.

She wants to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family. She is asking for this Kiva loan in order to buy animals, among other things. Biviana is grateful for this loan and is committed to making the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to purchase animals, among other things.

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, aquí se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 15 De Abril.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha,  tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es guardia informal de unos kioscos de frutas que se ubican en la vía. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Martha se dedica a la cría de cerdos y  pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa,  en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos o tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Los cerdos en cambio los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 3 años dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para pollos como y chanchos. Es su reingreso al Grupo De Crédito y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho y le gusta la unión del grupo. Su sueño es tener la casa terminada y hacer una cisterna de agua grande para que nunca le falte el agua.
texts.en:
The El Carmen canton stands out for agriculture. Barraganete bananas, coffee, cacao, corn, and a great variety of fruits are grown there. Regarding livestock, it stands out for raising cows, horses, pigs, and poultry. This is where the 15 De Abril communal bank meets.

Martha, age 65, lives in this place. She is married, and they have five grown and independent children. Her husband provides security for some fruit kiosks down the road. They live in their own house. Martha raises pigs and chickens. She has a small farm at her house. During seasons she buys a great quantity of chickens. She raises them for two or three months, which is the time for them to be ready to sell. After this time she delivers them to some stores in the area. She also sells by the pound or live to merchants who come to her house. On the other hand, she butchers the pigs and then sells the meat by the pound. She has been doing this work for three years, and it has gone pretty well for her because it is a way of earning something from her house.

She will use the new loan to buy chickens, feed, and medication for the chickens and the pigs. She has rejoined her communal bank, and she is very happy because they have helped her a lot and she likes the togetherness of the group.

Her dream is to have her house finished and to build a large cistern to store water so that she never runs out of water.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medication for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 32 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has three children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her neighborhood. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching.

Rukhsana’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Rukhsana has requested a loan amount of 35,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 54 years old and she lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. She graduated from Yerevan State Linguistic University. Since 1985 til today, she has been working at the village school as a German language teacher.

She mentions that usually her pupils have some hardships with learning this language, especially with the rules of grammar. She says she is always ready and patient to help each of them and to explain once more. She is happy and inspired with the achievement and success of each of them.

Susanna is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, as she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature for self-development activities after her work at the school.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature for self-development activities after her work at the school

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala, age 37, is a mother of four children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money her husband finds it difficult.

This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his wife, Ghazala, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

Her husband will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials. Ghazala is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: because her husband wants to increase his embroidery business.

loans.name: Aalan

texts.en:
Aalan is 43 years old. She is a married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area.

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has one child. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales, so she can earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is 50 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking.

She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is 48 years old. She is a married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Zeenat ’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Zeenat has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem has successfully built her general store business with the support of the Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained many customers and makes a good income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase stock of grocery items, such as grains, sugar, flour, and rice. It will help her to meet customers' demands on time.

loans.use: to purchase stock of grocery items, such as grains, sugar, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Carmen Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 
Teresa continua dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas, fideos, gaseosa entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir payando a su familia.
En esta oportunidad Teresa requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia Teresa se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa continues participating in Asociación Arariwa's communal bank "Comuzone III" in the city of Cusco. She continues to work selling groceries, such as rice, sugar and milk. She also sells other types of goods such as candy, noodles, soda and others that her customers request.

She has had her business for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She would like to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

At this time, she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, and other goods. Teresa is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Alfredo Uzziel

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III.
El socio Alfredo alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose para una institución pública, el socio  lleva buen tiempo en su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, a la vez el socio tiene un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio  solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz y azúcar entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone III.

Alfredo alternates between his daily activities. He works for a public institution and has been at this job for a long time. It is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it every day, and he would like to continue working to keep on supporting his family. At the same time, he has a business selling groceries, this being the way he is getting his family ahead.

He is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar and other products. He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Mou's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Mou is a 55-year-old and he has three children. To make a living, he grows cassava and rice which has supported his living condition for 37 years. The insect pests affected his crop so he has had lower outputs, and he can earn about 9.00 USD per day to support his children and wife. After offsetting expenses, he is able to save around 5.00 USD each day for emergency needs.

This is the fourth loan cycle for him with VisionFund, and the past loans, which enabled him to improve his living standard, were repaid successfully. He is now leading a group of two members to apply for a new loan and he will use his portion of loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support his farming.

He hopes to earn more income so that he can expand his current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase his crop yield as well as his income so that he can expand his current business.

loans.name: Mirian Maribel

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, aquí se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 15 De Abril.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos de 14, 16 y 9  años que estudian 2 en colegio y 1 escuela. Su esposo es ayudante de una tienda y de un balneario los fines de semana.
Doña Mirian para salir adelante junto a su familia, tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja de lunes a viernes en su tienda y los fines de semana en un balneario cercano que es de propiedad familiar. El balneario abren todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y es  su esposo el que le ayuda en este trabajo.  Tiene 15 años  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 1 año y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Su sueño es  que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The town of El Carmen is distinguished in its agriculture by its cultivation of barraganete bananas, coffee, cacao, corn and a wide variety of fruit. The livestock primarily raised are cattle, horses, pigs, and poultry birds. This is where the loan group "15 de Abril" meets.

It is in this place where Mirian lives. She is 40 years old, married, and she and her husband have 3 children ages 14, 16, and 9. Two of her children are in high school and one is in primary school. Her husband is an assistant at a store and works at a resort on the weekends.

In order to get her family ahead, Mirian has a grocery store in her home. Here she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, vegetables, greens, and fruit. She works in her store from Monday to Friday and works in a nearby resort on the weekends, which is owned by a relative. The resort is open every day from 8:00am to 8:00pm and it is her husband who helps her in this job. She has 15 years at this job and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to stock her store, buying rice, sugar, oil, soaps, meat, and other grocery goods. This is the loan groups first year and she likes it because she has made friends in the group. Her dream is for her children to finish school and become professionals.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 39-year-old lady and a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own welding shop for past 20 years. Shazia's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise such as iron, steel, and machinery, etc. for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill the needs of her husband, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for business purposes. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him in fulfilling his family's needs,

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his welding business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Hog raising is a practical endeavor that helps alleviate the food shortage in the community. Christopher, aged 35, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, has been running this business for only four years, and he’s convinced that it is such a profitable enterprise that offers affordable food for the community. As of now, he fattens nine hogs, while his wife, Rubilyn, operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Their combined income sustains their daily needs and the education of their small children.

But the problem in Christopher’s location is a shortage of water that affects the operation of his business. He plans to address this difficulty by putting up a deep well water pump in his backyard. He needs to buy a motor pump, pipes, hollow blocks, cement, and other materials necessary in this project. He is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan for this purpose.
