He will use part of the loan to buy feed and additional supplies for his variety store. He’s hoping that kind hearted lenders will extend valuable help to him as it will surely make a great difference in the operation of his small piggery.

He shares his experiences and aspirations with his co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and business, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials for a deep well water pump.

loans.name: Aasma

texts.en:
Aasma is the responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 20 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs to his taxi because the current condition of the vehicle is not good. It requires more maintenance costs every day. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make repairs to his taxi. Therefore Aasma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Aasma's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. With the taxi in good condition, he will be able to provide better transportation services and earn a more profitable income. Aasma also plans to grow their savings with the profit in order to meet her family's needs in the future.

Aasma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Akhtari

texts.en:
Akhtari is a 42-year-old lady and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own masala packing business for the past 12 years. Akhtari's husband needs to purchase merchandise such as shoppers and paper banding for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise.

To fulfill the need of her husband, Akhtari has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for his business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will help him to fulfill his family's needs

Akhtari is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's packing masala business

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en:
Emilita, 54, dreams of building several units of apartments in her current boarding house, and provide a stable source of income for her family and relatives. She is married to Juveniano, a crane operator, but she still desires to help her siblings, nieces and nephews. She wants to see that they have good living conditions. She owns a boarding house in Buhangin, Davao City, and runs a small canteen adjacent to it. She has been into this combined endeavor for 10 years already and it’s been a helpful source of their everyday sustenance.

Now she aspires to build an extension of the boarding house to maximize the number of renters. In this way, she can give additional financial support to her relatives. She applied for a PHP 25,000 loan, which she will use to buy wood, galvanized iron sheets, cement, hollow blocks, sand, and other construction materials. She is hoping that you can help her as she aspires to help her relatives too.

Emilita is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy wood, galvanized iron sheets, cement, hollow blocks, sand, and other construction materials

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 33 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which provides the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money, he is unable to. He wants to be able to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. To help her husband, Uzma is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

Uzma's husband will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Uzma feels happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina, 51 years old, is a single mother of one boy whom she lives with in her own house. Sabina sells shoes by catalog, going to many places, such as offices and fairs, to offer the shoes. She needs a loan to buy more shoes to offer to her customers. Sabina hopes you can help her because she is the sole supporter of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to offer to her customers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old. He is married with five children.

He has had a business selling goats and sheep for eight years.

He will be using the loan to purchase more goats to sell to his clients and hopes this will help him pay school fees.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have many livestock and other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell to his clients to help him pay school fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is growing mangoes. She has been in the business for 38 years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenya shillings).

This is Elizabeth's first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chemicals to spray mangoes against weevils.

She will use the profits from expanded business to improve her standard of living. Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to spray mangoes against weevils.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 39 years old. She is married and has two children. Her business is growing mangoes, maize, beans and cow peas. She has been in the business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES (Kenya shillings).

This is Ruth's first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use part of the loan to build a granary for storing crops and will use the other part to buy chemicals to spray mangoes against weevils.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to build a granary for storing crops and also to buy chemicals for spraying mangoes against weevils.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, 30 years old, is married and has one child. He has two businesses: motorcycle taxi and farming. He has been in business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 36,000 KES.

This is Patrick's second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a new engine for his motorcycle. He will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his child and to buy food for the family. Patrick's hope and dream is to own a fleet of motor cars for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is 37 years old and a mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall selling different types of eatable items such as samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, and Kabab paratha. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Fareeda's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Fareeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Rosapata De Mika Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ROSAPATA DE MIKA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Colquepata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Martina tiene 61 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank ROSAPATA DE MIKA. It is located in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.

Martina is 61 years old and has one child and is married. She alternates her daily activities earning a living in agriculture. She has been doing this for a long time and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into the business everyday. She is a responsible person and hopes to be able to continue working so as to continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertiliser.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the repayments set out.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 31 years old. She is married and has three children. For the past two years, she has been raising livestock and farming mangoes. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenyan shillings. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chemicals to spray the mangoes and protect them from weevils. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay her children's school fees. Her hope and dream is to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to spray mangoes to protect them from weevils.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 39 years old. He is married and has six children.

His business is selling cereals like maize, beans, cow peas, and green grams as well as farming.

He has been in this business for 14 years. He earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenya shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs of seedlings, fertilizer and farm chemicals.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams are to own a big business and have a healthy and educated family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of seedlings, fertilizer and farm chemicals.

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is 46 years old. She is married and has five children. Her business is growing maize, beans, cow peas, oranges and mangoes. 

Milcah has been in the business for 28 years. She earns a monthly income of 28,000 KES (Kenya shillings). This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to pay for farm ploughing. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children and to improve the family’s standard of living. Her hopes and dreams are to have dairy cows and a stable family.

loans.use: to pay for farm ploughing

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky has received a number of loans from Kiva and has always repaid them on time. She thanks Kiva and CCT (Center for Community Transformation) for their continued moral and financial support. Those loans have helped sustain her mineral water distribution business and enabled her to start selling eggs as well.

Although Jinky sometimes encounters difficulty collecting her receivables, she maintains her positive attitude and understands that things will get better. She is again humbly asking for your help of PHP 15,000 to pay for several gallons of mineral water and several trays of eggs to sell in her community. Your assistance with her business is greatly appreciated.

Jinky's simple motto is to grow her business and find more means of livelihood so she can assist some of her children who are in need. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional mineral water and dozens of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Tania Paola

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, aquí se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 15 De Abril.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 4, 3 y 1 año. El cónyuge es comerciante de frutas. Tiene casa propia.
Doña Tania es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo para damas, caballeros y niños. Además de Frutas de temporada como mandarinas, naranjas, papayas, etc. y verduras como pimientos, pepinos, etc. Cuando ella puede le ayuda al esposo ya que tiene la venta en la misma casa desde hace 8 años. Trabaja en la venta de zapatos tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cuatro años a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son zapatos para caballeros.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos para caballeros ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Lleva un año en el grupo de crédito  y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es  tener un carro para hacer recorridos distribuyendo tanto los zapatos como frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The canton El Carmen is known for agriculture. Barraganete bananas, coffee, cocoa, corn, and a wide variety of fruit are grown there. In ranching, cattle, horse, pig, and poultry breeding stand out. It is also where the credit group "15 de abril" [15th of April] meets.

Here lives Tania. She is 20 years old and in a civil union, from which she has three children, ages 4, 3, and 1. Her husband is a fruit salesman. She owns her house.

Tania is a housewife who, in order to earn her own money and be able to help her husband with the household expenses, works selling women's, men's, and children's shoes by catalog. She also sells seasonal fruits, such as mandarins, oranges, papayas, etc. and vegetables such as peppers, cucumbers, etc.

When she can, she helps her husband because, for the past 8 years, she has made sales from their own home. She sells shoes three days a week, from 2 to 3 hours a day. She sells her products on credit, and collects every 8 days. She has 4 years of experience in the business, and it is going very well for her. Men's shoes are what she sells the most.

This loan is to buy men's shoes, as she has many requests. She has been part of the group for one year, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a car in order to make rounds distributing shoes as well as fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
48-year-old Ana lives in Buhangin, Davao City, where she runs her small general store. Ana notices that her store is not that appealing to customers due to her limited stock, as many customers prefer a store with wide variety of selections. 

Therefore, Ana wants to borrow PHP 10,000 to buy supplies, including grocery items, beverages, and rice. The additional stock will enhance the competitiveness of her store within her community. If her store grows and improves, Ana plans to control and slightly lower the retail price of her goods to attract more buyers. 

With increased sales and profit, she will be able to sufficiently meet her family’s basic needs and children's school expenses. Her husband, Fernando, is very supportive of Ana and her business. They both work diligently to enrich their lives and prepare for the future. They dream of seeing their children finish their schooling and acquire stable jobs in the future. 
 
Ana meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies, including grocery items, beverages, and rice

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Yeng, aged 30, is married and blessed with two dependent children, one of whom is being educated in school and the youngest one who is under the age of school. She lives with her family in Tbaung Khmum province. About USD 16 is earned every single day from cassava growing, the main business, and rice growing and working as a paid worker, the additional businesses. Yeng can save approximately USD 9 each day for financial security in the future. She and her husband have been involved in the farming business for 12 years. The obstacle to the farming business is over growing of weeds on farmland which causes crops to grow unhealthily.

Yeng has formed a group of two to apply for a loan from VisionFund, which will be her first cycle. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to support her cassava and rice farming businesses. With this loan, she hopes that it will enable her farming businesses to grow well and return high crop yields so that she can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to support her cassava and rice farming businesses.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a 35-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is a single mom of a one-year-old girl. Marilou works hard to sustain her daughter's needs. She buys and sells Boholanos' well-known delicacies: “calamay” (a coconut milk candy jam; coconut milk heated and mixed with brown sugar and ground rice) and “peanut kisses” (made from selected high grade peanuts, roasted and processed, with all natural ingredients, that comes out crunchy and low cholesterol).  Marilou is asking for a loan to buy more of these delicacies to sell. In the future, she wishes to improve her business, increase her livelihood and have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy more delicacies (calamay and peanut kisses) to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives and works in the village of Harij, Shirak region, with her elderly retired father and her son, who currently serves in the military. Anna is the only one who takes care of their family farm and she works hard to gather some income for living. She currently keeps a cow, two calves and twenty hens. Near the house, in the family's plot of land, Anna also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes, which she personally sells in the market.

Anna is asking for this loan to make some improvements on her farm; she plans to purchase two calves, forage for feeding the cattle and wheat seeds for the autumn cultivation season.

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Anna's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living. Despite the bad socioeconomic conditions in the village, Anna wants to stay in her motherland and be an example for all the young families to work and develop their country.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, forage for feeding the cattle and wheat seeds for the autumn cultivation season.

loans.name: Diamoral Cap Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 01 juin 2011. Ce groupe est constitué de quatre membres engagée et dynamique qui s'activent dans le commerce et remboursent leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Ya Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 43 ans et mère de trois filles. Elle s'active depuis plusieurs années dans la vente de poissons séchés et des fruits. Elle capitalise une expérience avérée dans son domaine d'activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was started on June 1, 2011. This group is made up of four committed and energetic members who are businesswomen that successfully pay back their loans.

Mrs. Ya Fatou, who is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married and is 43 years old. She has three daughters.

For many years, she has been selling dried fish and fruit. She has built up proven experience in her business area. The profits will help her husband with taking care of the family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and fruit.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 29 years old and she lives in Sevan city in the Ggegharkunik region. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Her husband is a construction worker. Anna has vocational medical education and now she works at a local hospital as a nurse. Anna requests this Kiva loan because one of her daughters has some health problems. She is very upset and worried. She will be unbelievably happy if Kiva lenders help her with this loan amount of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD) that she will use for the solution to her child’s health problem.

loans.use: to pay for the solution to her child’s health problem

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola, 56 years old, is from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is a single woman who works hard to support herself. Teodola is engaged in selling home-cooked meals and has also run a sari-sari (convenience store) business for three years. Teodola sell various items such as candies, chips, biscuits, spices, cooking oil, coconut, salted fish and toiletries.

Teodola is asking for a loan to buy baking powder, meat, spices, oil, a frying pan, noodles, canned food and biscuits. She hopes to continue expanding and have an increase in her income so that she will have the chance to save for old age and live comfortably. Her income will pay for food and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy baking powder, meat, spices, oil, a frying pan, noodles, canned food and biscuits.

loans.name: Femmes Catholiques Cap Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en 2011. Ce groupe est constitué de onze membres qui s'activent dans le commerce et remboursent toujours leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Mariama qui est la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentant du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 33 ans et mère de huit enfants dont six filles. Depuis plusieurs années elle s'active dans la vente de lait et des arachide. Elle va acheter du lait en quantité et plusieurs sacs d'arachides avec le prêt sollicité. Elle est très battante et très engagée. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille et épargner.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' that this group belongs to was created in 2011. This group is made up of 11 members who are businesswomen and always successfully pay back their loans.

Mrs. Mariama, who is on the right side of the photograph with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married and is 33 years old. She has eight children, six of whom are girls.

For many years, she has been selling milk and peanuts. With this loan, she will purchase a large supply of milk and many bags of peanuts. She is high achieving and very engaged. The profits will be used to help her husband with taking care of the family and saving money.

loans.use: to buy milk and peanuts.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry, es un grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Santaní, se encuentran en el primer ciclo con 19 integrantes. Todas ellas están convencidas de que a través del trabajo unido de todas puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Cesia por su laboriosidad, se dedica a la venta de ropas para niños, jóvenes y adultos, de distintas marcas y modelos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar en su pequeño negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando además por poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The committee named “Kuña Katupyry” is a group that was formed in the city of Santaní. There are 19 members who are participating in their first loan cycle. All of them are convinced that they can improve their living conditions by working together.

Among the members is Sra. Cesia, who is known for her dedication. She sells clothing of different brands and styles for children, teenagers, and adults. Cesia is a hardworking woman who does everything she can to grow and improve her small business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes to sell. This will enable her to continue her work.

In addition, Cesia strives to provide her loved ones with everything that she was not able to have.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 31 years old, is married and has three children. For the past five years, she has operated two businesses: livestock sales and a retail shop, earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This is Ann's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy some goats and to pay school fees for the children. She will use the profits from her expanded business to increase shop stock. Her hopes and dreams are to open a supermarket and to educate her children to university

loans.use: to buy some goats and to pay school fees for the children.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet, 61 years old, lives with his son in the village of Tsaghkunk, in the Gegharkunik region. He also has a daughter who is already married and living with her family. Hamlet worked as a driver for many years but now he is busy with farming and agricultural activities. On his farm he has cows, heifers, bulls, sheep and chickens and produces milk, cheese, meat and eggs. Hamlet also sells his land’s potatoes, greens and tomatoes. His farming is of great pleasure for him and for his son, also, who greatly helps his father. Hamlet is asking for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Marco

texts.en: Marco is a single man with no children but he lives with his parents and helps them with the expenses. Marco works as a consultant but he is enthusiastic about starting his own business. Marco needs a loan to buy appliances to sell by going to many places such as offices, houses and fairs. Marco has experience in electricity so he thinks he is ready to have an extra job that will give him an extra income. He hopes you can help him because he supports his parents.

loans.use: to buy appliances to sell by going to many places such as offices, houses and fairs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 30s, is married. She has two children; one of them is in school and other is still small. She has been running a retail shop for three years now. She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rose's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her stock of fast-moving items like sugar, beans, salt, cigarettes, sweets, etc. She dreams of expanding her business.

Rose will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fast-moving items like sugar, beans, salt, cigarettes, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Delmy Concepcion

texts.es: Delmy de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delmy is a 39-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her three children. She has a store at her house that she has managed for the past five years. With the income she earns from her sales, Delmy is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products. This will enable her to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Yomaira Tatiana

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Nuevas Semillas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Yomaira, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en escuela.
Doña Yomaira es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos para que no le falte lo necesario a sus hijos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio,  vende  ropa, zapatos carteras y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi   todos los días ya sea a vender o a cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra  cada semana. De esta forma ella  logra ganar el sustento de su familia, ella lleva más de 10 años dedicada al comercio actividad que le permite sacar adelante sola a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 6 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The loan group Crédito Nuevas Semillas meets every two weeks in Jipijapa canton which is well known for a type of coffee, for its extensive coffee plantations, the wonderful flavour of its coffee, its food, and for the warmth of its people.

24-year old Sra. Yomaira lives there. She is a single mother with two children aged 6 and 2. The elder one attends school. Yomaira has always enjoyed working and so has managed to support her family through her own resources to ensure they lack for nothing. She runs a business selling clothing, shoes, bags and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She goes door to door selling this merchandise and does so most days, either to sell or to collect weekly payments from her customers.

Yomaira is successfully supporting her family by herself through her business which she's had for more than ten years. The loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, bags, perfume, lotions, cosmetics and the other items she sells. She has been with this loan group for six years and enjoys it for the help it offers with loans. Her dream is to provide her children with the best she can.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, bags, perfume, lotions, cosmetics  etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly, 28 years old, is married to Stanley and blessed with two children, aged 12 and 7 years old. She has been operating her milk business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,000.

Nelly has applied for her fourth loan of KES 30,000, having cleared her previous loans successfully. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional gallons of milk for resale. Nelly plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to pay school fees for her children. Her future dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of milk for resale

loans.name: Apu Marcasunay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU MARCASUNAY”; Este banco se encuentra  ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gabina, la socia continua  dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta formas seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos.
Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
El socio que sale adjunta en la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These people are members of the Apu Marcasunay community bank located in Lamay district, in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Gabina who is continuing with her work raising animals such as guinea pigs. She's had her business for a while now and all is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in on a daily basis. Gabina is a responsible person who sells the animals once they are grown according to the orders placed by her customers. She wishes to continue with her work so she can carry on supporting her family.

Gabina is seeking a loan to buy guinea pigs and feed.

The members of the group are grateful to those lenders who help them reach their dreams. They promise to make the repayments according to the schedule.

The member who is in the small photo at the side asked permission to be late for the meeting because of his work.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and feed.

loans.name: G. S. Los Triunfadores Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. LOS TRIUNFADORES ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES INTEGRANTES DOS MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, MADRES Y PADRE RESPONSABLES DE  CINCO HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA ZONA PRODUCTORA DE LECHE, QUESO, CREMA,  ESTE GRUPO HA DEMOSTRADO SER RESPONSABLE CON SUS FORMAS DE PAGO,  EN LA ACTULIDAD LUCHAN PARA SACAR ADELANTE SUS DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICAS, CUMPLIR SUEÑOS Y METAS Y BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LA ESTABILIDAD QUE NECESITAN.
GRACIAS A SU PERSEVERANCIA LA CORDINADORA DEL G.S ES MARIBEL Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS LACTEOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, PRODUCTOS COMO: LECHE, QUESO, CUAJADA ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE HA SIDO LA FORMA DE SUBSISTENCIA DE  SU FAMILIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS LACTEOS PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS LOS TRIUNFADORES AGRADECEN LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Triunfadores Community Bank is made up of three members, two women and one man. Between them they are responsible for five young children. They are from Sauce which is known for being a productive area for milk, cheese, and cream. The group has shown responsibility in their repayments. They are working hard to make progress with their different jobs, with their dreams and goals, and to provide their children with the stability that they need.

Because of her dedication, the coordinator of the group is Maribel who sells products such as milk, cheese, cottage cheese etc. out of her home. She works eight hours a day selling the products. It is work that she really enjoys since it provides a way of feeding her family.

The loan money will be used to buy milk products for her store and satisfy the requirements of her customers. In the not too distant future she expects to earn more money.

The Triunfadores are grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to poor people in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have meaningful work.

loans.use: buy products such as milk, cottage cheese, cheese etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is thankful for the loan that was previously granted to her, which helped sustain her small general store. Through CCT's and Kiva's support she is encouraged to persevere despite the hardships of life.

Once again she needs funds in the amount of 8000 Philippines Pesos (PHP), to restock her retail store with beverages, canned goods, rice noodles, shampoo, and soaps. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income to meet her family's basic needs for the past ten years. Although there are days that her sales are low, she trusts that even then they will have enough.

Like most mini store owners, she dreams that one day she will own a big grocery store. She prays for abundance in all areas of life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Alex Javier

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, aquí se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 15 De Abril.
En este lugar vive señor Alex, tiene 19  años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres.
Don Alex es un joven muy trabajador, él tiene un puesto cerca de su casa en el cual vende plátano de variedad barraganete de exportación, esta actividad se la enseño su padre desde muy pequeño. El de madrugada se desplaza a recorrer las fincas del sector y al mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, el también en las tardes le ayuda a su papá en los cultivos de plátano, naranjas, mandarinas y yuca, productos que él también le ayuda a vender a su papá y con lo cual se gana algo extra que le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátanos de exportación para sus ventas.  Tiene dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo. Su sueño es poder comprar una camioneta para poder ahorrar en transporte, hacer mejor sus recorridos  y obtener mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
The El Carmen canton stands out for its agriculture. Barraganete plantain, coffee, cocoa, maize and a great variety of fruits are grown there. The rearing of cattle, horses, pigs and poultry is notable in livestock farming. Here is where the Grupo De Crédito 15 De Abril meet and where Alex lives. He is 19, single, does not have children and lives with his parents.

Alex is very hard-working. He owns a stand close to his house in which he sells exportation plantain of the barraganete variety. His father taught him this work when he was very young. He goes at dawn to the fields of this sector and to the wholesale market to buy the best products for his customers. In the afternoon he also helps his father in the plantain, orange, mandarin and cassava fields. He also helps him to sell these products thus earning some extra money that helps him to get ahead
.
He will use this loan to buy exportation plantain for his sales. He has participated in two loan cycles with the Grupo De Crédito and likes it because the group is very united. His dream is to be able to buy a van to save on transportation, improve his journeys and make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy exportation plantain.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es: Juan, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside en el municipio de las Flores Lempira, con su esposa e hijos. Juan se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y hortalizas. Y hace 2 años 4 meses inició con el cultivo y venta de café en una propiedad que tiene. La producción de café la vende en  pergamino, húmedo y seco.  Con el fin de mejorar la producción ha solicitado un prestamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago de trabajadores y darle buena asistencia a su finca de café. Su plan es ampliar la parcela que tiene cultivada y sembrar otros cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old and in a common-law relationship. He and his partner have four children and reside in the town of Las Flores Lempira. Juan grows corn, beans, and vegetables. Two years and four months ago, Juan began cultivating and selling coffee on his own property. The coffee he produces is sold in parchment, both moist and dried.

In order to improve his production, Juan has requested a loan of 12,000 HNL in order to buy fertilizers and pay the workers who do a good job of maintaining his coffee farm. His plan is to expand the parcel of land that he cultivates so that he can plant other crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workers who maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a doctor. She works hard. She has her medical office and she goes to work to the public insurance building every morning. Monica needs a loan because she wants to buy an x-ray machine for her medical office.

Monica pays rent. She is a single mother of two kids, and she hopes you can trust her. She would like to have a good laboratory in the future to help a lot of people.

loans.use: to buy an x-ray machine for her medical office

loans.name: Mkongoni Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her late thirties, is married with four children who are in school. She has been running projects for her pharmacy and poultry business for five years now. She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Hadija's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy medicine that was out of stock, and started running a poultry business. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profits to repay the loan, to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group Mkongoni, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chick and chicken feed and to buy fast-moving medicine.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.en:
Life hasn’t been easy for Jorge, but he’s a warrior that always looks ahead and comes through all the obstacles that he finds. He’s 32 years old and has two children, a son who is 6 and a daughter who is 8 years old. The whole family lives in the municipality of Sincelejo where Jorge has a washing machine rental business.

He works really hard in his business, around 10 hours per day, all the days of the weekend, because this is the way to give his family everything that they need. He wants to improve his business by increasing his sales so he can be more competitive in the market. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy three more washing machines to earn more money.

Jorge has many dreams, but paying for his children's education is his biggest one, because he hopes they can be professionals and make a great life for themselves. A little help can do a lot for Jorge and his family. Loan now and watch him succeed.

loans.use: buy three more washing machines to earn more money.

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en:
Godfred is a carver from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, polish, and beads, as well as make improvements to his workshop.

Godfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

As a child, Godfred used to make boats with worn-out metal utensils, which he'd float in water. "Due to financial constraints, my parents could not further my education and so I had to drop out of school and join my uncle, who was a wood carver. Thanks to the woodcarving, I've been able to educate my four children and I know that with constant sales, I'll be able to give them a brighter future than I had. This motivates me to wake up each day to carve!"

"Without all of you, I could not have been what I am today. I will always pray for your continued support, and thank you all in the name of Allah."

Use the link below to view Godfred's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7252

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, polish, and beads, as well as to make improvements to his workshop.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano previously received a loan through Kiva which definitely helped fund the maintenance and registration of his jeepney. It ensured safe and efficient service and, thus, continuous income to help support his family's needs.

He is again in need of funds in the amount of PHP 19,000 to pay for the license renewal, franchise, registration and maintenance of his jeepney. His transportation business means a lot to him for it helps to adequately provide for the family's daily needs and fund the education of his children.

To improve his income, he plans to buy another jeepney. He desires for his children to get a college education to allow them to have a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and it is there where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance, license, franchise and registration renewal of his jeepney.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late forties, is divorced with five children. Two of her children are in school, while the other three are grown up. She has been a food vendor for thirteen years now. She works from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to continue increasing her food stock and to start selling fabrics and bed sheets. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.

She has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, cover household expenses, repay loans, reinvest in the business to buy a plot of land. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe business, and increase her stock of fabrics and bed sheets. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Mariam will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule time.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe business and increase her stock of fabrics and bed sheets.

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov is a farmer with 16 years of experience. In Mkchchyan village of Ararat region, Lyubov and her family cultivate tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, and grapes. Lyubov lives with her husband, two sons and brother-in-law, and they all help her with the farming work.

Lyubov is excited to have a profitable and successful farm which will provide enough income for covering her family's basic costs. She has now applied for this loan to pay for partial renovation of the greenhouse, a cow and one calf.

As this is Lyubov's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

The loan that Lyubov has requested will be used for improving the farm and enlarging the business. Additional income would greatly assist Lyubov's family to cover their costs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for partial renovation of her greenhouse, a cow and one calf

loans.name: Erleina Del Carmen

texts.en:
Young people have the world in front of them, and for Erleina, this is very important because she wants to accomplish great things. She is just 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Tuchin. She has a 6-year-old son son with her boyfriend. She owns a business selling art crafts, which she started to help support her family's needs.

The weather of Tuchin is the biggest enemy of Erleina’s business, but that doesn’t stop her because she wants to see her business grow and be successful. She wants to improve her sales so her profits increase. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some craft products in cane like “sombreros vueltiaos” (turned hats, a really traditional Colombian hat).

This mother has many dreams, but right now she has a big need. Her house has some damage so she needs to repair it as fast as she can so her family can be safe and comfortable. You can help her achieve her goals with a loan; she will do a lot with it.

loans.use: buy some craft products in cane like “sombreros vueltiaos” (turned hats, a really traditional Colombian hat).

loans.name: Nadin Rafael

texts.en:
Nadin is 34 years old and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo. He has two children; a son who is 8 and a daughter who is 10 years of age. Nadin's family is the most important thing to him and the main reason to work hard and dream big. He owns a farm where he raises different kinds of birds that are sold later. He learned this thanks to a close friend.

He started this business for the needs that his family had and has, and he works hard not just to give to his family everything they need, but to make his business grow so it can be successful. He wants to improve his sales and to be more competitive in the market. He asked for a loan so he can buy more birds like turkeys to raise them and sell them at a better price.

Nadin has many dreams, but now he wishes he can improve the conditions of his house because they’re not at their best. He’s working and wanting to improve his business to give his family a better quality of life. Help him accomplish this and a lot more with a loan.

loans.use: buy more birds like turkeys to raise them and sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Leidy Natalia

texts.en:
Stores in Colombians towns become meetings points for the people who live nearby; that is what makes a store successful in these kinds of places. That’s the dream of Leidy, a store owner in the municipality of Amaga. She’s 27 years old and has a little baby girl who only is 9 months old.

She started her business because her family had big needs and because she loves the contact with people, which is always produced in a store. She always thinks big, so she wants to improve her sales and offer new products so she has more to offer. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy inputs like alcohol drinks, grain and snacks.

She always has dreamed of having her own house, where her family can have a great life, sharing many good moments and living safely and comfortably. All these dreams about her family and business can come true with a little help. Make a loan and let Leidy accomplish all of them.

loans.use: buy inputs like alcohol drinks, grain and snacks

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.en:
Colombian women are well known for their capacities and how strong they are, as well as being fighters. Sonia isn’t the exception. She is 44 years old and lives in the municipality of Sampues where she owns a business raising livestock, especially pigs. She inherited this job from her family and has been doing it for more than 20 years.

Unfortunately this business can get really expensive to develop because of the high costs of inputs. She wants to increase her clients and make her business be sustainable so she can provide for her family. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more pigs to fatten them up and improve her business.

Sonia is aware of how important education is so the kids can grow up being good people and do good things for other people. Her dream is to give them the best education she can, and that’s why she works so hard. Don’t let this dream fail; help Sonia with the loan she needs and let her improve her business and her family’s life.

loans.use: buy more pigs to fatten them up and improve her business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is still living with her mother-in-law. She is a good nurse and now she is no longer selling beauty products.

Mabel needs a loan to pay for an upgrade nursing class. She likes to study constantly. She hopes you can help her because she would like to have a better job.

loans.use: to pay for an upgrade nursing class.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a single man with no children and he is still working as a waiter at his parents' restaurant.

Rolando has learned a lot about the food business and this time he needs a loan to purchase showcases to show the tucumanas that his parents sell.

Rolando is very interested in making his parents' business a success, so he hopes you can help him.

In the picture, you can see the tucumanas and the showcase that will be replaced.

loans.use: to purchase showcases to show the tucumanas that his parents sell.

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German is a married man. He and his wife have two sons but they are young adults.

German is been working at a bakery with his wife for over 20 years. The business belongs to them and they need a loan to buy supplies for the bakery, such as butter and flour.

The work is hard because German sells a lot of bread and pastries, but he and his wife are good bakers: they learned when they were very young.

German hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery such as butter and flour.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is in his late thirties and is married, with four kids. All of his kids are in school. He has been running several projects for 10 years now, such as selling charcoal, working with vegetables and running a retail shop.

He works from 4 am to 12 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to improve his business. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He paid back his previous loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay a loan and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale, increasing the amount of his stock. He dreams of expanding his business.

Joel will make sure he pays back his loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Francia Elena

texts.en:
People often talk about how difficult the life of a single mother can be, but they also forget how strong they can be and how hungry for success they are This is the case of Francia, who lives with her 17-year-old son in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. She works hard in her business raising birds, and although it hasn’t been easy, she has found the way to do well.

She inherited this business from her family and even has one family member as an employee. She wants to make her business be more competitive and also see it last in time. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some chickens to fatten them up and buy the food to do so.

Her son means everything to her, and she dreams that one day, when the business get more successful, she can leave it to her son so he can keep with the tradition. You can help Francia to achieve all these goals that she has, and a loan will get her closer to that.

loans.use: buy some chickens to fatten them up and buy the food to do so.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.en:
Traditions are very important in Colombia, especially in families where there’s a responsibility for the members to keep with them. For José, it means a lot to respect these traditions, in his case, for the business that he inherited from his parents and that has been working for many years, a business raising pigs and chickens.

He lives in the municipality of Puerto Salgar, where his whole family lives with him. He wishes that his business can be more competitive and allow him to increase his profits. He asked for a loan so he can buy more chickens and pigs, and build a bigger chicken barn so he can offer better products.

His family is the most important thing in his life, the reason why works hard and wants to see his business succeed. He dreams of giving them a gift, and it’s to repair his house so they can live more comfortably and happily. Help José to accomplish his dreams and improve his business with a loan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and pigs, and build a bigger chicken barn so he can offer better products.

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Irene, who is in her late twenties, is single, with one child who is in school. She has been selling soft drinks for three years now. She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Irene's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of soft drinks and has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profits to pay school fees, repay a loan, reinvest in the business, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of soft drinks. She dreams of selling the soft drinks at wholesale prices.

Irene will share this loan with her loan group, Dove, which consists of two members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Rubian

texts.en:
Rubian is a 30-year-old married man who lives in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. He has a 17-year-old son and loves him very much. Sometimes his son helps him in his business, because he likes to teach his son like his father taught him. He owns a business raising and selling fish, a job that has allow him to provide for his family.

He has a problem with his business in that it is far away from his house and there’s a lot of competition. He still is searching for ideas for improving his business so he can increase his profits, be more competitive and make the business last over time. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy a new boat so he can fish more and hire someone so the production will increase.

Rubian has many dreams, but the majority of them relate to his family. Right now the house where they all live has some problems, so he wants to improve its conditions. You can help Rubian to achieve all of his goals; a loan will get him much closer.

loans.use: buy a new boat so he can fish more and hire someone so the production will increase.

loans.name: Sorany

texts.en:
Sorany is a 32-year-old single mother who wants to take the world by storm. She lives with her son who is 12 years old in the municipality of Victoria, where she has a store that she’s been managing for around 8 years. She started it for her family’s economic needs, but it’s a business that she learned to love. She tries to improve it and make it grow all the time.

The store has had some problems because the inputs can get really expensive and there’s a lot of competition in the municipality, but she keeps working to increase her clients, to make it be sustainable and to offer the best service. She asked for a loan so she can buy some shelves, put in a ceiling, tables and chairs, and to buy inputs like vegetables, fruits, snacks and drinks.

Sorany dreams of leaving the business to her son, but before that she wants to pay for his education so he can be a professional. You can get this single mother a lot closer to her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy some shelves, put in a ceiling, tables and chairs, and to buy inputs like vegetables, fruits, snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Maria Eucaris

texts.en:
Maria is a 37-year-old mother of three. She has 2 sons and 1 daughter who live with her in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral and who she loves very much. Life hasn’t been easy for this hard working woman who lost her husband some years ago. She has had to take on the responsibility of her children and family by herself.

She started an agricultural business where she grows some products and has some farm animals that she raises.

The market isn’t in the best position at this moment: she was focusing on milk production, which is very cheap right now. She wants and needs to increase her profits for her family so that they can survive. She asked for a loan so that she can buy an extra cow with which to improve milk production.

Maria has many dreams in her life but, as expected, her family is the principal one: she wants to give them a good quality of life, to pay for her children's education and, someday, buy a house so that they can all live safely and comfortably. You can help Maria to fulfill all of these goals with a loan that will get her a lot closer to achieving them.

loans.use: buy an extra cow with which to improve milk production.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Stores are a really common business in Colombia, but in towns are meeting points for the community around it. Carlos has one but doesn’t want to stay in that, he wants to offer new things and make his business a whole experience for his clients. He is 33 years old and lives with his 2 children in the municipality of Victoria.

There’s a lot of competition where he works and the inputs can be a little expensive sometimes, but that doesn’t stop him; he’s always thinking of increasing his clients so he can be more competitive. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy more snacks and sodas, and also some chairs and tables to start selling breakfast and lunch.

He always thinks and dreams big; that’s why he wants to buy a house for his whole family, because he believes with that he can give themthe best quality of life. You can help Carlos to accomplish all his dreams, and a loan will do that for him.

loans.use: buy more snacks and sodas, and also some chairs and tables to start selling breakfast and lunch.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia la carrera de psicología.
Él es inteligente, constante y muy emprendedor. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública ubicada en la zona ‘Miraflores’ caracterizada por encontrarse el estadio de futbol donde se realizan partidos nacionales y conciertos musicales de todo tipo.
Daniel es moreno de físico robusto y cabello negro corto. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Él estudia la carrera de psicología y tiene vocación de servicio a la comunidad, cuenta con habilidad de expresión oral y escrita, es muy crítico y creativa, “quiero terminar de estudiar y dedicarme a la enseñanza parvulario…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que ya se encuentra finalizando, la desventaja es la falta de capital para pagar las mensualidades y el inicio de tesis. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y desempeñar su función en educación parvulario, el desea pagar las mensualidades de su carrera e iniciar su tesis final. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Daniel solicita un préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de su carrera e iniciar su tesis final.
texts.en:
Daniel is 27 year old, single, childless and is studying psychology. He is intelligent, steadfast and very enterprising. He studies in the public university located in the 'Miraflores' area, which is characterized by the football (soccer) stadium where national parties and concerts of all kinds are held.

Daniel is dark-skinned, with a robust physique and short black hair. He shares his life with his parents who work; they live in a brick house owned by the family, which has all the basic necessities. He is studying psychology and feels the call to provide community service. He is talented in expressing himself orally and through writing, and is very analytical and creative. He says, "I want to finish school and devote myself to teaching kindergarten."

The advantage of his studies is that he is almost finished, the disadvantage is that he lacks the capital to pay the monthly tuition and to begin his thesis. His dream is to finish school and play his part in nursery education. He wants to pay the monthly tuition for his degree and to start his final thesis. This is his first loan sequence with Emprender in his four years studying.

It is for these reasons that Daniel requests a loan to pay the monthly tuition for his degree and to start his final thesis.

loans.use: to pay the monthly tuition for his degree and begin his final thesis.

loans.name: Norma Teodora

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Nuevas Semillas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores  de edad. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Norma es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale casi  todos los días, aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que ahí se le hace más fácil salir, ella  también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisuterías, entre otros productos. Lleva más de 10 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Nuevas Semillas" communal bank meets every fortnight in Jipijapa canton. The canton is known as the "Sultan of Coffee" due to it's extensive cultivation of coffee with it's incomparable taste, it's gastronomy and the quality of it's people.

Norma lives in this place. She is 54 years old, married and from this relationship has two adult children. Her husband is a mechanic.

Norma is a housewife who in order to make her own income and with it be able to help her husband with the household expenses, works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). Her sales method is door-to-door and she goes out almost every day. She takes advantage of the morning hours as it is easier to get out. She also sells at her house when customers arrive needing something. She leaves the goods on credit and collects every week. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and things are going well.

This loan will be used to buy perfume, creams and jewellery, amongst other products. She has been in the communal bank for more than 10 years and she likes it as the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to enjoy good health and carry on.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Juana Nila

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Nuevas Semillas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 15 años de edad, el cual estudia en colegio.
Doña Juana es una mujer muy luchadora que le toca trabajar duro  y así lograr sus propios recursos para que no le falte lo necesario a su hijo, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa en general y  productos naturales de una marca muy reconocida, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella deja a crédito y cobra  cada 8  o 15 días, ella lleva más de 10 años dedicada al comercio actividad que le permite sacar adelante sola a su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones y productos naturales que vende. Lleva 5 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The credit group 'Nuevas Semillas' meets every two weeks in the canton of Jipijapa . The canton is also known as the 'sultana del café' because of its vast plantations, coffee's unique flavour as well as its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Juana is 38, a single mother and has a 15 year old child who is studying at school. Juana is a very strong woman who works hard in order to be able to make a living so that she can provide what her son needs.

She does this by earning a living in retail through selling a variety of clothes and the natural products of a well known brand. She sells door to door offering credit and collecting every 8 or 15 days. She has spent more than 10 years working in retail which has allowed her to bring up her son alone.

This loan is to buy shirts, blouses, pants and the natural products that she sells. She has been in the credit group for 5 years and likes it because the loans have financed her business. Her dream is to provide the best for her child.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants and natural products.

loans.name: Munay Tika Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marcosa  ella es soltera  tiene 52 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su  negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes  productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de et forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, leche entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “MUNAY TIKA” communal bank. It is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and Cusco department.

The member is Marcosa. She is single, 52 years old and has two children. She combines her daily activities with working in her grocery store business. She has had the business for quite some time and things are going well thanks to the determination she puts into her work each day. She sells different products like rice, sugar and milk amongst others to her customers at their request. She wishes to continue to work in this manner so she can continue to support her family.

Marcosa is requesting the loan to buy oil and milk amongst others.

The members as a group are grateful to those who form part of this dream and promise to comply with their installment payments within the established time.

loans.use: to buy oil and milk amongst others.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.en:
Gerardo is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. He has five children, three boys and two girls, so he has a big responsibility to his big family that he loves very much. 

Geraldo has his own business in agricultural production, something he inherited from his family. Weather and the costs of inputs are his greatest challenges. In order to offer more products and grow his enterprise, he is requesting this loan to pay for fertilizers, irrigation, and labor.

Gerardo has many dreams, and because his children are so important for him, he wants to give to all of them the best education he can; he also would like to improve the conditions of his house. You can be part of Gerardo's dreams with a loan that will help him achieve all that he wants.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, irrigation, and labor.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a woman from the community of Kananga, in Leyte. She is 37 years old and married with three children ages 13, 14, and 16.

Veronica provides for them by raising hogs and rendering manicure and pedicure services to the local residents. To further support her business, she is asking a loan from CEVI to buy feed for her hogs.

She will be focusing on managing her barn well without worrying for the feed requirement to keep her hogs healthy. Veronica aims to send all her children to school for a better future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is from Kananga, a municipality in Leyte, Philippines. She is 26 years old and married with three children ages one, two and five.

Riza is asking a loan from CEVI to buy piglets, feed, and supplements. Her barn is ready but she needs capital to have piglets.

She is determined to help her husband, who is a machinist, by raising hogs. Her loan will help pay for her family’s living expenses like food and school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and supplements.

loans.name: Ma. Felibeth

texts.en:
Ma. Felibeth is 53 years old, from Kananga, Leyte. She is married with four daughters aged 12 to 18.

She earn a living by operating a general store (sari-sari store) where she sell basic household commodities like canned food, shampoo, bath soap, candies and chips. She also owns a shop where people will come for vulcanizing and inflating their tires.

She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and merchandise for her store such as canned sardines, tuna, corned beef, cooking oil, shampoo, noodles, and toiletries.

Ma. Felibeth hope to have a bigger business so that her family's life will improve. Her income will be used for school fees and the healthy diet of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and merchandise for her store such as canned sardines, tuna, corned beef, cooking oil, shampoo, noodles, and toiletries.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
In the community of Kananga in Leyte, people mostly rely on farming as their source of livelihood. Irene comes from this town too.

She is 36 years old and married with two children, aged two and eight. Life is not easy in her place since there are only limited options for earning a living.

With her husband doing carpentry work, she also helps by raising hogs. Hogs are then sold after four months for a profit. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and chicken to expand her business.

She hope to have a better return of her investment so she can better provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicken

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 57-year-old woman from the community of Kananga in Leyte. She is married to a farmer and she has one dependent, aged 13.

Evelyn is relying on her business of making hollow blocks. These are used to build concrete houses. In addition to hollow blocks, she also cook snacks that she sells in a canteen. Evelyn is requesting a loan through CEVI to buy more sand, as well as flour, sugar, and milk for her food business.

She only hopes that she can sustain her business and save some profit while keeping her loan paid on time.

loans.use: to buy sand, as well as flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Ledivina

texts.en:
Ledivina has been in the business of sari-sari (general) store for twenty years, in Palompon, Leyte. She sell items such as shampoo, bath soap, detergent, matches, candles, cooking oil, soy sauce, canned food, chips, and biscuits.

Ledivina is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like fresh mint bubble gum, chocolate bars, chips, candies, powder detergent, and canned food. She hope to increase her customer base so she can have a better earnings and save for old age. Ledivina is 56 years old.

loans.use: to buy fresh mint bubble gum, chocolate bars, chips, candies, powder detergent, and canned food.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 26 years old and from Kananga, Leyte. She is married with three children ages 3, 6, and 7.

Her husband barely earns for them so Jean wanted to reopen her store to earn a living. She will use her loan to buy household needs to sell like toiletries, seasoning, sachet items like coffee, milk, canned goods and noodles.

She hope that in the future, she will be able to make her store bigger and full of stock so she can better provide for her family's needs, especially the education of her children so they will become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, seasoning, sachet items like coffee, milk, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a sari-sari (general) store owner from Kananga, Leyte. She is 50 years old, with two grown children. In spite of having children who are already adults, she works hard so she can help her husband, who is an ice cream vendor. Lilia also supports her granddaughter’s school expense.

For a year now, her store has been selling canned foods, toiletries, cooking oil, coffee, detergent, biscuits and chips. She is asking for a loan to buy noodles, salt, candies, cement and hollow blocks for house renovation.

In the future, she plans to make her store bigger.

loans.use: to buy noodles, salt, candies, cement and hollow blocks for house renovation

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is from Bogotá Colombia. He is married, has two daughters and has lived in the United States for the past 15 years. Two years ago he opened a business that specializes in wood cabinets for residential and commercial purposes.
