He has many corporate and residential clients that hire him to manufacture their stands and kitchen cabinets. More recently his residential clients are increasingly requesting his services.

Although Fernando has had much success in building a large clientele, he is having a hard time meeting his client’s demands in a timely fashion. He is currently seeking a loan to purchase supplies and keep up with his client’s requests.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and meet client demands

loans.name: Meredith

texts.en:
Meredith lives at home with her husband and three children. She has experience working as an accountant and she decided to start her own business when she realized she has what it takes to run a financial services business on her own. She has been running her business since May 2014. Meredith is passionate about accounting and believes it is important for accountability and decision making. She loves to be able to help other business/organizations track their funds and develop good working habits.

Her greatest success/opportunity thus far as a business owner has been her success in winning a large accounting contract with a client via a bid and intensive interview process.

Currently, Meredith is seeking a loan to pay some business debt and to purchase new business equipment and software. Her goal is to get her work done as efficiently as possible so that she can meet demands and close contracts with new clients.

Meredith’s vision for the future is to see her business grow and continuously serve more clients. She would like to someday reach the point where she can afford to hire an employee to help manage her business. She would like to expand to a larger and more professional office down the road as well.

loans.use: to purchase new business equipment and software

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.en:
Ramiro is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Turbo. This man has always dreamed of having his own business, but the lack of money hasn’t allowed him to do so. He has some economic needs and he’s unemployed right now, but he wants to find his way, to create his own business, and to work hard to make it successful.

He wants to start a food service business, where he sells food prepared by him. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his business by buying inputs like meat and other tools that he needs. He’s willing to give his best, and he has a big talent. He’s a great cook.

Ramiro has many dreams and he’s going to work hard so he can accomplish all, He wants to improve his house that is not in its best condition and to make his business successful and sustainable. Help Ramiro achieve all his goals with just a loan.

loans.use: start his business by buying inputs like meat and other tools that he needs.

loans.name: Alfy Tibisay

texts.en:
Alfy is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the municipality of Turbo. She is a strong and hard worker who always is thinking of ways to make her life and her family’s life better. She owns a cattle-raising business which she inherited from her family, and now has a family member employed in the business.

The costs of the inputs are expensive, but she wants to invest in her business so it can improve and become more successful. She wants to increase her clients and her profits. She’s asking for a loan so she can improve the place which she has for animals, buy more cattle, and buy food for the animals.

Alfy has many dreams, but she one that she wants to accomplish soon and it’s to repair some damages that her house has. You can help Alfy to achieve all her goals and make her business a success; a loan will get her a lot closer to that.

loans.use: improve the place which she has for animals, buy more cattle, and buy food for the animals.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul decided to open his business in 2013 to provide for his family. His owns a custom made t-shirt factory and serves a wide variety of clients. Most of his clients are schools, construction companies, nuclear plants, transportation, government agencies and restaurants.

Raul’s business has grown consistently since it opened. Although he has not invested in advertising his services, he has done very well by relying on his client’s reviews and word of mouth promotions. His largest difficulty has been the ability to access the funds he needs to fulfill larger orders. He is currently seeking a loan to purchase materials and additional inventory. Raul’s hope for the future is to one day be able to hire an employee that can assist him in fulfilling client orders.

loans.use: to purchase materials and additional inventory

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a young woman of 25 years. She is from Kananga, Leyte. Jenalyn is engaged in a sari-sari store business where she sells items such as insect repellent, beauty and bath soap, firewood, coffee, canned sardines, sugar, diapers and shampoo.

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as noodles, eggs, shampoo, sugar, additional electronic load top-up and gasoline. Jenalyn works hard so she can help her husband, who is a habal-habal (motorcycle transport) driver. With her income, she can support her three children, aged 7 months, two and five.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, shampoo, sugar, additional electronic load top-up and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 22 years old while her youngest child is eight years old. She earns a living by selling herbal products while her husband is doing a farming business. They work hard to provide the needs of their children to give them a better means of living. Cristita is asking for a loan to purchase more products (herbal tonic drinks) to sell. In the future, she wishes to improve her business and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy herbal tonic drinks.

loans.name: Lucrisia

texts.en: Lucrisia is a 54-year-old widow from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has one daughter who is already an adult. For the last three months, she has been selling nipa shingles. This is used as a roofing material by some Filipino people. Some people use this because of its affordability, if homeowners cannot afford to buy galvanized iron. Some will also choose this type because it is comfortable. Lucrisia is asking for a loan to buy nipa leaves, bamboo and rope. She hope to keep her business, manage it well and expand so she can support herself.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, bamboo and rope

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 44 years old and lives in the municipality of El Retiro with his two daughters. For more than 13 years, he’s been running a cattle-raising business, a job that he learned thanks to his father who taught him everything that he needed to know. It’s not an easy job but he puts his whole heart in it so it gives him what he needs to provide for his family.

The high costs of the inputs have turn out to be a problem for the business because he doesn’t have the money to make his business grow. That’s why he’s asking for a loan so he can buy food for the animals and to pay a debt that he has.

For William his two daughters are everything, and he wants them to be successful professionals. That’s why he dreams of paying for the best education for them. You can help William to accomplish that. A little trust and a loan will make much difference in his life and in his family’s.

loans.use: buy food for the animals and to pay a debt that he has

loans.name: Filicidad

texts.en:
Filicidad is a 38-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte. Her husband is a security guard while Filicidad buys and sells charcoal, coco shell and chorizo (pork sausage). She has been doing this for three years to get extra income.

Filicidad wants to improve and expand her business. She wants to increase their livelihood in the future. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal and chorizo to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and chorizo (pork sausage)

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella thanks Kiva that she has received assistance twice already and never failed to pay on time. It definitely sustained her small general store and helped cover her family's basic needs. Aside from her store, she has also derived income from her transportation service jeepney for almost 19 years already.

She trusts that she can again borrow an amount of 17,000 PHP to pay for the annual registration, franchise, new tires and upholstery for her jeepney. She hopes for your positive response to fund the necessary maintenance. She will also use part of the loan to buy groceries such as canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles and beverages to sell at her mini-store. She badly needs funds to sustain her livelihood and to send one of her children to college.

Estella aims to buy one more jeepney to grow her transportation business. Just like all mothers, she wants her child to finish college to allow her better opportunities to uplift their lives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, registration, franchise, new tires and upholstery of her jeepney.

loans.name: Sega

texts.en:
Sega is a 27-year-old unmarried woman with five children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Sega needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sega has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, and soft drinks

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
For five years now, Annalyn of Palompon, Leyte sells barbecue for a living. She works hard because of her five-year-old son.

Annalyn usually prepares her barbecue in the evening. This food sells the most during dinner time. She is asking for a loan to buy pork meat, soy sauce, calamansi (lime), and seasoning.

Annalyn plans to continue improving her livelihood so that she can give her child a good future.

loans.use: to buy pork meat, soy sauce, calamansi (lime), and seasoning

loans.name: Telly Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Nuevas Semillas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Telly, tiene 48 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores y el menor de 14 años de edad, los dos  mayores estudian en universidad y el menor  en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Telly es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos que demandan el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos,  al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que el gana decidió hace 10 años atrás  emprender un negocio, ella  vende ropa, zapatos de catalogo y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran y que le permiten ganar sus recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 10 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Nuevas Semillas Credit Group meets every two weeks in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known as the "coffee sultan" because of its extensive coffee crops. The region's coffee has an incomparable taste. The area is also known for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people. 

Telly lives in this region. She is 48 years old, has a common law partner and three children -- two adults and a 14-year-old. The older ones are in university and the young one is in high school. Her partner is a taxi driver. 

Telly is a woman who likes to earn her own income and contribute to covering the family expenses, including her children's education. After seeing that her partner did not earn enough money, she decided 10 years ago to begin her own business. She sells clothes, shoes and catalog beauty products. She sells her products door to door and at her home. She allows her customers to pay in instalments, which she receives every 8 or 15 days. She has a lot of loyal customers, which allows her to make a living. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams, and everything else that she sells. She has been a member of the credit group for more than 10 years and likes it because the loans allowed her to start her business. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 38-year-old married woman from the community of Matag-ob, Leyte. She raises hogs to earn a living, and she is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. Additional capital from a loan will help her to maximize her business.

Arlene will have to wait for four months before she can sell her fattened hogs. Her income will go towards food, savings and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, she hopes to increase the amount of hogs that she is raising for a better return on investment.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a widow and she has her own house. She works as a teacher and she is mother of 2 sons who are going to college. Delia needs a loan to pay the college tuition of her sons.

Delia doesn't have enough money to make the payments so she hopes you can help her because her sons are studying and she doesn't want that they take a job, because she thinks that would be bad for their studies.

Delia works hard. She is healthy and she supports her family without help

loans.use: to pay the college tuition of her sons.

loans.name: Judith Alexandra

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, aquí se reúnen el Grupo De Crédito 15 De Abril.
En este lugar vive la señora Judith, tiene 32 años de edad, está separada y tiene un hijo de 10 años que estudia en escuela. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Judith realiza el crédito para ella y sus padres, ellos se dedican a la agricultura, siembran plátano durante todo el año, ya que son dueños de una plantación de plátanos. Los fines de semana venden estos productos en el mercado, solo vende en estos días porque es cuando más gente llega al lugar y sus ventas son mejores, el resto de la semana vende en la propiedad a donde llegan comerciantes a comprar y también se dedican a sus cultivos. Doña Judith es parvularia y trabaja en una escuela cercana a su casa, tiene 5 años en su trabajo y su horario es de 7h30 a 15h00 de lunes a viernes, el resto de su tiempo se dedica a la venta del plátano. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes para los cultivos y otra parte para pagar mano de obra en los trabajos de limpieza. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta la ayuda del crédito. Su sueño es que su hijo culmine sus estudios y sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The El Carmen district stands out because of its agriculture; plantains, cacao, corn, and a great variety of fruit are grown here, and as far as livestock, breeding of cattle, horses, pigs and poultry is the focus. This is where the 15th of April credit group meets, and where Judith lives. 

She is 32 years old and is separated with one 10 year-old son who is in school. They live in their own home. Judith wants this loan for herself and her parents. They work in agriculture and grow plantains throughout the year since they own a plantain plantation. On weekends they sell these products in the market. They only sell on those days because that is when most people come to the market and they make better sales. The rest of the week they sell their goods where merchants come to buy and also work on their crops. 

Judith is a nursery school teacher and works in a school near her home. She has been working in this job for five years and her work schedule is 7:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. The rest of her time is spent on selling plantains.

She is going to use this loan in order to purchase fertilizers for the crops and to pay for manual labor for the cleanup. This is her fourth loan cycle with the credit group and she likes the support of the loans. Her dream is that her son finishes his studies and that he becomes a proficient professional.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru: Надира, 27 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, она спокойная, умная, общительная, хорошая девушка. На протяжении 8 лет занимается торговлей женской одеждой на рынке. В обороте у Надиры есть товар на сумму 550,000 сом (KGS). Надира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки школьной формы для продажи. Надира намерена расширить свой бизнес, привлечь новых клиентов что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en:
Nadira is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a secondary-level education, and is an easy-tempered, smart, responsible, and good young woman. Over the last 8 years she has worked by selling women's clothing at the market. Nadira has goods in stock worth 550,000 som (KGS).

Nadira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy school uniforms for resale. Nadira intends to expand her business and attract new clients, which will without fail lead to an increase in her family's capital.

loans.use: to purchase school clothes for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is a 43-year-old woman who is married with two children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has four years of experience with this business.

Epenesa has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and especially to help with her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material.

loans.name: Silika

texts.en:
Silika is 35 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years.

Silika needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Silika will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: San José De La 15 De Abril  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América. Aquí decidieron unirse tiempo atrás 12 mujeres y formar el Grupo De Crédito San José de la 15 de Abril, y con la ayuda de los créditos han podido  mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Rosa,  tiene 53  años de edad, está casada y de  esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes.  Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. 
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios recursos por el bien de su familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad,  legumbres, verduras, frutas, carnes, agua en bidón, colas, helados,  artículos de bazar entre otros, este negocio lo comenzó hace 5 años con la ayuda de uno de los créditos y así mismo con la ayuda de los cedritos que ha ido recibiendo ha ido mejorando hasta tenerlo bien surtido y con muy buena clientela.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres para seguir mejorando su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace más de 10 años y le gusta porque los créditos le han permitido tener su negocio con el cual se gana la vida. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando cada vez más.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular and visited spa of Ecuador because of its beautiful and inviting beaches; it is the first port of deep waters of Ecuador and South America. Here, a while back, 12 women decided to unite and form the San José de la 15 de Abril village bank and with the help of the loans they've been able to improve their businesses and their quality of life.

One of the members of this group is Rosa. She is 53, married and from this relationship they have 4 children, of age and independent. Her husband is a security guard. Rosa is a woman who likes to fend for herself and earn her own resources for the good of the family. She has a grocery store in her house; there she sells all types of staple products: legumes, vegetables, fruits, meats, water in drums, sodas, ice cream, bazaar items, among others. She started this business 5 years ago with the help of one of the loan. With the help of the loans that she's been receiving, she's gone improving until she has it well stocked and with very good clientele.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store more; she will buy food to continue improving her store. She has been in the village bank for more than 10 years and she likes it because the loans have permitted her to have her store, with which she earns a living. Her dreams are to continue improving more and more.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Katty Elizabet

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Nuevas Semillas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 24 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esa relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 7 años que estudian en escuela, el marido es comerciante.
Doña Katty es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante y ganarse sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo, allí también ella vende helados y bolos de muchos sabores al gusto de sus clientes, con esto ella logra ganar algo extra que le ayuda mucho, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar camisas. Pantalones, blusas y helados que vende. Lleva 5 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy buenosa. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia y seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Nuevas Semillas [New Seeds] Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa district, which is known as the Sultana of Coffee because of the extensive coffee crops, which have an incomparable flavor. It is also know for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people. 

This is where Katty lives. She is 24 years old and is in a common law marriage. From this relationship she has three children who are 7, 10 and 12 years old and go to school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Katty is a young, hardworking woman who likes to get ahead and earn her own income for the good of her family. She works in commerce, selling all kinds of clothing door to door, and also from her home when her customers want something. She also sells ice cream and popsicles in many flavors that her customers like. 

With this she is able to earn something extra that helps her a lot. She sells her products on credit and charges her customers every eight days. She has been in this business for more than five years and thus earns money for the good of her family. 

This loan is to purchase shirts, pants, blouses and ice creams that she sells. She has been a member of the credit group for five years and likes it because the loans are great. Her dreams are to give the best to her family and to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses and ice creams.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Eva has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, chicken meat and other materials for her food production business. Eva has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, chicken meat and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Roque está en su ciclo número 12º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para ir mejorando en sus emprendimientos, son mujeres muy luchadoras y sacrificadas. 
La Sra. Eva, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender por su barrio. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y siempre sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir con su venta de comidas, y comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, panificados y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por poder mejorar cada día. Está contenta por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar y crecer en su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The San Roque group is in its 12th cycle of the committee of women program, where all work and help each other to improve their businesses. They are very hardworking, sacrificial women.

Eva is one of the members of this group. She works selling food that she herself makes and later sells in her neighborhood. She has very good customers since her food is very tasty, and her customers always give her lots of order.

She seeks this loan to be able to continue with her food sales, and to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and baked good, in order to continue with her sales, fighting to be able to improve every day. She is pleased with the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve and grow in her small endeavor.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: G. S. La Fe Group

texts.es:
EL G.S LA FE ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES MUJERES MADRES SOLTERAS CON SEIS HIJOS MENORS DE EDAD LOS CUALES DEPENDE DE ELLAS 100%, ESTAS MADRES SOLTERAS SE HAN CARACTERIZADO DE SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, EL PILAR DE SUS FAMILIAS, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN LA ACTUALIDAD PERSEVERAN PARA SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS HIJOS, Y POR BRINDARLES LO QUE NECESITAN, HACER SUS NEGOCIOS , CUMPLIR METAS Y OBJETIVOS DE VIDA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  MARIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA COMO : PANTALONES, SHORES, BLUSAS, FALDAS, ROPA INTERIOR, ROPA DE NIÑO, CAMISOLAS, CAMISETAS ETC. ELLA DEDICA UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y APROVECHA LAS VENTA DE LAS FESTIVIDADES PATRIA EN NUESTRA LOCALIDAD, G.S LA FE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The La Fe Group is formed by three single mothers with six minor children who fully depend on them. These single mothers are characterized by being hard working, responsible, the pillar of their families, and wanting to get ahead in life. They currently persevere to get ahead with their children and to provide everything they need. Their businesses help them achieve their life goals. 

Thanks to her strong desire to get ahead in life, the coordinator is Maria. She sells new clothes, such as pants, shorts, blouses, skirts, underwear, children's clothing, tank tops, t-shirts, etc. She works about 12 hours a day offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with new merchandise. She wants to take advantage of the upcoming national festivities. The La Fe Group thanks the help obtained from Kiva lenders by low income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua. This helps people have honorable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes such as pants, shorts, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, tank tops, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III.
La socia Elizabeth alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de ceviche, la socia prepara para sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, limón, sal entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the COMUZONE III communal bank. The member, Elizabeth, alternates her daily activities making a living in the business of selling ceviche, which she prepares for her various customers who ask for it.

The member has a good time with her business, which it is going well thanks to the determination that she puts each day into her business. The member wants to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting her family.

The member requests the loan in order to purchase fish, lemon, and salt, among other things. The member feels thankful for the extended credit and agrees to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase fish, lemon, and salt, among other things.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is a 44-year-old man from Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has five children ages 23, 15, 11, seven and three years old. He works hard to provide for the needs of his children by driving a “habal-habal” (a local name for a motorcycle that has an extended seat to accommodate more passengers than the ordinary motorcycle). Aside from driving, Roland and his wife sell food to have additional income. With this, he is asking for a loan to pay for motorcycle maintenance and to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil. Additionally, Roland dreams of sending all his children to school to finish their studies to have a good future.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lizeel

texts.en:
Lizeel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like candies, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Lizeel has been in this business for two years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lizeel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like candies, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, drinks, spices, detergent and other snacks foods.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, drinks, spices, detergent and other snacks foods.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell like coffee, drinks, spices, milk, canned goods, bread, shampoo, soap, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like coffee, drinks, spices, milk, canned goods, bread, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grace is 29 years old and has three children that are presently in school.

Grace has a buy-and-sell used cloth business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more used clothes to sell to her customers.

Grace has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en:
Jacklyn is a single woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jacklyn is 26 years old and has two children that are still in school.

Jacklyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jacklyn requested a PHP 3,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Jacklyn has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has three children who are presently in school. Gorgonia has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials such as cloth, thread, needles and maintenance for her tailoring shop. Gorgonia has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cloth, thread, needles and maintenance for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessica is 28 years old and has two children who are presently in school. Jessica has a buy-and-sell used clothes business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell. Jessica has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mburucuya  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien se dedica a las costuras, es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Es conocida en el barrio por los buenos trabajos que hace, y esa es su mejor publicidad, el excelente talento que tiene. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que quiere invertir en su emprendimiento, y pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The Group called Mburucuya is in its second loan cycle of the women's committee's program where all of them work and help each other to move ahead. They are doing a poll of poverty elimination as the way to improve their life conditions and that of their loved ones. One of its members is Rosa who works as a seamstress and is very good in what she does; and because of this she has many customers. She is known in her neighborhood for her good products, and this is her best advertisement: the excellent talent she has. Her dream is to keep on growing, and this is why she wants to invest in her enterprise. She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, and other things, in order to continue sewing as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastics and other things.

loans.name: Norma Ruth

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Nuevas Semillas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es ganadero y comerciante. 
Doña Norma junto al esposo se dedican al comercio, compran y venden ganado, dos veces a la semana ellos viajan en su camión hasta otro cantón, lugar en la cual conocen ganaderos que siempre les venden a ellos a muy buen precio, luego transportan las reses hasta su ciudad de origen y entregan a comerciantes de este lugar  que son los encargados de faenar las vacas y luego vender la carne para el consumo de los habitantes de la ciudad. Su marido lleva más de 40 años dedicado a esto, actividad con la cual pueden salir delante de una forma honrada, el también cría estos animalitos los mismo que de igual forma lleva a vender.
Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar reses. Es socia fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son comprar un camión más nuevo y grande.
texts.en:
The "Grupo de Crédito Nuevas Semillas" [New Seeds Loan Group] meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the "Sultana del café" [Coffee Sultana] by the vast plantations of coffee which has a flavor beyond compare, by its cuisine, and by the warmth of its people.

In this place lives Norma. She is 57 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has six adult and independent children. The husband is a farmer and trader. Norma and the husband work in trade; they buy and sell cattle. Twice a week, they travel in their truck to another canton, a place where they know farmers whom they always sell to at a very good price. Then, they transport the cattle to their hometown and deliver to traders of this place that are in charge of butchering the cows and then sell the meat for consumption by the inhabitants of the city. Her husband has more than 40 years in this, an occupation with which they can succeed in an honorable way. He also breeds these little animals as well as taking them to sell.

They will use this loan to buy cattle. Norma is a founding member of the "Grupo de Crédito" and likes it because of the aid that the loans provide to her. Her dreams are to buy a newer and bigger truck.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a mother to an eight-year-old daughter. She and her family live in Ormoc City, Leyte. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. Elsa helps by engaging in a sari-sari (general) store business. She sell candies, shampoo, canned tuna, sardines, cooking oil, salt, seasoning and detergent. She is asking for a loan to buy stock in bulk such as canned food, sugar, detergent, cooking oil, seasoning, salt and toiletries. She also plans to start a food vending business with her loan. In the future, Elsa will continue to expand and manage her business well for a better return on her investment.

loans.use: to buy canned food, sugar, detergent, cooking oil, seasoning, salt and toiletries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 62 years old and has one child still in school. Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Jean is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has two children who are presently in school. Jocelyn has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products of frozen foods to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods products to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and married with nine children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Julia is borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Julia has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from raising pigs.

Cepriana dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Horizonte “ es un grupo unido y fortalecido, se encuentran con un gran espíritu emprendedor y ganas de superación, es por ello que se decidieron a unirse para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Todas las integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades rurales de cría y venta de animales de corral, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Isabel, una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo. Está contenta por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The committee called Horizonte is a united and strengthened group. They have a great entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to better themselves. That is why they decided to unite, to be able to grow and move forward.

All of the group members work in rural activities of raising and selling barnyard animals. Among them, Isabel stands out. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who wants to give her family a dignified life without deprivation.

She seeks this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals, and in this way to be able to continue with her small endeavor as she has been doing. She is pleased with the opportunity she is receiving to be able to be someone in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Leizle

texts.en:
Leizle works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, spices, soy sauce and other materials for her food production business.

Leizle has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, spices, soy sauce and other materials for her food production business.

Janice has been in this business for three years now.

Melanie has been in this business for 23 years. She earns additional income from raising ducks.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Nida

Nida has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

texts.en:

She needed this loan to assist in paying for her school tuition.

Zinev plans on working as an educator helping to shape the next generation of students.

loans.use: to assist in paying for her school tuition.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 38-year-old married woman from Samtredia district. She is the mother of four children. The family doesn't have any source of income to cover even their basic needs. They live under poverty and require financial support to start a family business. Nino was unable to find any stable job because of her secondary education and the high unemployment rate in the region. She decided to start a trading business and requested a loan from local financial institutions. She couldn’t receive a loan, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, began. The program allows rural poor like Nino to get a chance to start or restart business. Nino will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell it in her community at increased prices.

The family members will get the chance to satisfy their increased needs and have financial stability with the help of Kiva lenders. Nino and her children rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to start trading with clothing and earn the only source of income.

loans.name: Ma. Dalla

texts.en:
Ma. Dalla hails from Ormoc City in Leyte. She is 46 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 10. She is engaged in raising hogs and farming rice for a living. This started four years ago.

Ma. Dalla would like to improve and sustain her business. She is asking a loan of PHP 20,000 to make this possible. She will use it to buy feed for her hogs and fertilizer for the farm. Ma. Dalla hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned food, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, detergent, and pistons.

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en:
Nasrin is a 42-year-old mother of four. She has her BA and has completed business ‎management, marketing and Facebook courses at her local Small Business Association. ‎She sells clothing for life-cycle and specialty events for all ages.‎

Nasrin needed this loan to update her stock and introduce new trends in her dresses and ‎clothing.‎

Nasrin’s store is centrally located and has very good potential. With this loan she is ‎working to upgrade her store so she can contribute significantly to her family’s income ‎and strengthen her children’s future.‎

loans.use: to update her stock and introduce new trends in her dresses and ‎clothing.‎

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is the mother of six children; three who are already grown and three still living at ‎home. Several years ago Sara’s husband went into serious debt. One day he just up and ‎left, fleeing Israel and leaving her to raise their family and pay off his significant debts alone. ‎Sara is a strong, intelligent woman. She herself works as a business consultant and ‎opened a business organizing vacations abroad for religious families. Sara has worked ‎and has repaid 99% of her husband’s debt. She has no idea where he is but she has ‎built a good life for herself and her children. ‎

Sara needed this loan to assist with PR and for down payments on future trips and ‎vacations for her clients.‎

Sara knows she has gotten through some of the toughest times in her life and she looks ‎forward to making her future brighter and stronger economically.‎

loans.use: to assist with PR and for down payments on future trips and ‎vacations for her clients.‎.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Ana es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer, tiene 38 años y vive en unión libre con el padre de sus 2 hijos, los cuales cursan la primaria el menor y la adolescente la secundaria.  Viven en un terrero donado aproximadamente de cuatro hectáreas por el INDER. Ella junto con su esposo trabajan en la parcela,  se dedica al sector agropecuario. Tiene experiencia en la cría de animales, además la siembra de frutas y hortalizas, estás  actividades son la una única fuente de ingresos a su hogar, por ello todos trabajan conjuntamente sus tierras.  En ocasiones Ana trabaja por temporadas en otra parcela o fincas bananeras que hay en esa comunidad, debido a que es la única fuente de empleo, siempre con el objetivo de superarse y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia. Ella va a invertir su préstamo en la siembra de banano Datil, además de comprar insumos para  el cuido debido de éste. Es importante mencionar que ella y su compañero realizan todo el ciclo de producción de su fruta, desde que lo siembran hasta que se lo entregan al comprador sellado y empacado en cajas. Lo vende a un intermediario y éste tiene contrato con la empresa Chiquita.  En éste momento ésta actividad productiva de banano es el ingreso primordial a su hogar. Los créditos anteriores le han permitido capitalizar y con eso cubrir todos los gastos familiares, así como los estudios de sus hijos. Una de sus metas es reparar su casa, ya que está en mal estado, además de seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los gastos de los estudios, debido que para ella es muy importante que ellos terminen su estudio académico. Los diferentes préstamos que ha obtenido por medio de la Fundación los ha invertido siempre en actividades agropecuarias. Junto a ella integran el grupo tres socias más que van a invertir en actividades como es la agricultura de yuca y la cria de pollos y gallinas ponedoras. Todas buscan bienes en común, la superación y crecimiento de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of the Mujer Nuevo Amanecer bank. She is 38 years old and lives in a civil union with the father of her 2 children, the younger of whom is studying in primary school and the adolescent in secondary school. They live on land of approximately four hectares donated by INDER. She and her husband work the plot of land; she makes a living from farming. She has experience raising animals, as well as planting fruit and vegetables. These activities are the only source of income for her home for which they all work their land together.

On occasion, Ana works for periods of time on other plots or banana plantations that are in the community, owing to which she is the only source of work. She always works with the goal of excelling and improving her and her family’s living conditions.

She is going to invest her loan in planting Datil banana trees, as well as purchasing supplies for their care. It is important to mention that she and her companion carry out the entire production cycle of their fruit, from when they plant it until they deliver it to the purchaser, sealed and packed in boxes. They sell it to an intermediary who is contracted by the Chiquita Company. At this moment, this productive banana tree activity is the primary income for her home. The previous loans have allowed her to capitalize and with it cover all of her home expenses as well as her children’s studies.

One of her goals is to repair her home, since it is in a bad state, in addition to continuing to support her children in their educational costs, because for her it is very important that they finish their academic studies. She has always invested the different loans that she has obtained through the Fundación in farming activities. Along with her, those that make up the group are three more members that are going to invest in activities such as yucca farming and raising chickens and laying hens. They are all searching for common assets, self-improvement, and the growth of themselves and their families.

loans.use: to purchase seed and agricultural supplies.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama La alegría es un grupo nuevo con 19 integrantes, todas con muchas esperanzas de poder mejorar sus vidas por medio de las actividades que están realizando de manera unida.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Romualda quien se dedica al cultivo en su Huerta, vende sus cultivos por la zona, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre se acerca a ella para poder comprar sus productos frescos que siempre prefieren sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de semillas y abonos para poder seguir con sus cultivos en su pequeña huerta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The committee is named La Alegría. It is a new group with 19 members, all with much hope to be able to improve their lives by means of the activities that they are carrying out together.

One of the members who is known for being very entreprising is Romualda, who makes a living from cultivating her vegetables. She sells her crops throughout the area. She has a very good clientele that always comes to her to purchase her fresh products that her customers always prefer.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer to be able to continue with her crops on her small farm. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her business venture.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
A year ago, Epifania began growing and selling seaweeds. This serves as her main source of income. She is a 55-year-old married woman with no dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. She lacks capital to support her existing livelihood. She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol.

Epifania has requested a loan to buy materials like straw, tissue paper and additional seaweed seedlings. These are essential in augmenting her livelihood. She could expand her seaweed farming business to become sustainable. Thus, she could settle her obligations and handle her finances.

She hopes that she will become financially stable and that the loan will help improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials like straw, tissue paper and additional seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina operates a thriving business selling barbecue. This business has been existing for two years in her town of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. She would like to expand her business so she can earn more for her family. She will use the loan to buy hot dogs, chicken and pork. Rosalina is determined to improve her business for better income. She is 45 years old and she supports two dependents aged 15 and 18.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, chicken and pork

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Elvira has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Ghi-Ann

texts.en:
Ghi-Ann, 30, is married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a buy-and-sell business in the Philippines. She sells personal collection products and has been in this business for one year.

Ghi-Ann has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more products to sell, such as lotion, dishwashing soap and beauty soap.

Ghi-Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, such as lotion, dishwashing soap and beauty soap.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers for her buy and sell banana business.

Anecita has been in this business for 10 years. Anecita earns more income from a general store.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Loviella

texts.en:
Loviella, 33, is married with four children, three of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, detergent, shampoo, soap, bread, eggs and other groceries.

In the future, Loviella would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, detergent, shampoo, soap, bread, eggs and other groceries.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 57 years old and married with two children.

Helen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer es un grupo organizado que se formó hace varios años en la comunidad de La Curia en el Asentamiento llamado con el mismo nombre. Son señoras que se unen para obtener beneficios y asi poder cumplir los objetivos en común. Gracias a su organización tienen oportunidad de accesar al crédito en el programa de Banco Mujer, ya que la mayoría de las socias no cuentan con capacidad de ser financiadas en la banca estatal por diferentes circunstancias. Ellas buscan superarse y crecer en sus actividades productivas. Todas las socias trabajan en sus parcelas junto con su familia, las cuales fueron donadas por una institución del estado llamada actualmente INDER. Es un grupo con mucha trayectoria y excelente comportamiento de pago, está compuesto por 5 socias que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias. Han obtenido siete créditos. Doña Gloribeth es la presidenta del grupo desde que se formó, y ha sido reelecta al pasar los años, ya que las demás socias la ven como la lidereza indicada para cumplir con éste puesto tan importante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable e independiente, casada, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad y no viven con ella, porque ya tienen su familia formada. Ella siempre se ha dedica a las actividades agropecuarias junto con su esposo, el cual es el único ingreso de su hogar. Sus hijos también se dedican a los mismo, ya que tienen toda la experiencia en el campo. Este crédito lo va invertir en comprar ganado de engorde y los insumos necesarios para su cuido. Ella también tiene vacas lecheras de las cuales produce queso y lo vende en la comunidad. Los préstamos anteriores le han ayudado a capitalizar y ahora cuenta con animales que representan su inventario. Doña Gloribeth ha logrado contribuir a los gastos del hogar, satisfacer sus gastos personales, ayudar a sus nietos en los gastos escolares, gracias a la buena inversión que ha hecho con los préstamos de Fundación Mujer, además de motivar a otras mujeres en su comunidad para que trabajen en grupo, y administren bien los recursos financiados. Junto con la lidereza hay cuatro socias más que van a invertir en la cria de animales como es ganado y gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer, is a group that was created several years ago in the community of La Curia, in the settlement of the same name. They are women who are joining together to obtain benefits and thereby be able to fulfill their common objectives. 

Thanks to their organization, they have the opportunity to access credit under the women's communal bank program, as for various reasons, the majority of the members do not have the ability to obtain financing from regular banks. They are looking to succeed and see their businesses grow. All the members work with their families on their parcels of land, which were given to them by state institution current called INDER. It is a group with a great deal of history, and an excellent payment record.

It is made up of five members who will invest in agricultural activities. They have obtained 7 loans. Gloribeth has been the chair of the group since it started, and has been re-elected over the years, as the other women see her as providing the required leadership for fulfilling the responsibilities of this important position. She is a very hardworking and independent woman. She is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children, all adults. They do not live with her as they already have families of their own. 

She and her husband have always farmed, and this their household's sole source of income. Their children engage in farming also, as they are fully experienced in farming.  She is going to use this loan to purchase cattle for fattening, as well as the supplies needed to look after them. She also has dairy cattle, from whose milk she produces cheese that she sells in the community. The previous loans have helped her as working capital and now she has animals that represent her inventory. Gloribeth has succeeded in contributing to her household and personal expenses,  helping her grandchildren with their education expenses, as well as motivating other women in her community to work together as a group and properly administer financial resources.

Along with the chair there are four more members, who are going to invest in the raising of animals such as cattle and laying hens.

loans.use: to buy cattle. vitamins, honey, salt and other products.

loans.name: Ayessa Mae

texts.en:

Ayessa Mae has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Lưu

texts.en:
Mr Lưu is 29 years old and married. He has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for three years. Lưu lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough to provide for what he really needs to comfort his life. His family has a two-hole latrine. But it is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Lưu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true. In the future, Lưu hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Giberta has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, spices, meat, rice, etc. for her food production business

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama KUÑA ATY es un grupo unido y antiguo, actualmente se encuentran en el noveno ciclo con mucho entusiasmo trabajan y se ayudan para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes la señora Catalina, cuenta con una despensa en su propia casa, donde ofrece productos variados de necesidades básicas del hogar, con el préstamo que pide quiere invertir en la compra de más productos para hacer crecer su local de ventas, como ser bebidas, comestibles, frutas, verduras y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo en su trabajo. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere mejorar cada día. En la foto del grupo aparecen 18 mujeres, ya que el grupo tiene 18 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo 16 de ellas piden en préstamo.
texts.en:
The committee is called KUÑA ATY and it is an older, tight-knit group. They are currently in their ninth loan cycle. They work with great enthusiasm and they help one another in order to grow and improve their living conditions and that of their loved ones.

One of the members is Catalina. She has a small store in her own home, where she offers a variety of household staples. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to invest in purchasing more products to grow her sales establishment, such as drinks, groceries, fruits, vegetables and other items. That way, she will be able to continue growing in her work.

She defines herself as a very selfless and hardworking person, who wants to improve every day. In the picture of the group there are 18 women, but in this cycle, only 16 are requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, groceries, fruits, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
LAS TRIUNFADORAS es un grupo muy unido, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Son sacrificadas y muy luchadoras, y se esfuerzan para poder seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes de  este comité es la señora Delia, quien se dedica a la cría y faena de animales,  por medio de su humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna para ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos. Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de animales, alimentos para ellos y también para la construcción de gallineros y corrales, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
LAS TRIUNFADORAS are a very united group. They are mothers and heads of family that got together in order to provide their loved ones all that they couldn't have. Very self-sacrificing and fighters, they strive to be able to continue to grow.

One of the members of the group is Delia, who works raising and slaughtering animals. Through her humble work she makes a living in a dignified manner in order to help her family and her loved ones. She is doing everything to be able to grow and get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy animals, feed for them and to also construct chicken coops and pens and in this way continue with her efforts.

loans.use: to buy animals, feed for animals and also to build chicken coops and pens.
