She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years. Nenita earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and married with four children. Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

Josefina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Mariafe has been in this business for one year. Mariafe earns more income from farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mariafe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Venus works very hard to provide for them.

Venus runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Venus has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Venus would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, beverages,  home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and buy and sell ready to wear.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marian dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. Alicia is single and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, fish, meat, canned goods, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, fish, meat, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. Angela is married and has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase cement, sand and gravel for making hollow blocks.

Angela has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel for making hollow blocks.

loans.name: Abdul Hameed

texts.en:
Abdul Hameed is the age of 52, living with his family in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for many years. Earlier he was doing a job in the government sector. After retirement he established a general store with the help of gratuity amount so that he can equally participate in household expenses. His shop is situated in a populated area and a lot of customers are available here for him to offer miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily usage. He wants to offer additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc. But the major problem is the shortage of funds.

Therefore, Abdul Hameed requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be able to increase his general store business.

He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sales.

Abdul Hameed is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his own general store.

loans.name: Femmes Catholiques Cap Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en 2011. Ce groupe est constitué de quatorze membre qui s'activent dans le commerce. madame Christine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 43 ans et mère de six garçons. Elle capitalise plusieurs années d'expérience dans son domaine d'activité. Elle va acheter plusieurs sacs de légumes et des poissons séchés avec le prêt sollicité. Elle est très courageuse et très active dans son activité. les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge de la famille et à épargner.
texts.en:
The village finance association of which this group is a part was inaugurated in 2011. This group is constituted of fourteen members whose business is retail.
 
Mrs. Christine, who is on the right in the picture with her hand raised, is the group’s spokesperson. She is married, forty-three years old, and a mother of six boys. She is capitalizing on several years of experience in her domain.
 
With the requested loan, she will purchase several bags of vegetables and dried fish. She is very brave and hardworking in her business. Profits will be used to help support her family and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-drying business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF, to purchase boxes of fresh fish to dry for her dried-fish business.

Susan has sustained her business activities through her 20 previous loans with NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fresh fish to dry

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en: Orn is 61 years old and the married father of four dependent children, living in a small wooden house located in Kandal province. To support his family’s living conditions, he has grown rice for 41 years. Recently, his businesses did not do well as the crop was destroyed by drought. For Orn, this is his fifth loan with VisionFund and as the group leader he will spend his loan portion on buying rice seed and fertilizer and paying for labor fees to produce a good yield. He hopes that this fifth loan will enable him to grow good quality rice so as to sell it for good profit and allow him to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to grow good quality rice so as to sell it for a good profit and save for future needs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, y a la vez que estudia también trabaja para poder solventar sus estudios. Es administrador de un local muy concurrido, comenta que está en el segundo año de la carrera de contabilidad, es una persona muy dedicada que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus útiles de universidad,  de manera a poder continuar con sus estudios y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en: Juan is from the city of Curuguaty, is single, and the same time that he studies he also works to be able to cover his studies. He´is the manager of a very busy store. He notes that he is in the second year of the degree of accounting. He is a very dedicated person who wants to get ahead. He is applying for this loan to be able to pay for his university supplies, in order to be able to continue with his studies and be a good professional.

loans.use: to pay for university supplies.

loans.name: Buzylaika

texts.ru: Бузылайка, 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2009 году Бузылайка начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 19,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. На 2,25 Га земельной доли выращивает рис для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бузылайка обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, и оплату услуг по сбору урожая органического риса. Доходы Бузылайка планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и обучение дочери в техникуме.
texts.en: Buzylaika is 37 years old, married, and she is raising three children.  As she was looking for a source of income for her family, she got involved in agriculture and animal husbandry in 2009.  While she started with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS), her farming business now brings her about 19,000 som (KGS) per month.  She has three cows on her farm and also grows rice for resale on 2.25 hectares of land.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of harvesting organic rice.  Buzylaika is planning to use her earnings to further expand her farming business and to pay for her daughter's education in a technical school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of harvesting organic rice.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia es una joven con 29 años de edad, tiene una hija de 9 años y en éstos momentos está embarazada, vive con su compañero desde hace aproximadamente diez años. Vive en la comunidad de Ania, la cual pertenece al Cantón de Talamanca y al Distrito de Sixaola, comunidades que carecen de muchas oportunidades por ser rurales y la principal fuente de empleo son las bananeras. Fue integrante de un Banco Mujer, el cual canceló de la mejor manera en el mes de diciembre del 2014. Tiene la experiencia en la cria de animales y la siembra de plátano, debido a que siempre su familia trabajó en esas actividades. Hace varios años ella se dedica a la cria de cerdos, ya que tuvo la necesidad de aportar en su hogar sin descuidar a su familia. Su compañero labora para en una empresa de seguridad privada en una finca bananera, solo en horas nocturnas, ésto le permite a él ayudarla en su actividad productiva. Busca objetivos alcanzables como es la superación personal, crecimiento en el negocio, para tener ella y darle a sus hijos una estabilidad económica y mejores condiciones de vida. En el patio de su casa tiene acondicionado cuatro chiqueros para la cria de cerdos, los cuales necesita remodelarlos porque están en malas condiciones. El préstamo lo va invertir en comprar cerdos para engorde, luego venderlos ya sea vivos o muertos por kilos, además de hacerle unas mejoras a los chiqueros. Los vende en su misma comunidad, la mayoría de veces vende dos cerdos al mes y ésto le va permitir asumir el pago del pasivo adquirido y también reinvertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ligia is a young woman that is 29 years old. She has a 9-year-old daughter and is currently pregnant. She has lived with her partner for approximately 10 years. She lives in the community of Ania, which belongs to the Talamanca canton and the Sixaola district. The communities are lacking a lot of opportunities because they are rural, and the main source of employment is banana farming.

She was a member of a Women's Bank, which she ended on good terms in December of 2014. She has experience raising animals and planting bananas because her family always worked in these occupations. For many years she has earned a living raising pigs since she had the need to support her household without neglecting her family. Her partner works for a private security company on a banana farm, only during night hours. This allows him to help Ligia in her productive occupation.

She pursues obtainable objectives such as personal progress, and growth in her business in order to have stable finances and give her children better living conditions. In the patio of her house she has made four pigsties to raise pigs. These need remodeling because they are in poor conditions. She will use the loan to buy pigs to raise and then sell them, dead or alive, by the kilogram. She will also make a few improvements to the pigsties. She sells the pigs in her own community and most of the time she sells two pigs per month, and this will allow her to make the payment of the loan and also reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and supplies.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Jeanette es una integrante del Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer, formado en el año 2006 en la comunidad rural de La Curia. Vive en una parcela que se la otorgó el I.N.D.E.R., en el asentamiento con el mismo nombre. Es una señora muy trabajadora, humilde y con mucha experiencia en el sector agropecuario. Ella se dedica a la cria de ganado de engorde junto con su familia, además también siembran frutas y hortalizas. Trabaja algunas horas diarias en otra parcela para generar ingresos y ayudar en su hogar, debido a que su esposo cuenta con un salario bajo en la bananera en donde labora, la cual es la principal fuente de empleo en esa zona. Con ella vive su esposo y un hijo menor de edad, el cual cursa la secundaria. Gracias a la buena inversión que hace en sus créditos, ella ha logrado generar buenos ingresos a su hogar y asi mismo ayudar a su hijo en el gasto colegial. Los préstamos le han permitido capitalizar y actualmente cuenta con un inventario de siete vacas, que le han ido quedando a través de los financiamientos. En éste nuevo crédito también va comprar ganado y los insumos para la cria de los mismos. Éste banco mujer se ha caracterizado por su buena moral de pago, responsabilidad y compromiso con la Fundación. Es un grupo muy organizado, han logrado cumplir con las Reglas de Oro, además se esfuerzan por tener un ahorro navideño, ya que la mayoría de socias viven de sus actividades productivas y las realizan junto con su familia, las cuales son la principal entrada económica a sus hogares. Junto con Jeanette hay tres socias más que invertirán sus préstamos en la compra de ganado de engorde. Todas buscan objetivos en común como es generar ingresos a sus hogares y asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
Jeanette is a member of the Mujer Nuevo Amanecer village bank, formed in the year 2006 in the rural community of La Curia. She lives on a plot that INDER granted to her, in the settlement of La Curia. She is a very hardworking, humble person with much experience in the agricultural sector. She works raising beef cattle along with her family, additionally, they plant fruits and vegetables. She works some hours daily on another plot to generate income and to help in her home, since her husband has a low salary in the banana plantation where he works, which is the main source of income in this area.

She lives with her husband and a son, a minor, who is in middle school. Thanks to the good investment she makes with her loans, she has achieved generating good income for her home and also helping her son with the school expenses. The loans have allowed them to capitalize and currently she has an inventory of seven cows that they've gone keeping because of the loans.

For this new loan, she will also buy cattle and the supplies for raising them. This woman's bank is characterized by its good payment morale, responsibility and commitment to the Foundation. It is a very organized group; they've achieved fulfilling the Golden Rules, additionally, they push themselves to have a Christmas savings. Since the majority of the members live from their productive activities and they do them with their families, they are the main economic input for their families.

Along with Jeanette there are three members to will invest their loans in the purchase of beef cattle. All seek common goals like generating income for their homes and therefore improving the living conditions of themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy calves and supplies.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 37-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, selling different types of edible items such as chicken burgers, egg burgers, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nazia's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business purposes so that her husband can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his food stall business.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is married and has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit and coconut selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old, married and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nora has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, 38, is married and lives in the Philippines. For the past seven years she has worked continually selling food she prepares to earn a living.

Mary Jean has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy ingredients such as bananas, sugar and cooking oil. She is saving money to put back into her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Arfan

texts.en: Arfan is a very hardworking and active borrower with Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is 33 years old and lives in Sialkot with his family; a decent and responsible housewife, one son, and one daughter. Arfan has been running a small garment shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family. The winter season is very near starting in Pakistan, so he wants to purchase a variety of warm clothing, such as sweaters, coats, gloves, mufflers, and school jerseys. To do this, he has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 200,000. The loan will help him to offer a variety of products to his clients and increase his net income as well. Arfan dreams of increasing his business so that his children can have a better future. His family sends loads of prayers and thanks to all of the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of seasonal garments for his own shop.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 59 years old and married, and she is from the community of Matag-ob, Leyte.
She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through CEVI to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, bath soap, detergent, seasoning, and shampoo.

Lourdes enjoys having her store, since this keeps her occupied while earning a living. A loan will make her customers happy since they will not have to go to another store anymore when she runs out of stock.

In the future, Lourdes would like to expand and introduce more merchandise to her business to secure her financial stability for her old age.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, bath soap, detergent, seasoning, and shampoo.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 53 years old and married. With seven children, two of whom are still in school, Noemi must work very hard to provide for them.

For the past five years Noemi has run a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, detergent, shampoo, bread, eggs, soap and other groceries.

Noemi’s desire is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari, or small general store.

loans.name: Perive

texts.en:
Perive is a 33-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a small taxi business to earn an income. She has six years of experience with this business.

Perive needs a loan to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Perive joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, and petrol.

loans.name: Tae

texts.en:
Tae is 59 years old and unmarried with eight children.

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 13 years. Tae needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Tae will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 32 years old, married with four dependents. She and her family lives in Matag-ob, Leyte. Since livelihood in this area is limited to mostly agriculture, Lilibeth is engaged in raising hogs. Her business adds to the income of her husband who is a carpenter.

Lilibeth is requesting a loan to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes that she will be able to produce healthy hogs that will attract buyers from the market at a good price.

She plans to improve and increase the hogs that she is raising in the future so her business will be more stable.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 65 years old, married and has five children. For the past ten years she has farmed rice to earn an income in the Philippines.

Virginia has taken out and successfully repaid twenty prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 25,000 PHP loan to pay for laborers to prepare her fields for planting.

Virginia’s desire is to save enough money to secure her family’s future wellbeing.

loans.use: to pay for laborers to prepare her fields for planting.

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya sells secondhand clothes at the market. Due to the previous loan she increased her income. Ibolya is open, friendly and a hardworking person. She is a regular KIVA client. Ibolya wants to develop her business further.

This time Ibolya is asking for a loan of 70,000 UAH to purchase underwear, pillowcases, blankets and towels. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of goods and get new clients.

loans.use: to purchase underwear, pillowcases, blankets and towels to resell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is from the town of Matag-ob, Leyte. She is 41 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community. She sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent and rice. These items are needed on a daily basis in a Filipino household. With a loan, Evelyn is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous.

loans.use: to buy  coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent and rice

loans.name: Jocelina

texts.en:
Jocelina is a 39 year old woman from the town of Matag-ob, Leyte. She is currently in a hog raising business and she finds it profitable and improving. She works hard in her business hoping that it will help her sustain and meet her families' financial needs for their daily expenses.

Currently, Jocelina needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth PHP 15,000 for her to buy additional piglets and feed. She is certain that through the loan, she can buy what she needs for the growth and development of her business.
With the income from the business, she can save for old age, eat a healthy diet and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 28-year-old woman from Matag-ob, Leyte. Marivic is in the hog raising business to earn a living.

Marivic wants to improve her business but she needs funds to make it happen. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the hogs. She also wants to buy additional piglets to raise.

With the loan, Marivic will finally be able to make her plans of expanding her business happen.
She hopes to see her family live a bountiful life and she believes that this will be possible if she is provided with financial support through a loan.
Any additional revenue will be used to finance the families' daily needs and the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Anicha

texts.ru: Анича, 59 лет, замужем, она мать-героиня 6 детей, все дети уже взрослые и проживают отдельно, у Аничи уже есть внуки. У нее среднее образование, 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Аничи, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 7,40 ГА собственного земельного надела, где Анича ежегодно выращивает пшеницу и клевер для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть дойная корова и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анича обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 2 коров с целью увеличения поголовья скота, часть средств направят на сбор пшеницы. Анича намерена развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en:
Anicha is 59 years old, married and the mother of six. All her children are already grown and live separately. Anicha already has grandchildren. She has received secondary education and has been growing farm crops and raising livestock for 25 years. Thanks to Anicha's hard work and persistence, and present she has her own field of 7.4 ha [18 acres], where she annually grows wheat and clover for sale. She also has a dairy cow and 20 sheep on her farm. The monthly income from her agricultural business is 19,000 soms (KGS).

In order to develop her farm further, Anicha has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount. She will also use a part of her fund for harvesting wheat. Anicha intends to keep expanding her business, which will bolster her family's finances.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows in order to increase her herd and to pay for harvesting of organic wheat.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old, separated, and from the island of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She did not allow her separation to cause her to settle where she is.  She moved ahead and started a business of her own to raise her three children.  One of her children is in High School and the other two are in Elementary School. 

She started her hardware shop about eight months ago.  She sells various car oils, lubricants, and hose. She values and takes care of her business since this is her main source of livelihood. She earns money by buying and selling products that help clean and protect engines so they operate efficiently. Aside from her machinery products, she also sells ready to wear clothes. 

To serve the needs of more vehicle owners in her community, she is seeking assistance in the amount of 40000 to pay for various engine oils like Delo and Helix. Part of the loan will also pay for ready to wear clothes from wholesalers to sell to her neighbors, friends and relatives. She trusts that you will consider her request as she needs the funds badly to sustain her business and provide for the needs of her children. She thanks KIVA for your noble cause.

Agnes aims to maintain her hardware shop and build a ready to wear clothes store someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for machinery products like various car oils, lubricants, and hose.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor lives in Matag-ob, Leyte with her husband. She has been in the hog raising business for a few years now. 

Eleonor tries her best to earn a living in order to pay for daily expenses. Her business provides the income that she needs without moving. Raising hogs allows her to build a barn near her house.

Eleonor wants to expand her business to generate more income but she needs funds to do it.  She is requesting a loan of PHP5000 to buy feed and piglets to expand her business. With the loan, she will be able to make her business sustainable and productive. Her income will be utilized for a healthy diet, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 50 years old and a responsible mother of 6 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has been running his own butcher business for the past 22 years. Rukhsana's husband needs to purchase buffalo, cows, tools, etc. for his business.  Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. To help her husband, Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With this loan she will help her husband buy this merchandise for the business.  This will help him earn more income, and this income will help him fulfill his family's needs.

Rukhsana is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband grow his butcher business

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррине 32 года Она родилась и проживает с мамой в районе Шахринав. Заррина 5 лет предоставляет услуги портнихи. Ей нравится шить женскую одежду, она с раннего детства наблюдала, как ее мама шьет и кроит национальные платья. Зарринапошла по стопам мамы и тоже стала мастерицей своего дела. Она много времени посвящает своей работе и пополняет семейных бюджет за счет услуги швеи. Для хозяйства и других нужных продуктов Заррина тратят из семейного бюджета.  Заррина замужем и мать двоих детей. Она живет вместе мужем и детьми в районе. Заррина обратилась за кредитом, чтобы поменять швейную машинку. За счет кредита она хочет приобрести новую швейную машинку. Заррине очень нужно Ваша поддержка.
texts.en:
Zarrina is 32 years old.  She was born in the Shahrinav region of Tajikistan and lives there with her mother.  For 5 years, Zarrina has offered her services as a seamstress.  She likes sewing women's clothing.  Starting in early childhood, she would observe her mother sewing and cutting cloth to make Tajikistani dresses.  Zarrina followed in her mother's footsteps and has also become skilled at her trade.  She devotes a lot of time to her work, and bolsters her family's finances from her work as a seamstress.  Zarrina and her family pay for household goods and other items with the money they earn. 

Zarrina is married, and is a mother of two children.  She lives with her husband and children in Shahrinav.  Zarrina has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine as a replacement.  She is very much in need of your support.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad denominada la novia del sol hay símbolos importantes que dan identidad a sus habitantes. El monumento a la bandera, la primer locomotora manejada por una mujer y las caritas sonrientes preservadas desde tiempos prehispánicos son los elementos más representativos de la región. En una de sus colonias se integró un grupo llamado Las Pagadoras el nombre hace referencia a la responsabilidad de sus miembros, ellos son: Juana quien vende cosméticos; Irene y José, abarrotes; Claudia, zapatos y cosméticos; María, lencería y calzado; Sarai, zapatos y Teodora, comida.
   Doña Irene es una mujer orgullosa de su lugar de origen y comparte el valor del trabajo junto con sus compañeros. Es madre de tres hijas y un hijo los cuales estudian y dependen económicamente de ella; por tal motivo decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes con el objetivo de brindarles mayores oportunidades. En un principio sólo vendía frutas y verduras pero con el tiempo implemento productos de la canasta básica además de botanas y dulces.
   Para tener un local en condiciones acondicionó un cuarto dentro de su casa cuya ventana da a la calle, compró anaqueles de fierro y los acomodó de tal manera que la mercancía siempre está a la vista del cliente. Gracias al buen surtido, precios accesibles  y un buen trato al cliente pudo superar los retos que representaban la competencia y la reinversión de productos. Por otro lado, su patio trasero le sirve como huerto pues siembra frijol, chayote, nopales, cilantro, rábanos y pepinos para comercializarlos en su tienda.
   Al igual que con los préstamos anteriores de VF México, éste lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, azúcar, atún, mayonesa, chiles en lata, pan, galletas, jitomate, chile, cebolla, zanahorias para aumentar sus ventas. Las ganancias las emplea para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y reabastecer su tienda. Finalmente comenta, “gracias por confiar nuevamente en nosotros”.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio trasero de Doña Irene quien viste playera color rosa.
texts.en:
In a community called "The Bride of the Sun", there are important symbols that give identity to its inhabitants: the monument to the flag, the first locomotive run by a woman, and the smiley faces preserved from prehistoric times are the most representative of the region. In one of the neighborhoods, a group called Las Pagadores [The Women Who Pay] got together. The name refers to the responsibility of its members. They are: Juana who sells cosmetics; Irene and Jose who sell groceries; Claudia who sells shoes and cosmetics; Mary who sells lingerie and shoes; Sarai who sells shoes; and Teodor who sells food.

Irene is a woman who is proud of where she's from and shares the value of hard work with her peers. She is the mother of three daughters and a son who study and depend on her financially. For this reason she decided to open a grocery store in order to offer them greater opportunities. In the beginning she only sold fruits and vegetables, but with time she added basic food products, in addition to snacks and candy.

In order to have an appropriate venue, she accommodated a room in her house with a window overlooking the street. She bought iron shelves and set them up so that the merchandise is always in the customer's sight. Thanks to her good assortment of products, affordable prices, and good customer service, she has been able to overcome the challenges of competition and investing in restocking products. 

On the other hand, her backyard garden is an orchard for beans, chayote squash, prickly pear, cilantro, radishes and cucumbers to sell in her store. As with previous loans with VF Mexico, this loan will buy rice, beans, oil, soup, sugar, tuna, mayonnaise, canned peppers, bread, crackers, tomatoes, peppers, onions, and carrots in order to increase her sales. 

She will use the profits to help her husband with household expenses and replenish her store. In closing, she says, "Thank you again for your confidence in us."

*The photograph was taken in Irene's backyard; she's the one wearing a pink shirt.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, soup, sugar, tuna, mayonnaise, canned peppers, bread, crackers, tomatoes, peppers, onion, and carrots.

loans.name: Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Para llegar a cierta comunidad oaxaqueña hay que recorrer un camino de terracería mientras de forma amena se puede observar las arboledas, escuchar el canto de las aves, y apreciar la altura de los cerros. Allí se integró el grupo llamado Desarrollo nombre que eligieron pues desean que sus actividades prosperen.
   Los integrantes son: Consuelo quien vende tacos; María, tamales y servicio de molino; Silvia, ropa y Adela, José, Edi y Marcos quienes se dedican a la cría de cerdos.
   Doña Consuelo es una mujer muy amigable, es madre de dos jóvenes quienes aún viven con ella, también tiene una nieta a la cual ella quiere como su propia hija. Tiene una amplia experiencia de 29 años a cargo de una tienda de abarrotes, en un inicio sólo vendía refresco y algunos productos, no obstante comenta que sus clientes le referían “deberías vender más abarrotes, ya que otras tiendas no ofrecen esos productos, ¡anímate!”. Al día de hoy tiene un amplio surtido y brinda una atención especial a sus clientes.
   Los beneficios que ha obtenido le han motivado para iniciar con el servicio de molino, la cría de animales, la venta de tacos y la siembra y venta de caña de azúcar. Todo lo anterior es posible gracias al apoyo que recibe de toda su familia y las oportunidades otorgadas por VF México. 
   En esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo en la compra de carne, tortillas, verdura, chiles y refresco. “Soy la mujer más feliz del mundo, que Dios cuide a cada una de las personas que hacen posible estos beneficios” son palabras expresadas por Doña Consuelo.
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo, la fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol”, Doña consuelo viste blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
To get to this particular community in Oaxaca, one must follow a dirt road. On the way, one can enjoy looking at the woods, listen to the sound of the birds, and appreciate the height of the hills. There, the group Desarrollo was formed, a name they chose because they hope that their activities will prosper. The members are: Consuelo, who sells tacos; Maria, tamales and grinding services; Silvia, clothing; and Adela, Jose, Edi, and Marcos, who work in pig breeding. 
Consuelo is a very friendly woman, the mother of two young children who still live with her. She also has a granddaughter who she loves as her own daughter. She has 29 years of experience being in charge of a grocery store. At the start, she only sold sodas and a few products. However, she says her clients told her: you should sell more groceries, because other stores do not offer these products, come on!” Today, she has a wide stock and provides special attention to her clients. 
The benefits she has received have motivated her to start with the grinding service, animal breeding, taco sales, and farming and selling sugar cane. All the previous things are possible thanks to the help she receives from her family and opportunities given by VF Mexico.
On this occasion, she will invest the loan in the purchase of meat, tortillas, vegetables, chilies, and sodas. “I am the happiest woman in the world, I hope God cares for each of the people who make these benefits possible,” are the words expressed by Consuelo. 
*These are the members of the group. The photograph was taken at the “bride of the sun.” Consuelo wears a pink blouse.

loans.use: to buy meat, tortillas, vegetables, chilies, and sodas.

location.town: Buena Vista, San Miguel Soyaltepec,  Oaxaca

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 61 years old, widowed, and has one child.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread and other snack foods.

Aida has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from dried fish vending.

Aida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family.  Her husband has been running a computer shop for the past 3 years. 

Uzma's husband wants to purchase different types of computer accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Uzma has applied for a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan.  With the help of this loan, she’ll help her husband purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more income to manage his business and household.

Uzma is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband grow his computer business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and three of her children are in school currently.

Arlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell in her stall.

Arlyn has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 53 years old, married with seven children.

Adelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread and other snack foods.

Adelia has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Adelia aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Cila

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Cila works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cila is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Cila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Delfa

texts.en:
Delfa is 59 years old and widowed with four children.

She is in the agricultural and pig fattening business in the Philippines. Delfa is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Delfa has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
Para llegar a una comunidad oaxaqueña rodeada por cerros, cañaverales y árboles de hule, se deben recorrer 15 kilómetros; algunos de pavimento y otros más de terracería. En el camino se puede apreciar el Pico de Orizaba en su máximo esplendor ya que suele estar bordeado por nubes y la luz del sol crea una atmosfera única. 
   En dicha comunidad se integró un grupo llamado Alegría ya que que dicha característica distingue a todos sus integrantes; el grupo lo conforma: Karina quien vende cocteles de fruta; Rufina, tejidos típicos; Andrea, abarrotes, novedades y refresco; Reyna, comida típica; Marcela, pescado; Teresa, abarrotes y Rosa, refrescos y verdura.
   Tere, como es mejor conocida Doña Teresa, ha sido padre y madre ya que ha criado a sus cuatro hijos  ella sola. Su espíritu emprendedor la ha llevado a vender desde pan y pescado hasta pollo fresco dentro de su comunidad. Sin embargo desde hace cuatro años encontró la manera más efectiva de obtener ingresos por medio de una tienda de abarrotes. En un inicio su negocio sólo contaba con una pequeña mesa donde colocaba, arroz, azúcar, sopa, aceite y huevos, es decir, lo más básico. Sin embargo, actualmente su tienda se ubica dentro de un local de madera en el cual ha colocado dos refrigeradores y anaqueles espaciosos donde exhibe su mercancía, “vendo de todo un poco, poco a poquito y de poco en poco” expresa con gran humor. El local abre desde las 8:00 am y cierra hasta las 8:00 pm, en el trascurso de la jornada sus hijos la apoyan en la atención de los clientes.
   Las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido brindar estudios a sus hijos, reabastecer su tienda y realizar en tiempo y forma cada uno de los pagos del préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de galletas, botanas, refrescos, detergente y papel higiénico. 
   Con estas palabras el grupo expresa su sentir respecto al crédito: “gracias a cada una de las personas que creen en nosotros, esto nos ayuda a fortalecer nuestras actividades”.
*La fotografía del grupo fue tomada en la tienda de Doña Tere quien viste falda gris y blusa a rayas color gris con blanco.
texts.en:
To reach a community in Oaxaca surrounded by hills, reedbeds, and rubber trees, one must traverse 15 kilometers, some made of pavement and some dirt tracks. On the way, the Pico de Orizaba can be appreciated in its maximum splendor, as it is usually surrounded by clouds and the light of the sun creates a unique atmosphere. 
In this community, the group named Alegria(Joy) was formed, as this trait characterizes all of its members. The group is made up by: Karina, who sells fruit cocktails; Rufina, traditional fabrics; Andrea, groceries, novelty products, and sodas; Reyna, traditional food; Marcela, fish; Teresa, groceries; and Rosa, sodas and vegetables. 
Tere, who is better known as Teresa, has been both a father and mother, as she raised her four children by herself. Her entrepreneurial spirit has taken her to sell bread and fish, to fresh chicken inside her community. Four years ago, she found the most effective way of obtaining an income through a grocery store. At the beginning, her business only consisted of a small table where she places rice, sugar, soup, oil, and eggs, that is, the most basic products. 
However, currently her store is located inside of a wooden shop in which she has collected two refrigerators and two spacious shelves where she exhibits her merchandise: “I sell a bit of everything, little by little,” she says in a great mood. The shops opens at 8:00 a.m. and closes at 8:00 p.m. Through the course of the day, her children support her with customer service. 
The profits obtained have allowed her to provide for her children’s studies, restock her store, and to meet each of the loan payments on time, which she will invest in the purchase of cookies, snacks, sodas, detergents, and toilet paper.
With these words, the group expresses how they feel about the loan: “thank you to each of the people who believe in us, this helps us to strengthen our occupations.” 
 *The group photograph was taken at Tere’s store, who is wearing a gray skirt, and a gray and white striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy cookies, snacks, sodas, detergent, and toilet paper.

location.town: Localidad Corrales, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa Oaxa

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is 24 years old, married, and has one child who is still in school.

Anie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Anie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Anie has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Anie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 44 years old and married with six children, three of whom are still in school. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread and other snack foods. Emily has been in this business for five years.

Emily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lipstick, eye shadow, eyeliner, foundation, perfume, and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es:
María ve en los créditos la oportunidad de mejorar el negocio, por ello hace la solicitud de más capital para comprar yuca, papas, aceite, harina, etc., para tener materia prima a su disposición y así  preparar la venta de antojitos.
Gracias a su experiencia y a los créditos ha podido mantener la continuidad de su negocio y tiene los ingresos necesarios para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
María sees in the loans the opportunity to improve the business. That's why she is requesting more capital to buy cassava (manioc), potatoes, oil, flour, etc. to have the raw materials available to prepare her snacks for sale.

Thanks to her experience and the loans, she has been able to keep her business going and have the necessary income to honor her commitments.

loans.use: to buy cassava (manioc), potatoes, oil, flour, etc., to have the raw materials available to prepare her snacks for sale.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “amigas por siempre de miguel Grau” conformada por 07 socias con deseos de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es DELIA una de las socias de 50 años de edad separada con 2 hijos. Ella tiene su bodega donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes y bebidas. Desde hace más de 20 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder implementar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de más abarrotes como lentejas arroz y bebidas gaseosas. El grupo “amigas por siempre de miguel Grau” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Delia es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo color negro.
texts.en:
This group is called “Amigas por Siempre (Friends Forever) de Miguel Grau” and is made up of 7 members with the desire to work and improve their quality of life. DELIA is one of the members. She is 50 years old, separated, with 2 children.

She has a convenience store where she sells all kinds of groceries and drinks. She has had the business for more than 20 years.
Her greatest wish is to be able to carry on her business. She requested the loan to buy more groceries, such as lentils, rice and soft drinks.

The "Amigas por Siempre de Miguel Grau” group is thankful to the people in Kiva that made this loan possible, because it allows them to continue improving. Delia is the second from the left wearing a black top.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as lentils, rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Brenda Liz

texts.es:
Brenda, poco a poco está mejorando su negocio con la ayuda del crédito anterior, comenta que ha podido incluir la venta de nuevos productos de la canasta básica, sus ventas e ingresos han incrementado. Su núcleo familiar se mantiene.
Hace la solicitud de más capital para continuar teniendo abastecido su negocio, comprara pan, huevos, pastas, cereales, productos enlatados, etc., podrá cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y así contar con su fidelidad.
texts.en:
Little by little, Brenda is improving her business with the help of her previous loan. She comments that she has been able to include the sale of new basic staple items. Her sales and income have increased, and her family unit is supported.

She is requesting more capital to continue keeping her business stocked up. She will buy bread, eggs, pasta, cereal, canned goods, etc., so she can fulfill her customers’ demands and thereby keep their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, pasta, cereal, canned goods, etc., so she can fulfill her customers' demands and keep their loyalty.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is blessed for knowing Center for Community Transformation (CCT), and she’s thankful for the amount of PHP 25,000 that they approved previously and was provided by the lenders. She was able to buy spare parts for equipment and machines for her buy-and-sell business and the maintenance of her repair shop. She can’t thank you enough for the monetary provision since this made her business earn more.

Corazon is determined to succeed in the business since her son is about to finish college. She aims that her son may find a decent job in the future. With the help of the Lord, she and her family are able to survive their day-to-day expenses. However, Corazon still needs to have additional capital for her business, as there are customers whom she loan products to which affects the business’ earnings.

For this, she decided to apply for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional spare parts for her buy-and-sell business, as she wants to earn more her family.

Corazon believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, and this is where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and supplies for her appliance repair shop

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Andresita works hard to support her family. Andresita is married and has a buy-and-sell live lobster business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of live lobster to sell.

Andresita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Andresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of live lobsters to sell.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn works hard to support her family. Ronelyn is single with two children and has a buy-and-sell beauty-products business in the Philippines.

Ronelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy beauty soap, toner, body lotion, beauty cream and other personal care products.

Ronelyn has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Ronelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty soap, toner, body lotion, beauty cream and other personal care products

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 35 years old and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Emerlyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emerlyn has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a fertilized duck egg making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase dozens of duck eggs to make fertilized duck eggs to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of duck eggs to make fertilized duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Los Soles Group

texts.es:
En la actualidad Oaxaca cuenta con zonas que mantienen rasgos de la cultura mazateca, allí los habitantes conservan tradiciones y costumbres basadas en el respeto y la amabilidad. Uno de los atractivos turísticos de la región es la denominada Laguna de las Mil Islas. El grupo Los Soles proviene de una de dichas comunidades y el nombre fue elegido por lo integrantes debido a que les encantan las puestas de sol. Ellos son: Darién quien vende comida; Isabel, comida y recipientes; Elvia, refresco; Teresa, cosméticos y cría de animales; Araceli, repostería; Alma, zapatos; José, refrescos y pescado.
   El señor Mario es otro de los integrantes del grupo y tiene 10 años a cargo de una carpintería, “toda mi vida he sido carpintero, desde niño ayudaba a mi padre a lijar y barnizar los muebles, después decidí ser mi propio jefe” comentó. Don Mayo, como le conocen sus amistades, construyó un taller en el patio de su hogar en donde ofrece servicio de lunes a domingo de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche. Cabe destacar que da empleo a dos personas más cuando su carga de trabajo es elevada, y no es para menos ya que la calidad de su mercancía y la atención al cliente hablan por sí solas.
   De igual forma lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es diseñar los muebles que después serán realizados detalladamente para materializar su idea. Para Mario la satisfacción de solventar los gastos del hogar por medio de las ganancias obtenidas con base en su pasión es la mejor motivación, “la familia y la madera son el motor de mi vida” expresó con una sonrisa en el rostro.
  El crédito que solicita en esta ocasión le servirá para comprar madera, clavos y pegamento  ya que tiene pedidos próximos. Asimismo Los Soles agradece a VF México y KIVA por el nuevo préstamo que les ofrece, ya que con ellos enriquecen sus actividades.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Don Mario quien viste camisa.
texts.en:
Oaxaca currently has zones that have maintained characteristics of the Mazatec culture. The residents there have preserved traditions and customs based on respect and kindness. One of the popular tourist attractions in the region is the Lake of Mil Islas [Thousand Islands.]  

The Los Soles group [The Suns] comes from one of the said regions, and the name was chosen by the members because they love sunsets. The members are: Darién who sells food; Isabel, food and containers; Elvia, drinks; Teresa, cosmetics and raising animals; Araceli, pastries; Alma, shoes; and José, drinks and fishing.  

Mario is another one of the group members and has been in charge of a carpentry business for 10 years. He explained, “All of my life I have been a carpenter. Since I was a young boy, I was helping my father sand and refinish furniture. Later, I decided to be my own boss.”

Don Mayo, as he is known among friends, built a workshop in the courtyard of his home where he offers services Monday through Sunday from 8:00 AM in the morning until 8:00 PM at night. Note that he employs two people when his workload is high, and it is no wonder as his quality of work and customer service speak for themselves.

What he likes most about his work is designing the furniture that will later be made in detail to materialize his ideas. For Mario, the satisfaction of meeting the household expenses through an income earned from his passion is the best motivation. “My family and wood are the driving force in my life,” he added with a smile on his face.

The loan he is asking for this round will help him purchase wood, nails and glue — as he has future orders. The Suns group is also grateful to VF México and Kiva for the new loan they have been offered because they have enriched their businesses.

*The photo was taken at the home of Mario who is wearing a shirt.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and glue.

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.ru: Сарвар добродушная женщина в возрасте 50 лет. Каждый год она выращивает разные овощи и когда они созревают продаёт их и этим кормит свою семью. А когда то она жила в полном достатке вместе с мужем и они растили своего единственного сыночка.  Сарвар три года назад стала вдовой.  Она осталась одна вместе с сыном и внуками. Когда её муж умер ей было очень тяжело содержать семью, но теперь её сын вырос и хочет поехать в Россию и заработать денежные средства,  чтобы как то помочь маме и улучшить жизнь своих детишек. Для этого ему понадобились деньги и его мама решила получить кредит. Сарвар обратилась в Арванд за кредитом, она хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить билет сыну. Она заранее благодарна за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Sarvar is a kind, 50-year-old woman. She grows various vegetables every year and sells them when they ripen, and this is how she supports her family. And at some point in time she used to live in plenitude with her husband, and they were raising their only son. Sarvar became a widow three years ago. She was left alone with her son and grandchildren. When her husband passed away, it was very difficult for her to support the family, but now her son has grown up and wants to go to Russia to earn a living in order to help his mother and improve the lives of his children. This is why he needed money, and his mother decided to obtain a loan. Sarvar came to Arvand to obtain a loan in order to buy an airline ticket for her son. She is grateful for the support in advance!!!

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket for her son to travel to Russia for work

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is an amazing mother who lives in a small village near Hebron. She has four children and is working hard to ensure a good life for them and ensure that they do not need anything.

Fadwa's husband works as an employee, but he would not cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can, and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Fadwa started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore, she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarn and fabrics to increase her income.
She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and yarn and fabrics to increase her income.

loans.name: Ayaash

texts.en:
Ayaash is a 23-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ayaash took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Abdl-Rahman

texts.en:
Abdl-Rahman is a 25-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Abdl took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Femmes Catholiques Cap Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de huit membres qui s'activent dans le commerce et elles remboursent leurs prêts avec succès. madame Philomène qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 44 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de cinq années. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité des sacs d'oignons, de carottes de patates et et de maniocs. Elle très dynamique dans son domaine d'activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille et à épargner.
texts.en:
This group is composed of eight members who all have businesses and successfully repay their loans. Philomène, on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative.
She is married, 44 years old and the mother of four children - two of whom are girls. She has sold vegetables for over five years. With this loan request, she plans to buy sacks of onions, carrots, potatoes and yams. She is very dynamic in her business.
The profits will help her husband with the family's living costs, and also provide some savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old, married and has four children. 

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her vegetables.

Gloria has been farming vegetables for 10 years now and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her vegetables

loans.name: Mechill

texts.en:
Mechill works hard to support her family. Mechill is married and has a farming vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Mechill would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support her family. Pacita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Pacita has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Pacita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business
